Flurry and Google Analytics, Facebook and Twitter4j, and a boat-load of permissions, including Read Phone State and Identity, Modify/Delete SD Card Contents, and Full Internet Access.The only mystery in this app is why anyone would pay $3 for it.

Fruit Fling is your fairly basic match-X type game.  When you make a match, the fruit disappears and the rest of the fruit fills in the hole.  Bombs explode after a couple seconds and fruit bats can be shot at for bonus points.  Hit a rain cloud and the fruit appears faster, while shooting an ice cube slows things down.  Once it stops raining, the ground will begin rising; if the fruit reaches the top of the screen, the game ends.  You start out having to match just three of a kind, but this increases as the levels get harder.There are three game modes, Arcade, which has just one level and you have to match four of a kind, Classic with 24 levels, and Custom that lets you adjust the number of fruit needed to make a match, the frequency that bonus items appear, ground speed, stickiness and other parameters.The game sometimes didn't register two fruits as touching, which lead to lost combos and lower scores.  The game also has a real bad habit of giving you one more of a fruit type that you just eliminated.This app contains modules from OpenFeint, Flurry, Papaya Social, AdKnowledge, InMobi, and Inneractive, HOWEVER, the app lacks any sort of Internet permissions, which means these modules are COMPLETELY INERT.  These modules are likely part of the Corona developer toolkit, which tends to throw in everything but the kitchen sink.  As long as the app lacks Internet access, this is merely a waste of space.

This app is supposed to be a pocket guide for gardeners.  It features flashcards, a quiz and a glossary as well as a news feed.This might be a decent quiz app, except the multiple-choice answers to the questions are so utterly obvious.  Even if you don't know the answer, you can figure it out because the other two answers are stupidly impossible.  For instance, the question "This is a garden with a large collection of trees and shrubs" has the possible answers "Tuber", "Alternate Host", and "Arboretum".  Really?The glossary is just row after row of definitions, no illustrations or other insight.The "news" button does nothing but point your web browser to Google.On my Motorola Xoom tablet, there is vast amounts of wasted space.  Most of the quiz questions and flashcards take up 1/4 to 1/2 of the screen.Some of the images were missing and replaced with a ? symbol.  Was this app even tested?This app offers absolutely nothing that might actually benefit a gardener such planting time tables, weed or insect identification, weather charts, soil amendments, or anything else.  A copy of the Farmer's Almanac would be infinitely more useful.

Cross Fingers is a tangram-style puzzle game.  You have to slide pieces around the game board so that they fit together to form a shape.  Most pieces stay where you put them, but the red ones will move back so you have to hold them in place with a finger.The pieces didn't track my finger very well; on the more complex puzzles this frequently caused other pieces to be knocked out of place. -1 star for this.When you open the app, you are immediately slapped in the face with a full-screen advertisement for a bunch of different games.  There were so many game ads, you actually have to scroll down to view them all!  At the bottom of the screen is a small button you have to press to open the game.  This comes up EVERY SINGLE TIME you start the game!  Even free apps aren't usually this obnoxious with their ads.  -3 stars for this.The game also has an absurd number of permissions, the most worrisome of which are Full Internet Access, Modify/Delete SD Card Contents, and Read Phone State and Identity.  The game doesn't need any of this, and a malicious app with these permissions could be used to collect information from you or even steal files from your SD card such as photographs or documents.  -2 stars for this.

In Noogra Nuts, you play a hungry squirrel who can bash open nuts with his head.  You tilt your device left and right to move and tap the screen to jump.  Bash a shell enough times and it will split open, then you can feast on the tasty nut inside.There are three game modes.  Classic gives you 2 minutes to crack as many nuts as possible.  Jungle adds some obstacles such as rolling boulders that will end the game instantly.  Survival gives you unlimited time, but you have only 3 hit points and must dodge falling rocks and tumbleweeds.  As you play you earn Noogra Coins which you can use to purchase hats, some of which grant special abilities.The game works well on my Motorola Xoom.  The animation and controls are smooth and fluid.  The squirrel character is cute, especially when his head gets distorted while smashing a nut.Unfortunately, the game comes with a double whammy of OpenFeint and Flurry Analytics.  It also uses Modify/Delete SD Card Contents, Full Internet Access, and Read Phone State and Identity permissions.  The ability to access the SD card combined with Internet access always rings alarm bells.  With this combo, a malicious application could upload your documents or photos, which, if geotagged, could also provide someone with your exact location.The author's name isn't even listed on Amazon, it's just "Developer", which helps to make this app sound all the more suspicious.

Front Runner is a vertical scrolling space shooter with a cartoony style.  Shoot enough enemies and they will drop musical notes.  Collect the notes and you can purchase upgrades to your ship at the end of the stage.  You start out with just a basic gun, which can be upgraded to shoot sideways and backwards; after defeating a boss you can acquire their weapons such as homing missiles or lightning bolts.  Complete Story Mode to unlock Survival Mode.The game is fairly challenging, particularly the boss fights, but it's not too difficult.  I died while fighting the first boss, but the game let me keep all the notes I'd collected to that point in the stage, so I was able to buy some armor upgrades and try again.The game has no In-App Purchasing, nor OpenFeint, Flurry or any other evil tracking modules.  Alas, it does call on the Full Internet Access and Send Sticky Broadcast permissions.  (Sticky broadcasts means the app can load information into memory where it remains available to every other app until the app removes it or the device is rebooted.  This wastes memory and is a potential security hole.)  The app also constantly displays ads for other games between levels and before starting.Five star app, minus 1 star for bad permissions and minus 1 for the annoying ads.

Gunship II is a Vietnam War era combat flight simulator.  The game currently offers 5 missions, with the developer claiming several more are coming soon.  The first mission is to transport a load of cargo from a carrier to a land base using an H-34 Choctaw.  Then you have to take photos of a couple suspicious villages using an H-13 Sioux.  The third mission is to rescue a pilot trapped behind enemy lines using a UH-1D Huey.  This is followed by an air patrol in a UH-1B Huey Gunship.  The final mission involves another observation helo drawing enemy fire so your AH-1 Cobra can target them.  Future missions will supposedly involve the F-4 Phantom II, T-28 Trojan, A-37 Dragonfly, CH-47 Chinook, OH-6 Cayuse and two enemy aircraft, the MiG-15 and MiG-21.The controls are fairly simple, you slide the control on the left up and down to adjust the throttle (and thus increase or decrease altitude), while the control on the bottom right works the rudder.  You move forward, backwards and sideways by tilting your device.  The camera button lets you switch between interior and exterior cameras, and you can look around by swiping on the screen.  If your aircraft has guns or a camera, the appropriate fire buttons will appear in the lower right corner.  The red bar along the top is your aircraft health.Some people have complained about a lack of instructions, but they are provided for you IF you follow the designated flight path.  Just fly through the red arrows and all will be explained.The graphics are pretty good, and the developer did a great job on the rotor motion effects.My primary complaint about the game is that there are no instruments, particularly an altimeter.  It is sometimes difficult to figure out how high you are above the ground.  An airspeed indicator and vertical speed indicator would be handy too.I think there is a glitch in the second mission.  It kept complaining I was too far away while taking the photos, even when I landed right in the middle of the area where I was supposed to take pictures!  Do they want me to get out and take portraits of the soldiers or something?  Say pho mÃ¡t!The game works well on my Motorola Xoom, however many of the buttons in the game are black with no labels at all.  This isn't a problem when there is only one button, such as at the end of a mission, but pressing the pause button brings up four blank buttons.  If you have this problem, the pause menu buttons are apparently "resume", "restart", "calibrate" and "return to menu".The app is free of In-App Purchasing, nor does it have OpenFeint, Flurry, or any other secret data miners.  The only permissions it calls on are harmless: accessing the vibrator and keeping the screen from dimming.  Excellent!Five star app, minus 1 star for the glitches and 1 for the lack of instruments.  If these are fixed, I will adjust my rating accordingly.

Word to Word is a word association puzzle game. You are given two columns of words and you have to match together words that are related; they can be synonyms (hot-warm), antonyms (hot-cold), compound words (hot-dog) or merely related in some way (hot-summer). Higher levels will have multiple possible matches for some words, making the game much trickier. The game comes with 440 puzzles.This game is a lot of fun and is actually pretty challenging, especially on the later puzzles. It's also one of the more unique games I've seen so far.The game works great on my Motorola Xoom tablet.The best part of this app is that there is absolutely no villainy on the part of the developer. No In-App Purchasing. No OpenFeint, Flurry or other data miners. No permissions of any kind! It's also a relatively small app, at 3.3 MB. And it only costs 99 cents! This is the way to write an app!

Ion Racer is a high-speed twitch-reflex racing game.  Collect ion orbs for energy and smash through the blue barriers for points, but don't hit the red ones, they will damage your shields.  Hit a red barrier without any shields left and the race is over.Controls in the game were terrible.  Several times the game stopped responding to my inputs and I just smashed through whatever was in front of me, unable to move.The missions require you to exceed a certain speed or collect a given number of ions, but there is no speedometer or other indication of how far you have progressed within the mission until the game ends.This is another of those games that make it difficult to progress without resorting to In-App Purchasing.  The upgrades and perks cost so much and you get coins so slowly that even the second mission is impossible to pass without upgrades.  Completing missions is the only way, other than spending cash, to obtain a decent number of coins.This app contains a module from the advertiser MoPub, though it does not display ads.  It does, however, have some rather excessive permissions, calling on the Course (Network-based) Location, Modify/Delete SD Card Contents, View Network State and Full Internet Access permissions.  At least it's only course location and not fine (GPS).1 star for buggy controls, IAP and excessive permissions.

This app is one of the best references I've ever seen for tying knots.  There is a quick animation for each type of knot, and you can rotate the image 360 degrees so you can get a good look at it.  The app also describes the uses for each knot and its advantages and disadvantages.  It covers just about every knot you could ever need to tie, though disappointingly, it leaves out necktie knots entirely.It works great on my Motorola Xoom tablet (though only in portrait mode) and my HTC Evo LTE.EDIT:  When I originally wrote this review, the app was loaded with spyware such as OpenFeint and Flurry and a ton of permissions.  Since then, the developer has listened to the reviews and removed all that junk.  The new version of this app has no permissions and no spyware!This is a 5-star app and a definite must-purchase for anyone who goes camping, fishing, sailing or climbing, or anyone who just wants to learn to tie a proper knot.

Word Shaker is your typical Boggle-type game with a small twist, you can shake your device to scramble the letters if you're having trouble finding anything.  You can play with the basic 4x4 board or up to a monstrous 8x8 board, and you can choose a time limit from 1 to 10 minutes or infinite.Overall the game is quite fun.  I like having the option to select an unlimited amount of time so I can try to find the really big words.  I did have an occasional frustrating issue where the game wouldn't quite track my finger correctly, wasting precious seconds during a time limited game; this was particularly bad on my HTC Evo LTE.  -1 star for this.The text-to-speech function doesn't work on the Motorola Xoom with ICS.  Selecting it just brings up a menu to install foreign language packs; even if you select all three it still won't work.  (Text-to-speech works fine in other apps.)This app calls on the Control Vibrator, View Network State and Full Internet Access permissions.  It contains modules from Madvertise and Flurry Analytics.  -1 star for this.

This app is a trivia game in which you have to identify lyrics from 80's music.  You earn points for each song you get correct, but make 3 mistakes and it's game over.  As you play, you can unlock trivia tidbits about various songs and musicians.The game claims to have over 300 songs, so it should have pretty good replayability.  It covers a wide range of artists from Michael Jackson to Men Without Hats.The buttons are a bit small on my Motorola Xoom tablet, but the game is still playable.  The graphics and sound effects are reminiscent of an old-school arcade game.This app calls on the modify/delete SD card contents, full Internet access and view network state permissions.  Scanning it with Addons Detector shows it to have just a single addon, the Amazon Licensing module required of all Amazon-distributed apps.

In the year 4122, genetic experiments have brought dinosaurs back from extinction and given them intelligence. One of these intelligent creatures, called nanosaurs, was sent back 65 million years into the past to recover eggs. Upon returning to the future, however, a group of rebels stole all but one of the eggs and took them to other planets in hopes of raising an army. The sole remaining egg hatched into a pteranodon. Equipped with a jetback, it is sent through a wormhole to retrieve the stolen eggs.Nanosaur 2 is a fairly unique flight game. You control your motion by tilting your device. The blue button in the left corner is your jetback booster, the red button in the lower right fires your weapon. The green button next to it switches weapons. You start out with a blaster with 20 shots and a sonic scream which has infinite ammo and can be charged by holding the fire button. You can acquire additional ammo and new weapons, including heat-seeking missiles, fragmentation grenades and bombs, by flying through green powerups.Across the top of the screen you have a map, the number of eggs you need to collect, how many lives you have remaining (you start with 3), then your health, shield and fuel status. These three can be restored by flying through the red, purple and blue powerups, respectively; additional lives can be obtained by with the yellow powerups. Below the map is the calibrate button which you can press if your controls start acting up.The objective of the game is to fly low and grab the eggs (which will be done automatically when you get close enough), then carry them to one of the waiting wormholes where they will be sent back to Earth. If you get hit, you will drop your egg and you'll have to pick it up again. Collect all the eggs on the planet, and the wormhole will change color. Fly into it to travel to the next world. You can only save your game after completing a world.Game play is excellent and the controls are intuitive. The graphics look incredible and the game runs quite smoothly on my Motorola Xoom.My sole complaint is that there is no training mission or tutorial, you just get thrown right into the action. I died in less than 5 seconds the first time I played because I had no idea what I was doing. There is a very detailed help file, but that doesn't really make up for a lack of tutorial.The application is fairly large, over 55 MB, but it is quite a lot of game. It calls on just a single permission, Control Vibrator. Pay attention, developers, this is the way to write an app!

This app is exactly what it calls itself, a jigsaw puzzle.  The game has over 150 different images and you can create puzzles with your own pictures.  There is also a challenge mode which blacks out some of the squares; the hidden areas are revealed every 5 seconds.The game has a fairly large number of options.  You can choose between square or rectangular puzzles and you have the option of plain or the more traditional jigsaw-shaped pieces.  To make the game easier, you can lock matched pieces together, snap pieces to the game board, or have a faint guide image behind the board.  Each puzzle has eight difficulty levels (five on a phone), ranging from 9 pieces up to 100 (49 on a phone).I encountered a few minor issues when moving pieces.  Sometimes they didn't track my finger properly, and if you had snap pieces to game board turned off and lock pieces together turned on, it was difficult to get the game to recognize the puzzle was finished unless you lined it up on the game board just right, even though all the pieces were stuck together.I ran this app through Addons Detector and it has only two add on modules, Amazon Licensing, which is to be expected of an app coming from Amazon, and Application Crash Report for Android (ACRA).  The latter is probably the reason the app requires Internet permissions.Ultimate Jigsaw Puzzle HD has more puzzles and more options than Spectrum Puzzles, and it handles a large screen tablet better, but the latter has fewer frustrations when moving pieces around and also allows rotation of pieces, making for a much more challenging game.  Spectrum is $1 cheaper, but adding the two image packs to give it the same number of images makes it cost $1 more.  Personally I'd choose Spectrum Puzzles over this app, but only by a fairly slim margin.

The object of Juminja is to shoot colored balls to match 3 or more ninja balls that are marching down a path.  If the balls reach their destination, you lose a life; clear them all to move to the next level.This game is very similar to a previous Free App of the Day, Bonsai Blast, except that the latter is actually well written and enjoyable.The interface for this game is very haphazard and in many cases downright broken.  The OpenFeint button is right on top of the exit button, making it impossible to press exit without launching OF.  The icon that tells you what color ball is next sits atop the icon showing how many lives you have left.  The Menu button doesn't work unless you press it in just the right spot; it typically took me about a dozen attempts to find that spot.  The help text was off-center and ran off the edge of the sign.  Bonus symbols would sometimes float around on their own.Accuracy leaves much to be desired.  I frequently had balls simply shoot off the screen or attach themselves to the wrong place.  I lost the very first level because of this.The game has OpenFeint AND In-App Purchasing.  The latter appears to be only used to unlock all the levels, which is far less odious than some of the games we've seen recently.And the biggest insult of all is that the game isn't even the least bit fun.  I enjoyed Bonsai Blast, but I got to only the second level of Juminja before quitting in disgust.1 star for a terrible game, then minus stars for OF, IAP, and sloppy programming, giving this app a score of negative a whole bunch.  Bleah.EDIT:  After reading a number of other reviewers complaining about ads in the app, I decided to reinstall it and run it through Addons Detector.  What it returned absolutely shocked me.  This game contains modules from AdMob, GreyStripe, InMobi, JumpTap, Millenial, MoPub, Nexage, PontiFlex, Smaato and AirPush advertisers, as well as Flurry, OpenFeint, AndEngine, Facebook and Twitter4j.  This is more junkware than ANY OTHER APP I currently have installed on my tablet!  TEN different advertising modules!  This would be unacceptable in a FREE app, let alone one you have to pay for!  I uploaded a screenshot of the results to Amazon.

Concentrate is your basic Memory-type game using a standard 52-card deck of playing cards.  There is only one mode and only one difficulty setting.The first time I attempted to run the app on my Motorola Xoom, I got a blank screen for about 30 seconds, followed by a force close.  The app loaded successfully on the second attempt.  The game was frequently slow to respond to my screen taps and the card flip animations were often rather jerky.On my HTC Evo LTE, the app loaded correctly, though slowly, but also suffered from occasional slow response.The cards were fairly hard to read on my 4.7 inch phone, I can't imagine trying to play this on a compact phone.  The cards were quite legible on my 10 inch tablet.The app is relatively small, 1.27 MB, and while it does have Modify/Delete SD Card Contents, it does not have Internet Access or any other worrisome permissions.I give this app 3 stars, an average score, for being a perfectly average game.

In Meowch!, you play a runaway cat, trying to escape the clutches of a crazy cat lady.  You leap about window ledges and light fixtures, bounce off satellite dishes, climb hanging vines and slide down gutters, avoiding power lines and Animal Control, while collecting "missing cat" posters and trying to reach a safe hiding place on the ground.At first I thought this was just an Angry Birds clone, drag your finger to launch the cat, but the second level changed that pretty quick.  You have to make multiple jumps per level, and sometimes you have to make your next leap in a hurry before you are grabbed by the cat lady.I found the cat lady to be the most difficult of the obstacles in the game; if you land on a lit window, you have only a second or two to make another jump before she grabs you and yanks you inside!  Oh noes!There is a time limit to each level, but it's about 3 minutes, and you can add another 1 minute and 40 seconds for each poster you nab, for a maximum of 8 minutes.  You shouldn't need anywhere near that much time.I love the graphics in this game, particularly some of the cat animations.  The game is fairly challenging (it took over a dozen tries to get all three posters on level 1-3), yet fairly forgiving at the same time (you'll stick to a ledge even if your landing isn't perfect).The app works perfectly and looks great on my Motorola Xoom LTE.

In Rope Rescue, you have to save your fellow birds by dragging a rope around a number of pulleys, avoiding knives, fire and other obstacles, and connecting to a hook on a cage.  The shorter the length of rope, the more points and the more feathers you are awarded.  Occasionally, you'll have the opportunity to release a butterfly.  These are used to unlock a level or obtain a hint or extra time.  You can also get a butterfly for every 25 feathers, or buy them with real money using In-App Purchasing.Originally I wasn't going to dock this game because the IAP didn't appear to be too necessary, but then I did some counting.  You can only obtain a maximum of 30 butterflies in the game: 3 you start with, 10 if you get at least 250 of the 252 available feathers, and 17 if you can release all the butterflies in each level.  It takes 30 butterflies to unlock the Infinity Hall world, which means you have to complete nearly every single level with a perfect score AND you cannot use any butterflies anywhere else in the game, otherwise, you'll only be able to play the final level by paying cash for it.[EDIT:  My bad, there are 31 butterflies available in the game, I missed one while counting the releasable butterflies (18, not 17).  But this still is an awfully slim margin, you either can use one hint and then have to complete nearly every level with a perfect score, or you can play without hints and can afford to miss an average of just 4-1/2 feathers per world.  Use two hints and you will HAVE to pay if you want to unlock the final world.]I feel this takes the app out of the realm of acceptable IAP and drops it squarely into evil.  At $2.99, the app is already pushing the boundaries of price, adding a virtually required IAP is just a slap in the face to the consumer.

I bought a bar of this shave soap back in the early part of December and I'm STILL using the same bar in July!  I love the smell and the lather seems pretty good (I just started using a shaving brush 7 months ago and this is the first and only shave bar I've used so far).  I think I get a much better shave with this than I ever got with canned foam; I can even shave against the grain without any irritation or razor burn, something I could never do before.

In Space Station: Frontier, you are in command of a mining station.  You build out a power network and connect mining drones, power generators and weapons, while trying to defend the power grid and station against incoming fighters, destroyers and battleships.This is a 5 star game.  The graphics are great, it has a good story line, and the gameplay is excellent.  Unfortunately, it is completely ruined by In-App Purchasing.  The developer has chosen to make it impossible to proceed in the campaign mode until you have purchased upgrades.  You can spend real cash to get the upgrades, or grind for hours to earn enough credits.After the third level, the game advises you to play endless mode to earn more credits and upgrade your station before continuing in campaign mode.  I played for 15 minutes before I got bored and let the enemy win, and in all that time I'd managed to accumulate just 120 credits.  Let's see what that would buy....  The Missile Launcher is 300 credits, so I'd need to play for at least another 20 minutes before I could buy that.  The Interceptor Laser is 150 credits, so I can't buy that one yet either.  A Rail Cannon is 500 points, that's probably around 45 minutes more play.  Power Generator, 300 credits, Power Storage is 150, Repair Stations, 400.  Proton Torpedoes cost a whopping 2000 credits, that's well over 4 hours of mind-numbing play to earn those.  And there are other station upgrades that speed up your energy recharge or capacity, health, and other stats; all of these have 2 to 20 levels each.To upgrade everything requires just shy of 15,000 credits.  At about 120 credits for 15 minutes of "endless" play, it would require over 31 hours to earn enough to fully upgrade the station.  And it is very difficult to complete the campaign mode without all the upgrades.In-App Purchasing in a paid game is bad enough, but when the developer makes it nearly impossible to finish the game without spending more money, it's just downright greedy.The app used to have OpenFeint, but it was allegedly removed.  It still has Full Internet Access and Modify/Delete SD Card Contents permissions, however.5 stars, minus 1 star for questionable permissions, minus infinity stars for blatantly evil use of IAP.

This app is all the fun of slot car racing, without having to mess around with those plastic tracks that never seem to fit together right.  The game comes with 18 tracks, you can make your own, and you can download others from the community.  You can upgrade your slot car with new tires, motor, frame or body.Control is pretty simple, just slide your finger along the throttle to adjust your speed.  It's not quite as realistic as a pistol-grip, but a bit easier to fine tune.  Unfortunately, the controls are rather badly broken.  Many times per track, the car would just stop and the throttle slider would drop to zero as if I'd taken my finger off the screen.  I ended up losing several races because of this.This game has In-App Purchasing.  Upgrading your virtual toy car requires spending coins, 665,000 if you want to fully trick out your ride.  At 3,100 points maximum per race, that would require coming in first 215 times!  It doesn't tell you how much it costs to buy those points until you actually try to purchase them.The second time I started the app, a popup window tried to sell me a fully tricked out vehicle, the Amazing Capone.  You can only get this vehicle if you spend real money, you can't obtain it through playing the game.  It doesn't say how much this car will cost (I have IAP disabled, so it won't tell me).I like that the app has a track editor.  You can create your own racing masterpiece, then upload it for others to play.  Some of the tracks available from the community look absolutely insane, including one where you end up racing way up in the sky.  This is probably the best part of the game.This could be a 5 star app, but I'm docking 1 star for In-App Purchasing, another for pushing an IAP-only vehicle whenever I start the game, and a third for broken controls, and I'm awarding an extra star for the track editor and ability to download other people's track designs, for a total of 3 stars.

This game is a first-person dungeon crawler with a cheese theme.  Your enemies are genetically modified dairy products and accoutrements, such as cheese slices with fangs or evil crackers.  You pick up various items as you explore the dungeon, like a cheese knife to use as a weapon, or a paper plate for a shield.The game starts out with you wandering about a dungeon.  Upon encountering an enemy, the game switches to combat mode.  When an enemy is vulnerable, cross-hairs appear and you can swipe across them to attack.  When it tries to attack you, you can defend by pressing the shield button or attempt to parry by swiping across the screen at the right moment.  You can also distract an enemy by tossing a cracker at them.  If the battle gets to be too much, you can tap the button at the center bottom of the screen to run away.There are several mini-games you have to solve to proceed.  So far, I've found a Memory-type game, a Tower of Hanoi puzzle, and a Simon-like game.The graphics are somewhat old-school, but not bad.  The dairy-based monsters are a bit amusing.Unfortunately, the controls stink like three month old Limburger.  You move about the dungeon by endlessly swiping up, left or right.  Combat is particularly annoying because the defensive moves such as raising your shield are terribly slow, if they work at all.  I've died 28 times so far; luckily, you get infinite lives on the Casual difficulty setting.The game kind of grows on you, like mold on a wedge of Cheddar.  Like every other dungeon crawler I've played, it's hard to quit, you want to explore just a bit further to see what you can find.  Just a little more...  just a little more...  and then you realize you've been playing for over an hour.5 stars for the app, minus 1 for the slow combat controls.

This app has some interesting features, like the ability to record various body measurements including biceps and thighs, in addition to the usual weight and waist.  You can even record the growth of your "baby bump".Unfortunately, there are also a number of issues.  The first problem that has put a number of people off this app is that once you input your name, age and sex, it doesn't appear to let you do anything.  You have to press the small button in the upper left that looks like a scale with feet.  That is apparently the home button.  It would be nice if there were something pointing this out, as it has no label.The app defaults to measuring your height in feet and inches, but your weight in kilograms, an odd combination.  The units can only be changed by going into Manage Users and selecting Edit User.  This has to be done for each person who uses the app.On my tablet, everything is small and there is a ton of wasted space.  The calendar, for instance, only takes up little more than 1/2 the screen.While the app does have the ability to export to a file, it lacks a cloud synchronization feature.  I'd like to have this app on my tablet and phone and keep them synced.

This app is a fairly typical hidden-object game.  There isn't really much too distinguish it from the 90 or so other HO-type games currently available on Amazon.  It has a good story line, and the graphics are good enough, though occasionally a bit blurry on my Xoom tablet.It's a bit confusing when your character keeps saying she needs to find one particular item, like a doll or a watch, but then you start searching for a dozen things that aren't that one item.I would have given this game 5 stars, but I'm docking one because it keeps bugging me to log into Facebook or rate the app.

This app tries to be a series of puzzles, but what it succeeds at is being annoying.  Many of the puzzles have no instructions, so you have to try to guess at what it wants you to do.  There are also at least a few "trick question" puzzles.Worst of all, however, is the controls are completely broken.  Objects don't follow your finger correctly, and there is at least one maze level that is extremely hard to finish because of this.Often, if you make a mistake, the game forces you to start over several puzzles previous.  Since the puzzles are all exactly the same each time, it can become annoying have to hit the same items repeatedly just to get back to where you were.If you're thinking of buying a puzzle game, just keep walking.  If you pay money for this app, you've already failed the test.

The game of MASH has been around for ages; I can remember playing this when I was a kid. Of course, we had to use paper back in the Middle Ages. Now you can play on your phone or tablet.In the basic version, you enter various locations, jobs, vehicles, colors, names, numbers, and animals--you can type your entries or use the randomize button to have them entered for you--and it will come up with a prediction about your future, such as, "Once you graduate, you'll find work in Portland, Oregon as a Veterinarian. You'll get around town in your burgundy scooter. You'll marry Alexis and live in a Mansion with your 44 kids and ever-loyal pet pony."The paid "Elite" version of MASH lets you download additional stories; there are currently 18 available. These include games such as Superhero, Championship Football Game, Rumors and Dear Diary.This app is not optimized for tablets; on my Xoom it only runs in portrait mode and the buttons are very small. It looks much better on my Evo LTE.Overall it's a cute little app, loads of fun for kids, or nostalgic adults who remember playing this in their youth. I'd give it 5 stars, but I'm currently docking one for poor tablet support.

Router Aqua is the sequel to park3mobile's excellent puzzle game Router.  It's quite simple, draw lines connecting the dots.  If you can make the shortest possible routes, you get five stars and a Star Point.  Hints are available at the cost of five star points.Unfortunately, the developer has succumbed to the Dark Side and added In-App Purchasing to a paid game.  In this case, it's to purchase Star Points, which are needed for hints.  It costs $1 to purchase 30 points, which is 6 hints, or $5 for 200 points/40 hints.  Luckily the game isn't that hard, and you accumulate enough points for another hint for every five puzzles you complete with a perfect score; you also start with 10 free points.  I got to level 89 in the original Router and had accumulated 99 Star Points.5 stars, minus 2 stars for in-app purchasing in a paid game.

This app is one of the most basic Sudoku apps I've ever seen. The interface is primitive and it lacks features found in many other Sudoku games.The graphics are unimpressive and amateurish. The app forces the operating system to run in portrait mode on my tablet, placing the system buttons and menus on the side of the screen, even though the app itself is reluctantly capable of displaying in landscape. There is a large amount of wasted space on the edges, and the background image falls short of covering the whole screen. When I pressed the Menu button, I got a dialog box full of gibberish. Even the icon looks boring.This app does not appear to have any way of entering pencil marks. It will fill in some marks if you press the Crib button, however it still leaves many of the spaces blank, making this feature nearly useless. Besides, I'd rather do the work myself.There is a large button labeled Solve which will start filling in the answers if you press it. Since it's right next to the numbers, and above the Undo button, I imagine it would be quite easy to hit it accidentally. It doesn't ask if you are sure you want it solved for you, it just starts doing it the instant you press it.Pressing the back button on your device exits the game rather than taking you back to the menu.The game has only 3 difficulty levels, the fewest I've seen of any Sudoku game except the ones they print in the newspaper.The permissions this app asks for are questionable. Why does it require read phone state and identity, view network state, and full Internet access? I can't find any features in this game that would require the Internet.3 stars for mediocre design, then -3 for no pencil marks, -2 for questionable permissions, -1 for having only three difficulty levels, and -1 for poor tablet interface. Inability to enter pencil marks is an absolute deal breaker for me.I'd HIGHLY recommend Sudoku 4ever Plus or Enjoy Sudoku over this app. The former has several interesting Sudoku board variants and multiple markup systems, the latter has an excellent tutorial if you're new to the game or want to learn some advanced solving techniques.

This is an educational app intended for very young children.  The name of an animal is spoken and you press the appropriate image.  There are two modes, Tik Tok, which has a time limit, and Play All Day, which continues indefinitely.  Tik Tok has three difficulty levels, Play All Day adjusts automatically.  If you take too long, the game will bounce the correct choice up and down; the hint delay is adjustable from 5 to 15 seconds or it can be disabled.I was surprised at how many animals this game has.  It displayed about 60 different creatures before it began repeating and there are at least 75 unique animals total.  Each one has an amusing illustration.The only problem I could find with the app is if you touch the animal too quickly, the game sometimes gives the 'wrong answer' response.  If your child is quick, this could become confusing.This game requires no permissions!  Kudos to the developer!

First off, this paid app contains in-app purchasing.  It's 99 cents if you want to unlock all levels, or 99 cents to buy a "Golden Tofu" to skip a level.  These prices are not shown unless you actually press the purchase button.  It also doesn't say if the Golden Tofu is a one-shot item, or if the purchase is good for multiple levels.  At least the in-app purchases with this game are good for all devices on the account and aren't lost if the game is reinstalled, unlike many other games.Some of the levels appear to be deliberately designed to be impossible (or at least extremely difficult) to finish.  For instance, I tried playing level 3 a couple dozen times and was never able to complete it in the required three moves.  I'm not sure it's even possible.Most of the levels have to be played at least twice to achieve all the objectives.  Level 3, for instance, requires eight moves to collect all the Chi, way more than the three moves required to complete the limited moves objective.The controls are very imprecise.  Some of the levels require a fair amount of accuracy, which just isn't possible to achieve.  On many levels you have to aim at a point that's off the screen; you can scroll to see where you're going, but you can't launch from there.  Make a single mistake and you have to start the level over again.The game is extremely slow moving.  It takes almost 20 seconds from the time you finish a level until you can begin playing the next.  If you complete all 150 levels in one pass each, that's 50 minutes of wasted time!  You can't skip the animations at the beginning and end of a level, nor the death animations.  This becomes rather annoying, especially if you have to keep retrying a level.Exiting the game requires that you press the pause button, then quit, then yes, then the back arrow, and finally the X in the corner.  That's 5 screen taps just to exit the game!  If you press the Home key on your device, the game will continue running with Foreground priority, eating up CPU time and battery.This app has one of the longest permissions lists I've ever seen in a paid game.  It wants full Internet access, modify/delete SD card contents, read phone state and identity, view network state, and modify battery statistics.  It can also change your audio settings, prevent device from sleeping, and control vibrator, though these permissions are usually harmless.

In this first-person shooter, you're trapped in a cemetery full of zombies; your goal is to survive until 6 am.  There are 3 game modes available.  In Bone Collector, your objective is to collect all the cursed bones and return them to the sarcophagus before time runs out.  Survive the Night requires you to merely stay alive until 6.  Dead by Dawn is the ultimate zombie apocalypse; there is no end, just stay alive as long as you can.  There is also a simple tutorial.The graphics are good, but everything is very dark and you can only see about 10 feet in front of you.  This enhances the spookiness of the game, but it also makes it very hard to figure out where you are or what direction you're traveling.  You can easily get lost, which isn't as big a deal in most of the game modes, but can become a serious problem trying to find your way back to the sarcophagus in Bone Collector.  My single biggest frustration with this game was trying to figure out where I was going.The radar is of vital importance in Bone Collector, since it's really the only way to find the bones in time, but it doesn't show where the walls are, so often I'd find myself on the wrong side having to hunt for an opening.The controls also leave a lot to be desired.  You control your movement with a thumb joystick on the left, with no option to place it anywhere else, and shoot by tapping the screen.  This is harder than it sounds if you're playing on a tablet, since you have to hold the device with just your left hand.  It's probably easier with a smaller, lighter phone.  When I played, the gun would go off randomly at times.The game ran smoothly on my Motorola Xoom with ICS, even on the highest graphics settings.

I think this is the first cricket app I've ever seen.  It's certainly the first cricket FAotD.The graphics look fantastic and the sound is great.  There is an announcer calling the play by play, and while he does get a bit repetitive after a while, this is true of most sports games.The one major flaw with this app is that it lacks any sort of instructions on how to play cricket.  It has instructions on how to play this particular computer game, but not the game of cricket in general.  I understand you're suppose to hit the ball, but that's about it.  This game is clearly written for the cricket enthusiast, however, I doubt you'll find very many in the US.  In fact, the game doesn't even have an American team.[EDIT: I didn't realize it, but this app actually includes two different games, World Cricket Championship and World Premier League.  I initially thought the button for the latter was just a league logo, like the MLB logo in a baseball game.  WCC and WPL appear to have the same gameplay and follow the same basic rules, just different teams and different tournament systems.  And the WPL does include a handful of American teams.]A practice mode where you can just practice your pitching or hitting skills would be a nice addition.If you're one of those rare Americans who actually understands the sport, then this app is a definite must purchase.

This app is a series of what could barely be described as mini-games.  First you have to tap on the alarm clock 5 times to wake Daisy up.  I suppose that might be difficult, if you are like 1 year old.  Then you get to watch her take a shower, or not, because she runs the water so hot she has a tule fog surrounding her.  Next you have to help her pick out her outfit; luckily, she only owns like a half dozen articles of clothing.Then she gets locked out of her apartment, and rather than going to get the manager to let her back in like a normal person, she decides to kick the door down. If she's spotted by any of her neighbors, they call the police.  This is the first level with any serious difficulty, as her neighbors put Gladys Kravitz to shame.  If you can manage to get back in without being frisked by the cops, then you have to read her mind and make her a smoothie.This is as far as I was able to get in the game.  After this, you have to sort shoes, then commit battery on random strangers at the mall, then you can go on a date with Brad!  Isn't he dreamy?This is, without a doubt, one of the worst games I've ever played.  If at any point you make a mistake, you get shown an advertisement with an incredibly tiny button to dismiss it, and you have to start all over.  Since, of course, Brad will understand perfectly that Daisy is rescheduling their date because she drank the wrong smoothie that afternoon.[EDIT:  The advertisement in this game links to Top Girl, a free game with some rather expensive in-app purchasing.  The comments for that app include parents whose children have spent hundreds of dollars on virtual goods.  If your kids use your phone or tablet to play games, you can disable in-app purchasing by opening the Appstore app, pressing the menu button and selecting Settings, then In-App Purchasing; clear the checkbox to prevent purchases entirely.  If you wish to allow in-app purchasing, but provide limits, you can instead go into Parental Controls within the Settings menu and select Enable Parental Controls.  This will require entering your Amazon password each time an in-app purchase is made.  You can also check Use PIN if you would prefer to use a PIN instead of your full password.]

In this game, puzzle pieces drop from the top of the screen, and you have to place them in order to complete a circuit from one side to the other.  Some pieces rotate, some don't.  Some can move back and forth, others can't.  The game has 4 modes: Timed, where you race against the clock, Block Limit, which gives you a limited number of pieces, Unlimited, with infinite time and pieces, and Story, which basically serves as the tutorial and combines all three other modes.The graphics are reminiscent of the retro-futuristic style used in Bioshock, with dials, push buttons and analog counters and a gritty, metallic feel to everything.The game is an interesting concept, however I found the gameplay to be rather frustrating at times, particularly with some of the rotating pieces; they never seemed to face the direction I needed them to.  This can be especially bothersome in the Block Limit games, where you only have a limited number of pieces to work with, so you can't afford to throw any away.This app also includes that add-on everyone loves to hate, OpenFeint.

I have most of OneLouder's other paid apps, such as TweetCaster Pro, SportsCaster Pro, and ChannelCaster Pro.  All of these apps are great, so when I saw it on sale, I figured I'd give their Reddit app a try.Unfortunately, it looks terrible on my Motorola Xoom LTE with ICS, like a school project for a beginning programming class; it looks alright on my HTC Evo 3D phone.  (Actually, they look the same, but the formatting fits the phone's small screen much better than the larger tablet.)  This app desperately needs a tablet-specific update.  -1 star until it gets it.There is no way to save images from within the app, you have to launch your browser and save the image from there.  This is almost a deal-breaker for me.  -1 star just because of this.The Amazon version of BaconReader is currently at 1.4.155, while the version on Google Play is 1.51; there was a 1.5 before that.  Once again, Amazon is way behind on upgrades.  I don't fault the app or the developers for this, however, it's totally Amazon's fault.I like being able to access Reddit from my tablet, and this is the best app for the job, it just needs a few fixes before it's worthy of 5 stars.  I will revisit this review if and when the app is updated.

In this game, you play a chicken who gets hit on the head and now believes he is a ninja. No, really.The controls are quite basic. Press one button to jump, another to slide. Pressing slide will also make you fall faster. Run into a shuriken to throw it and jump over a nest to lay an egg. Hit any object and you have to start the level over. The level ends when you complete the objective, such as collecting a certain number of acorns or coins, laying eggs, or running a specific distance.When you complete each level, you receive a number of gold coins, but other than unlocking bonus levels to collect more coins, there doesn't appear to be any purpose for them; it doesn't even show how many coins you have so far.The graphics are relatively simple, but you really don't want anything overly complicated for games of this type. The character animations are well done, though the sound effects could use a bit of work. The load screens for the game are a bit jarring. I'm surprised that a game that is only 5 MB needs such long load screens. The developer should at least make them themed to the game, and not just black with the name of the company in giant letters.The internet access and phone state permissions are used to send anonymous user information to help improve the game.The game works great on my Motorola Xoom LTE with ICS.

In this physics-based puzzle game, you play Mr. Weasel, head of Weasel's Skool 4 Huntin' Chickens. Your students set out to raid a chicken coop, but are instead captured by the farmer. So you do the obvious thing, strap a rocket to your back and try to rescue them!While the game sounds like a clone of Angry Birds, and you do indeed launch the titular character across the screen, the similarity ends there. In Angry Birds, you basically just slam yourself into obstacles, but in Rocket Weasel, you have to try numerous strategies to accomplish your mission. You might have to light firecrackers or burn ropes with your rocket exhaust, avoid leaping porcupines, deploy a parachute, or trigger crazed squirrels armed with mallets. There are even a few levels that have Rube Goldberg-like contraptions.I must say that this is one of the most imaginative and well animated Android games I think I've ever seen. I found it to be even more fun than Angry Birds. The character designs are wonderful and the game is full of surprises, like the little animations Mr. Weasel does if you leave the game idle.The app includes a link to the developer's website where you can vote for a new rocket type to be used in a future update, or suggest your own rocket ideas. I love it when a developer is committed to providing updates to their product.It works perfectly and looks gorgeous on my Motorola Xoom LTE with ICS.For only 99 cents, this game is a definite must buy.

Great charger for the for DJI Phantom. Capable of charging 3 batteries or 2 batteries plus 1 remote controller.  It can automatically adjust the batteries charging sequence according to the batteries' power level. Very convienent. Works effectively and quickly as described.This product was supplied as sample for my unbiased review.

Beautiful two toned Iphone6 case. Rose and champange. Has a silicone case, then hard case over to give extra protection, but still maintains the slim profile of the Iphone 6. Easy access to charging ports and buttons without obstruction. Looks like a solid case and holding up pretty well so far!This product was supplied as a sample for me to try and give a unbiased review.

This is a great 24 oz thermos! Bright vibrant color. Heat resistant exterior. Slim enough to fit in my cup holder. Kept my tea warm all day. Cap can be used as a drinking cup.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

This is one nice looking Iphone 6 case! Very classy with leather-like case. Very feminine. Maintains the slim profile of the Iphone. Offers great protection with bumper against falls. Fits on my phone with easy access to ports and doesn't obstruct any of the buttons. Soft, good quality case.This product was supplied to me as a sample for my unbiased review.

Set of two pacifier clips! My little one loves her binki, but we seem to always misplace them.  We have few,  but still manage to loose them. When we need our binki,  we need it right away!  This clip helps keep our binki connected to her shirt at all times. Saves us the frantic cry!  I have one clipped to the car seat and one to her shirt. BPA free food grade silicone bright beads that are stimulation orally and visually.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Huge chalkboard label set. 72 in a package!  I can label up my whole house and still have plenty for later!  Erasable and chalk marker is included. Adhesive on label works great.  Marker is tricky at first. Shake,  write until it goes on smooth before starting.  Let it dry and don't touch otherwise it'll smear.  This set is great for anyone trying to organize and I love how cute it looks!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Easy to install child safety straps. I had some cabinet drawers that son started getting into in the restroom.  I was worried I wouldn't be around and he'd get into something dangerous. These straps are so easy to install.  Adhesive is on the back side of both bases. Straps fit in one side and slides in the other. To release just push the release buttons.  Simple to use. Great for my purpose of keeping my kiddo out.  Also comes with a door jam protector. 6 to a kit.  Very strong and effective!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

4 port power usb charger. Charges my phone quickly and notable difference from my other car chargers in the past.I love the option of being able to charge 4 devices as needed in our busy life!This product was supplied at a discount for my unbiased review

I wanted to add some extra protein into my smoothies and this Smart Protein tastes great. This is vanilla flavored. My favorite part about this protein powder and different from the ones I've used is that this product is not majorly processed. It is GMO-free, hormone treatment free, pesticide and chemical-free which is important to me in my efforts to live a healthier lifestyle. 15 grams of protein per servings and each container has about 30 servings, so lasts me about a month. Only about 80 calories and 2 grams of carbs per serving.This product was offered as a sample for my unbiased review.

Love the smell of this Frankincense! This is the first time I've used this brand and I'm very pleased that is comparable to others I've tried!  Smells of a woody spicy smell. Works great for my diffuser. I use it as part of my first aid by putting it on my boys little cuts to help with healing and inflammation. I love the use of essential oils!This product was supplied asa sample for my unbiased review.

My lashes are short and pathetic. This mascara is a two step process with clear gel and then mascara. Repeat steps until desired length and darkness.  Non irritating. Very simple.  Good results. Looks real. Very exciting for this lady with no lashes!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Great deodorizers! I have to diaper genies upstairs & downstairs. I love how the diaper genie help suppress the odors, but there is still a stench and my childs feces can be rancid since starting solids! These charcoal dipaer pail deodorizers don't mask the smell, but absorb the smell! I put 3 in each of my pails and I've noticed a great difference! It's recommended that every 2 weeks you need to put them in direct sunlight for 2 hours on each side & they should last up to 3 months.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.
Great quality silver rings. Great fit. Smooth and comfortable fit. Love screw design.  Arrived quick and safelyThis product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Perfect tote for swimming lessons for my boys.  Has compartments that separates lotions,  soaps, swim goggles, snacks,  and swim trunks! Has durable handles to help me commute to and from school!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

I have 3 boys and they always get fevers!  We have used a ear thermometer for years,  but with this no contact thermometer it allows me to check their temperatures while asleep and not wake them up,  especially important for the baby!This is the same technology we've used at our hospital!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review

This little device seems to have decreased the amount of bugs that show up in our garage. Plug in and does not require batteries. Emits a sound that we can't hear. Hopefully this will help keep our bugs under control.This product was received as a sample for my unbiased review.

Easy way to get extra protein, fiber, and omega 3 into my diet. I add a couple spoonfuls into my smoothies or water. I love the little texture it gives my drinks and it keeps me feeling full! Keeps me regular, full, and healthy! Love that Nutria chia seeds are organic. Soak in water for about 10 minutes and the seeds soften up. There are lots of recipes for chia seed pudding as well. This is a great super food!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Classy stainless steel door stop. I've had wedge stops in the past but they were too low and door would slip shut. This door stop is higher up. Stays in place. Looks good. Has grips on the bottom so it doesn't slip and also weighted down.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Stroller net! This helps protect my baby when we're out and about town. No mosquitos. No strangers touching him. I'm able to see him. Wraps around my stroller without it falling off. Measures 40 x 47 inches. I'm able to wrap this around stroller, car seat, pack and play. Baby doesn't mind since he can see and hear out. Does not make it hot and stuffy, good ventilation.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Great to add a little texture, calm fly aways, and style my hair! This is pomade, not gel. Anyone who states this is sticky is because they are using too much. Only a dap is needed, then put on your palm and slap it back and forth to separate it. Then rubbed it in my hair for great texture. Great hold. Non-greasy look. Love it!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased reveiw.

My boy loves this! He loves the "life sabers" that light up his wheel! Flickers of blue light while he rides. Great for safety! Front light and rear light as well. This is a excellend set to help illuminate our bikes! Screw the light in the tire. Secure the front and rear lights with a easy to install strap. No tools necessary!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Great backup battery for my iphone! There are days that I use my phone a lot and my battery gets drained. This is a great solution to charge up my phone, but not be strapped down to a wall charger! This little device connects to the base of my phone. Not heavy. I can still use my phone while charging.  Nice!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Got a new nexus 6 and it uses a qi wireless charging.  I use this extra for the office to be able to charge away from home.  Works well! Charges without problems!This product was supplied asa sample for my unbiased review.

With 3 kids and a big SUV trunk, I had lots of random loose things scattered around. This trunk organizer helped clean up my mess. I have extra change of clothes, diapers, wipes, picnic blankets, snacks, water, etc This collapsible organizer is great, fold up if not needed. Also portable to take along. Keeps everything contained.olded: 11" wide x 10" high x 3" deep. It expands up to 21 inch of storage space: 21-inches long, 10-inches high, 11-inches deep. 6 mesh side pockets to keep organized.  Closable pockets on both end, smaller pockets with velcro closure and other end has 1 large pocket with velcro closure. Black and easy to clean. Water repellent.This product was purchased at a discount in trade for my unbiased review.

I've always wanted my own epilator! I like it because it helps space out the interval between shaving. Easy to use rolling up and down my legs. Works best with hair being a bit longer. I like that it is not a large head to be able to go around my knees, underarm, and bikini area. Comes with a shaver to clean up whatever the epilator did not get. Works effectively. What I like about this gadget is that it has a callus buffer too. Buffing at my dry heels and feet! Gentle, so doesn't hurt. Buffs away a little white dry skin. Rechargeable, so no batteries or cords needed which is so much easier and cost effective.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased reivew.

Loving my new canvas tote! I needed a bag to carry some of my stuff to and from work. What is unique from other canvas bags is that there are two side pockets! I am able to store my keys and phone without digging through my whole bag. Comfortable to wear on my shoulders. Cute. Large enough to slip my apple air inside. Heavy duty material. Good quality.This product was supplied to me as a sample for my unbiased review.

Nice gel cream for under my eyes. Being a working mom of a baby I do not get enough sleep and run around with bags and black circles. I started using this eye gel and I do feel and look more refreshed. I apply it twice a day after I wash my face. Small amount goes a long way. This will help fight away circles as well. Does not have a sticky residue. Notice a improvement of dark circles and bags for sure.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Works like OEM to charge up my Samsung Note. My OEM wires have stopped working a couple other times. This alternative is much more affordable, yet it works just as well. Quickly charges my phone. Plugs in and doesn't fall loose. Works great and have no problems with it.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Great automatic soap dispenser. Dispenses the perfect amount of soap with auto dispensing. I don't have to worry about touching the bottle in my kitchen while my hands are soiled. Great elegant stainless steel body matches my decor. Operates seamless and doesn't drip. Requires 4 AA batteries that are not included. Place battery at base of the dispenser, then attach the base for stability, but also has the drip tray. The top of the cylinder slides open, then unscrew the cap for soap refill (also soap not included). I used the Method soap and it worked great! Great dispenser for my home!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Beautiful lavender iPhone 6 case. Very elegant design. Champagne bumper edge. This case is great because it helps me maintain the slim profile of iPhone design while offering protection. Case opens up on the edge of the bumper to have a nice tight fit. Open the buckle, align the phone and sheer lavender backing, then lock the buckle by compressing it down. Great fit. Doesn't interfere with charging ports, camera, or speakers.This case was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

A great anti-aging product. It helps product collagen and has hyaluronic acid and elastin to help keeps skin look plump and refreshed. Helps skin rebuild for a healthier glow. Also works on decreasing breakouts. I've been using this product for about a few weeks now and I do notice more of a glow. Skin feels refreshed. Yellow serum. Small amount goes a long say. No smells or frangrances. Skin tone appears more smooth. Pores do appear smaller. I'm excited for continued use.This serum was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Stainless steel lemon squeezer. I like to make smoothies and the touch of a lime or lemon in them taste great! This handy little lemon squeezer makes this process so easy and clean! Cut the lemon in half and squeeze down, then juice is extracted! Very simple. Not much effort needed. Dishwasher safe. Easy to clean.This product was provided as a sample for my unbiased review.

Great powerful little camping light! Small, yet bright and strong light. Pull up the canister and the light auto illuminates and turns off when folding it back down as well. Has a little handle to carry. The LED light is quite impressive and brighter than most of our other lights! Requires 3 AAA batteries for operation.This product was provided as a sample for my unbiased review.

I love the slim profile of this case. Most heavy duty cases that protect from water, dirt, sand and snow are bulky. The reason why I invested in the iphone6 is the slim profile and this case offers the great protection I'm needing while maintining the light weight slim design!Waterproof up to a depth of 6 feet! We have a pool and kids, so this case is essential for the warmer months around my house!Military Grade Protection: IP68 certified.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

I use this cute little konjac sponge for my baby. With his gentle skin, even wash cloths seem to harsh for him. This sponge I submerge into water and is soft. I put a little baby soap on it and laters well. Dries up and has a little string to hang. Soak back up in water and it is a nice soft sponge again.This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

Cute black and white hobo with blue accent! Option of wearing over the shoulder or over the elbow. Front pocket. Plenty of pockets throughout. Body is made of a canvas material. Large enough to carry all my essentials plus my ipad or macbook. Trendy look to it. Only thing I didn't care for is the print on the strap. Made in China. Overall good hobo bag!This bag was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review

Turmeric has been used for years to treat a variety of conditions. Turmeric may help fight infections and some cancers, reduce inflammation, and treat digestive problems. I've started adding it to smoothies to help with joint pain, headaches,  and regulate my digestion. This bag of tumeric is huge, 1 lb.  All organic. Bright orange yellow color.  Smooth. Great flavor!  I made a carrot,  orange, pineapple,  lemon concoction with tumeric powder.  Even the kids drank it!I received this product as a sample for my unbiased review.

Great for exfolliation and relaxation. Epson salt helps decrease swelling and achy body and feet!  I use it as a scrub in the bath and then soak. The lavendar is so relaxing! Makes my body feel soft & refreshed! Once a week treat for myself!This product was supplied as a sample for my unbiased review.

My baby has been teething and biting everything and anything! Teething can be such a miserable time. I love having some teething toys, hylands teething pellets, and my amber teething necklace to make this stage more tolerable for baby and US! This set of teething toys are cute! Compact and easy to take out! I keep it in my freezer at times and it makes it cool for his gums! Holes make it easy for baby to grasp on. Also comes with a pacifier holder, but the beads are also made from the food grade silicone for him to bite on! Easy to clean with mild soap or throw it in the dishwasher. Train and elephant design are adorable!This product was sent as a sample for my unbiased review.

Natural anti-septic. Put a few drops on gums and swish around and swallow for bad breath as needed. Helps kill bacteria in a natrual way and helps with bad breath. I also tried putting it on my toothbrush. Not the typical peppermint/spearmint mouth wash flavor I'm used to, but more of a anti septic which was tolerable mild flavor.This product was sent as a sample for my unbiased review.

I'm always disappointed with these kinds of toys.It says 35 phrases but I guess it is if you count "one" "two" "green" as phrases.Our one year old seems to not get enough songs, and again, we managed to get a toy that has only a few short "original (not that good)" songs in it.The speaker is on the back, so it gets quieter if placed on the floor.I realize it's a cheap toy for a cheap price but it still could have been better.Baby wanted to play with it right away and was bored with it within a few minutes...

This is a very creepy toy.It is well made and the noises are good.But I will keep it away from my kid until much later. I don't want my kid to learn to bite, and it is creepy looking anyway and my kid didn't him.Maybe in a few years.

I really really like this book.-Everything we tried tasted great.-It's quick.-It uses good ingredients. By good ingredients I mean fresh and things you can buy easily.I have used other cookbooks that say "add a cup of cooked chicken" which made me mad because it was hidden time waster or they mean canned cooked chicken? etc. None of that stuff is in this book. It even had common dressings for salads on a page.I am a busy parent too and I really appreciate this book.

I like the idea of not having to tilt this cups as much.But we switched back to the generic ones we found in the grocery store because they don't leak.These squirt water out every time baby pulls it out of it's mouth (1 year old). The baby's shirt was soaking wet in 3 minutes. No thanks. I don't want to change baby's shirt after each drink.

I have a little bit of mixed feelings about this bottle.From the promotional materials: "...constructed of borosilicate glass for pure taste" and I want to add "and then the liquid touches plastic right before it reaches your mouth..."I think this is a fine container I just don't like that the glass part of it is advertised so prominently when the stuff inside is interacting with and condensing from the plastic cap. If they really cared about the "pure taste" the cap would be made of glass and silicone maybe.You might as well make the whole thing from plastic if the cap is plastic really.It keeps beverages warm.The outer sleeve isn't cool to the touch but it won't burn you.If you choose to drink out of the cap, it works well. The flow is perfect and it is leak-proof. You do have to tilt the cup quite a bit before liquid comes out and it can be very scary if you don't know how hot the liquid is.

I wish I liked it more.It's cute enough and baby loved it.In night mode the music goes on forever and it's loud.In day mode pushing the ears tells you about colors. Pushing two ears at the same time will play some music.That's it. If you think of it as a stuffed toy and everything else as extra, then you might like it. If you think about it as an electronic toy, then you will be disappointed.It took baby about 2 days to figure out the ears are activating the toy.Some colors are not accurate when they glow (yellow glows green etc).

This is a good solid choice for a wardrobe.However I don't like the placements of the zippers. It think it's good for storage (where you leave it zipped)  but I want to use this everyday. I don't want to unzip and zip it every time. But it looks messy if left unzipped. If the zippers ran down the sides let's say then I can leave it unzipped and it would look closed.Everything else about it is great. It's solid. The shoe pocket are a nice touch. Assembly wasn't too bad. It's great if you need more clothes hanging space (it doesn't have shelves inside, just room for hanging clothes).
This is a very nice ornament.It looks better than the pictures make you think.It is not too small and the detail is fine.I like how playful it looks, it is christmasy with the ball.

Live Scribe penWhen I first open the box and looked at the contents and realized how it worked, I wanted to give this 2 stars. Here is why:-The pen is wide. Even if the grip were narrower that would help.-The pen rattles. I hate when pens make noise. The ink cartridge is smaller than its housing.-The pen needs special paper to transfer data to the device youâre using.After the initial very negative impression. It grew on me.-The size wasnât as bad as I thought it was going to be. Itâs more comfortable that I thought it would be (I would still prefer a narrower grip).-It doesnât rattle as much or have a lot of give when using (although I would prefer it didnât at all).-And most importantly the functionality of the pen is a lot better than I expected. This is the important part so I will dwell on this for a bit:It uses special paper and I looked at the notebook prices. While not cheap, they are not expensive either.The notebooks are numbered so it knows which notebook you are writing in automatically (or if writing in the included moleskine notebook).It knows which page you are writing in and where on the page. So it makes an accurate representation of the page in the app.I can write without being connected to the app, it stores stuff on the pen and syncs when connected to the app.This is useful to me when I write stuff down and want access to the material when I donât have the notebook but have the phone. All the stuff I jot down is accessible on try phone.Things of note:I wish I can turn off the beep it makes when I turn it on.When you record audio: The pen doesnât have a mic. It used the mic on my phone. So the pen is just a switch for the app to do the recording.So I started my review with 2 stars and worked my way up to 5 stars. But itâs a 5 star recommendation with a few caveats:-Make sure you know what you are getting (the livescribe notebooks, the lack of mic on the device, the rattling, that itâs a ballpoint pen (I donât like ballpoints but if thatâs not an issue for you then donât worry about it), the thickness of the pen etc).But it works so well, if you are ok with everything else, that I do like it and would recommend it.

This is a cute and quite cuddly toy even though he has a sound box in him. Our 1 year old gave him a hug instantly.All 4 paws, an ear, and his heart/tummy have buttons to push for sounds and songs.If you hold his heart for a few seconds, he plays his entire repertoire.There are three different levels so he will "grow" with your child and continue to provide fun for many months.Two volume levels are always welcome. It's not too loud.Baby can change the learning levels too easily. You just have to hold one of the leg buttons for a few seconds.

Very large, very convex! I really like this mirror. It attaches easily using two adjustable straps that should work with any headrest - one vertically wraps around the headrest and the other wraps horizontally. Once the straps are tightened,I have complete confidence that it will not come loose and hurt baby. It feels very sturdy once attached. It is made of lightweight yet hardy plastic that is shatterproof for added safety.While I have a similar product from a different company, I like this mirror better because it is more convex, meaning both baby and I have a larger view.The hinge is stiffer than the other product so it moves less with car vibrations.Would definitely recommend.

This is a great chair for forward facing setup.If you have a newborn, then you should have a normal rear facing car seat. That seat should be good enough until they are ready for forward facing seats. The advantage of that is the the baby is still light enough that you can carry baby in car seat and set them in a base that stays in your car.This seat starts at 9 lb for recline position 3 and rear facing. It's is good and solid and very comfy and reclines back enough. But it's something you want to keep in the car. It's good for older kids when you don't want to carry the seat anyway! We can use position 2 now but we will wait until baby is bigger then stop using our other infant seat and switch to this.It is baby approved though for the few times we used it.Position 2 is for 22-40 lb kids facing forward.Position 1 is the most upright for 40-65 lb kids (also forward facing).Installation isn't too bad and supports LATCH (or just seat belts).It feels very safe and solid but the handle for the head adjustment feels very cheap. It get's stuck in squeezed position (to adjust) and I have to mess with it until it pops back out and locks the head position.

It has some good qualities:The velcro runs along the entire length so the spacing of the slabs doesn't affect how it works.It looks nice.Things I don't like:It's shorter than the crib. It's note like the picture where it reaches the ends.It's not cushioned or anything. This is ok. Just wanted to let you know.

Sitting in it you feel the full heat of the sun. It gets hot even with windows and front open.You have to put blankets or towels on top top actually not get sunburn.And the instructions are horrible. The picture on Amazon was way more helpful.I was really excited for this, too bad.

This is great for very young babies.It does grow with your baby a little bit.I like that the cads are labeled with age.It one of those things you don't think about. It is a good idea. It makes the ride a little less boring for them. Ours was never bored though; she can look out the window too but she does look at them so I know it's engaging.

I was very excited to get this book but was rather disappointed.Some of the movements are quite clumsy and difficult to manage.Most of the ideas behind the book are great, but it needs something. It seems to be missing some transitions between the steps.The back of the book suggests that the book will describe how to build a birdhouse. It misses the mark - the first few steps/pages are great. You can see how this might make a birdhouse. Then, it just basically stops with the birdhouse and describes how to use a screwdriver, tighten a bolt, and cut and fasten.Could have been so much better

Made of sturdy plastic, very cute.At first we thought it was too loud but we got used to it pretty quickly. The music has to be kind of loud to cover up the sound of the fan that propels the balls. I would say it is about as loud as a hair dryer. Scared baby at first but it was too cute and fun for her to resist.Easy to use - you just push the tail down and away you go! Hours of fun!It really holds my 11-month-old's attention.I would definitely recommend. We have been using it daily for a few weeks and are still using our first set of batteries.Music is lively and fun - although, I have it stuck in my head always! Great toy overall

This is the first time I try Goji Berries.I don't like them.The pictures on the website and even on the product make it seem like they would be more moist.I was expecting something like raisins or craisins but with a new flavor.
