But these are wayyyyy to dry, almost crunchy dry and the eventually when you get some flavor out it's not good.Even though I have no experience with Goji berries, I have a feeling this is not what they are supposed to be like. Will try another brand at some point and compare.

Very fun toy - her house/ocean cruiser allows many different and entertaining scenarios. With a little imagination, this toy will bring hours of entertainment.I really like the compactness of the toy with its accessories. Everything fits together very nicely.The "MagicPoint" things are pretty cool, too. It's like Sandy is playing with you and the house/ocean cruiser is real! I think this encourages independent play - which we all know translates into a little "down-time" for mom or dad.Some of the parts are maybe a little bit "not-so-sturdy," which is why I didn't give it the full 5 stars.Also, as an animals lover, not sure I like the dolphin harness idea :)

Just the right size and machine washable!Very squishy and cute.Clothes have easy to use larger Velcro pieces.She is actually quite realistic, for being made from washcloth material.I love that she has 10 fingers/toes, elbows and knees, and a heart-shaped belly button!Her pacifier is very cute, the magnet works well, and has a removable wrist tether. I think this might help with our baby getting rid of her pacifier. My only conservative wish is for the diaper to be a little bigger - reminds me of "daisy dukes" with a bit if her cute little buns hanging out the bottom!All in all a great first doll. Definitely recommend.

Think of this as 2 slide puzzles. Each side is racing the other on who solves it first.It's an ok idea for a game and the rules say you can put tiles in anyway you want at the beginning.If you don't like slide puzzles don't even consider this game.Also as a parent you have to find way to play handicapped to give young ones a chance.It is a cheap game and it's priced as one. So if you like slide puzzles and want to make it competitive, you found your game.

This has surpassed all my expectations.After getting done with the annoying stickers (takes the most time of the assembly process), this is really a great toy.The remote works well. Forward and backward. The car then drives the elevator up and down and the service area gears.It is a bit louder than I'd like but not too bad.It is very big. Takes a lot of floor space when assembled.I'm very rarely pleasantly surprised especially by kids toys. This is very good.

Great toy. Our 11 month old found the button on Miss Norah before we even unboxed it. The elevator has survived being tugged on.I'm not the biggest fan of VTech songs in toys, they are not good and get old fast. But the toy is pretty good in all other respects.I can't comment on how older kids will play with it but as ours gets older we'll see.It is sturdy.It is busy. There is a lot to do.I hate toys where I have to put stickers on :) It's a half joke, I would really appreciate the stickers being on there.

This are great. If you have a kid who is less than 2, I would recommend the First Builders sets.Once they get stronger hands with better coordination, then these are great.They have some cards so you can get inspired.They can come apart easily (this is a positive thing, you don't get frustrated with stuck pieces).There is enough pieces.

Pros:Good diffuse light.Very adaptable positioning.Included USB charger.2 light levels.Very good value.Looks good.Cons:Sometimes you have to hold the base when adjusting. The joints are too stiff or the base isnot heavy enough.Only 1 temperature of light: daylight (I wouldn't use this in the evening as it would keep me up late).

This is not a bad toy. It needs a bit of dexterity and patience to work well. I was worried about the pieces being too small so I won't give this to a baby less that 2 years old as stated on the box.It is nice that all the pieces fit in the bus.It can be very educational.I found that it's better to let kids discover things in it (I'll show them a little bit).This is not the most captivating toy your kid will have but it's nice to have around. But I think it's a toy they will revisit as they develop and get older.

I like it because it works.I don't like it because it is made cheaply.It works:It really does. After you vacuum, you can see the dirt being pulled out of the carpet. I used the deep clean formula (it came with antibacterial formula which makes no sense? Are you trying to sterilize the carpet? Good luck with that).It got rid of old and new stains (if it hadn't I would have tried the oxy formula but I didn't need to). If you get carpet cleaning services done often, this will pay for itself.It's made cheaply:it's made of cheap plastic and I have no idea how long it will last.I like that it has a fast cleaning mode that doesn't take as long to dry or the deep cleaning mode (plan for a at least a day of not using that room).

I really wanted to like it because I thought I wouldn't have to use the blue ice packs and recover some room.It doesn't last 6 hours. I think I still have to use the blue ice packs.I don't like that Velcro is the only thing holding the flap with the handle to the front of the bag. A zipper closes the container but the handle is on the flap thing.It's not a big bag. So yeah the idea is that you don't have to use ice packs but it's smaller than other bags so there is no net gain in space.

This is a great mouse.Easily the most comfortable mouse I've used. And depending on how you hold it, the keys can slide forward or backward (using the included tool).I also  like the DPI up and down buttons. You can't push them accidentally. You don't even feel they are there until you use them.This has by far the best quality scroll wheel I've ever used. It's quiet and it feel great.It's rare thing nowadays but everything about this mouse is well thought out: The key clicks, button click, amount of resistance, the weight, and the comfort. (I don't care at all about the led lights but if you do, they are nice and customizable with software).It's a great everyday mouse too.

What do you get when a company only designs chairs for at least 6 feet tall people with huge asses and very short arms and weigh less than 350 lbs?This chair.This is the stupidest chair I have put together.Step 2 of the instructions is very difficult.This is the stupidest chair I have sat in.I'm not tall, but I'm not short. My feet barely reach the floor. The chair is so wide almost 2 of me can fit in it. The arm rest offers no support.And the one piece arm rest along the back makes this chair look very bad.
The is s a classic trike.I didn't not like the instructions (trying to be sparse with words like IKEA manuals).Once together, it is super sturdy.It has a storage container and it works well.

This is good. It's not a substitute for a coach.I just play for fun, I don't have a coach and I don't ever plan on it. So this is useful for me.It is nice to visualize when you are hitting the ball in the swing (for serving for example) and try to optimize little things to get better.I got pretty accurate results.I prefer the flex mount. It's not obtrusive.I have a little bit of a problem getting the ball the sweet spot of the racquet and this confirms it. So nothing I didn't know but I notice I'm more conscious of it so I hope it gets better.I do like the capture a serve function quite a bit also.It just makes you make small improvements which is the whole point...

These are great for me. I occasionally have to send a postcard.I hate looking at greeting cards and postcards at stores.Now I don't have to :)You can get blank ones at the post office but they are hard to print on especially if your printer doesn't do edges well.As other Avery products, you know there are no surprises. It is exactly what you expect (which is to say good and dependable).Economical personizable postcards
There is not much to complain about.They came apart cleanly for me.Worked great with my color laser printer.They come with envelopes.The price is good.

This has Very high quality construction and super soft material.It's very easy to manipulate - even for a non-puppeteer.I was surprised with how realistic I could make its facial expressions appear.It seems to come alive in your hands!I appreciate the placement of the opening for your hand - it is a slit on his lower belly. It appears closed when not in use.I would absolutely recommend this product.It is very beautiful

Cool idea, especially if the child shows interest in decorating cakes and such. The spotlight is cool but the motorized spinning isn't really a great idea. It doesn't really go at a speed that you can use. I would suggest just spinning it by hand. It comes with two rather small, plastic, re-usable items to decorate - a vase and a dish/container. There are also 3 cardboard discs included to decorate, which are really kinda cheap-looking. The styler is reminiscent of a caulking gun - you load it with a deco pop filled with play-doh and squeeze. I really don't like purchasing products that require additional purchase of consumables. I wish you could refill the Deco pop containers by hand. However, I don't see that it will be a big problem, since I believe most kids will tire of this before you need to purchase many refills. Not bad for a rainy day afternoon project but not really a long term item.

I think it's ugly (especially the cap). Uglier in person than you see in pictures.It didn't always write, I'd have to move the piston down and up every time to write. This is the only fountain pen that did this. I tried with various inks.I threw it out. I don't like it enough to fix it.I was really excited for an inexpensive piston filler so I can give them as gifts to introduce people to fountain pens.Very disappointed.

Some things you need to note:-Plastic interior.-Water level window under the handle is not an ideal location for it.I have this, Breville BKE820XL Variable-Temperature 1.8-Liter Kettle, and I will make a comparison between the two since that is what would be useful to me if I were buying one.The Breville has buttons for the different kinds of tea. This Kenwood has temperatures. I will have to remember which tea needs what temperature or write them down.The Breville is slightly faster.The Kendwood is much quieter (can barely hear the water boiling)The Kendwood has a very pleasant chime when it's done (it's not loud, you won't hear the chime in another room).Both have plastic parts in the interior. The Kenwood is all plastic inside though (except for the bottom).The Breville is all stainless steel on the outside.The Kenwood has a sainless steel base, but the kettle is brushed aluminum. It looks a little strange.I can't find any info on either to see if they are BPA free or not.So I think both products are good if you need variable temperatures for different kinds of tea.

As always, Schleich pays great attention to detail in their products. Everything looks amazing! The horse and groomer appear to be very high quality and sturdy. The mat of the washing station is a nice rubber-like material - feels very realistic! The saddle and bridle are made of a flexible material to add to the realism. I would definitely recommend this Schleich product - I have always loved their products and this horse wash station is no exception.

I like it because it's short and portable. I throw it in my backpack. When I'm at someone else's house everyone knows it's my cable because of the color (every one else's cable is white)! It works with iPhone 6 and 6s (I'm not sure why the description doesn't include that).

These are very high quality.I expect these to last forever!It's nice to still be able to get stuff that is not made in the cheapest possible way.The middle of the dividers are transparent so you can see the first page of whatever comes after it. It is quite handy.This is one of those things that there isn't much to say about. It's just a simple product that is made well.

These are very good headphones.First the sound.The bass is not powerful, but it is accurate. I'll take accurate bass over sloppy powerful bass any day.Overall though I don't think it's recreates everything accurately. Music sounds distant. Podcasts sound good.I still recommend these headphones because they don't cause ear fatigue for me.I wouldn't want to listen to these critically (or at home where I have better headphones) but they are great for traveling or at work.Everything else:They are extremely comfortable (and lightweight).Big L and R in the cups (but you can tell from the shape anyway).They do leak noise though, so if at work I don't think you can listen to them loudly.I like the detachable cable. The mic and volume buttons work well with my iPhone.

This is a very high quality bag that will last a long long time (familiar with brand).Some things to know:It is narrow (macbook 15 in will barely fit).It has a million pockets (well kinda).It has a curved aluminum back (with the combination of a mesh net that will keep the bag off your back).Very very comfortable. The padding is very good. Even the waist belt has good padding and very convenient pockets.A zipper in the bottom of the bag reveals a pocket to hold your gun or bow.Another zipper in the bottom reveals a waterproof bag.It's slightly expandable so if you don't use the whole bag you can compress it so things don't move around.There is a removable pouch that can be worn separately or attached to the front straps.The whole time using this bag I was thinking: this is the bag I want to carry in case of a zombie event.It's light and narrow so you can run with it and not snag on anything. The mesh bag will let help you sweat less so they can't smell you. It's compatible with hydration packs. It's extremely comfortable so you can carry a heavy load and wear it all day. The side pockets are great for snacks or ammo etc.The whole

This is a great idea.It has a 30 minute timer so kids can use it whenever they want. And you know it's not going to be on all night.It's very light (not pun intended) and the button is easy to use.I wish I picked the money one though instead of the owl because the light is blue (a lot of research there) from the owl so it might contribute to keeping baby up.
Once your toilet is clean, they help keep it clean. It does work well.It has a strong bleachy smell so we have to keep the lid down on the toilets.

This is a very simple toy. That is it's strength.It's safe.It works.It's well made.The driver comes out and is not too small (no hazard).There is a hand on the scoop shovel to make it work well.Can't think of any negative thing to say.

This is my second one of these. And my third Philips flosser.I have this, Philips Sonicare HX8211/02 Airfloss Rechargeable Electric Flosser, and it worked well. until it got dropped on the floor and the little door mechanism broke. You can't buy the tiny cheap plastic door from Philips.I decided to try the "pro" version to replace the non-pro version linked above. The pro version fires 1, 2, or 3 successive blasts depending on the setting. The blasts are less powerful than the non-pro version.Anyway about a month after owning the pro version, it started firing continuously until I turned it off or the battery died. I was about to call Philips when I was offered this review version.Long story short, I recommend getting the non-pro version. It lasted me years until a drop broke part of it. It also has a more powerful blast.I will see if this pro version will last. I will update my review if it fails.Now to the actual performance. Initially I wasn't impressed with it's "flossing for people to hate flossing" message. But I really rely on it now. Yes, I hate flossing but that is not why. I sometimes get food stuck in my back teeth that no brushing or flossing will remove. This is where this shines, and now it's a necessity for me.Manual flossing is supposed to better than using this machine but after I manually floss, I still get some particles to come out when I use this flosser.

This is one of the most high quality, well thought out baby thing I've encountered.It started with unpacking. It actually had repacking instruction on the box (and the manual).This is great they thought ahead so we can pack it away between babies.The instructions are also amazing. A real rarity with baby products I'm discovering.To the important part:I works very well. You can choose the motion types and the speed. You are bound to find something baby will like.Baby looked comfortable. It's not rigid, I wish the back support for the baby was a little more rigid so it doesn't curl the baby up. It's good if you keep it reclined all the wayThe speakers are the only drawback. Very cheap/bad sounding speakers.The motor isn't silent or very quiet but babies won't care about that.Some extras:You can attache a phone or music player with provided headphone jackYou can control the whole thing with your phone with bluetooth.

What you need to know:Straps hold it together (can see in pic)Does not "snap" shut or anything like that. Easy to open by accident.There are a lot of things to do in there. It keeps baby busy for a while. (considering putting it with car seat as a car toy).Well made.Can get cumbersome but it's not heavy.

This is great. Very practical.The flashlight is very bright. Pushing the power button quickly lets you dim the light and eventually make it flash.If it was just a flashlight I would have been happy enough.It also is a good charger/battery pack.I like having it in my back pack if my phone dies. And it's a great flashlight!I like the square (I mean non-cylindrical design, so it doesn't roll)I still have to do a know how long it keeps a charge so I know how often to top it off... Will update as I collect data.

We got this for a 10 month old.There are 3 positions.1. Baby lies flat under toys2. Sitter can play with some of the stuff (mat folds over and has baskets)3. Stander can put balls on bridge (get rid of mat)I knew it was going to be a 5 star review when I saw the baby's face after I put it together and she wanted to play with it :)Like all Fisher-Price toys, the instruction manual is terrible, and if feels a bit cheap, but works well.We are running out of space, so it's nice to get a toy that baby can use for long time.

I think it's too expensive for what you get, and there are better choices.It's really 2 small purifiers on top of each other, each with their own blower and filter.The size might make you think it's for a bigger room.I blows air front to back, so it can't be too close to walls.It's not loud but not quiet either, might be good white noise.I personally don't see the advantage of having it be connected to wifi. I can turn do the same things as the buttons on the device. It does let me see the life of the filter.

The carrying case Is great: it is soft with sturdy handles and seems to be quite rugged. I also like that there are examples of things to build on the carrying case.The "bloks" are all sorts of different shapes - makes for more interesting possibilities. The bloks are a good size - too big to choke on but big enough for small hands to easily grasp and manipulate. Bloks fit together very well and are easy to take apart without just falling apart. There is a good number of them too.All-in-all, very satisfied with this product.

I have to confess this at the beginning of the review: I don't jog. I will never jog. My wife doesn't jog or have plans either. But this is the perfect stroller for us.I have many Graco strollers: inexpensive 4 wheel ones (Graco Verb Click Connect Travel System, Sunshine, Graco Comfy Cruiser Click Connect Travel System, Stratus, moderately expensive 3 wheel ones Graco Aire3 Click Connect Travel System, Gotham.All the other Graco models are great for walking in malls or other indoor smooth areas etc (Aire3 became our favorite until now).This one is what we use to go on walks outdoors. It is perfect for curb to street, uneven roads etc. It is quiet because the wheels are inflatable and it's gentle on baby because of the excellent shock absorbers.The canopy is really good too. I hated the canopy on the Comfy Cruiser and Verb Click. The Aire3 had a better canopy (still has the inexplicable mesh middle which let sun hit baby's eyes).This model has the best canopy (it's closed on top and has mesh windows on the sides for baby to look out of).If you want to go on walks outside, this is the Graco stroller you want.It comes with the good version of the car seat (easliy adjusts) and it's the 35 lb not the 30 lb versions you get with cheaper Gracos.It also comes with the good car seat base that adjusts the recline angle (not the cheap car seat bases that don't adjust angle which they also make).

This is a really good hand blender (immersion blender).The ice attachment worked really well for me. It's not quiet, but it's not horribly loud.The crushed ice came out perfect.I think if you have a counter-top blender then this is redundant.The ice crushing bowl sits in the 1L beaker.The beaker comes with a separate blade attachment and it's becomes a rather full sized blender. But now there is no convenient was to store everything.The blender stick attachment is made of metal so you don't want to use that in nonstick cookware.It takes up a lot of room. I was thinking I would put it on a counter top but with all the attachments it really doesn't save any more room than having a full sized blender.I'm trying to find out if I can get more attachments to make this more useful (for example other models come with whisk attachment or one for mashing potatoes (big foot or something like that)). I will update my review when I hear back from customer service. I couldn't find a place online that sells attachments (I found some on amazon uk site though so I might resort to that to get the whisk).I would search for other Kenwood or DeLonghi (they own Kenwood) blenders which seem to be compatible (if not identical) and see if they come with attachments you like).

The pockets are deep and close well.We like the abundance of pockets, kids pick up a lot of stuff!Feels well made. Looks like it will last for yearsLots of loops to hangs stuff on.We like the mesh back a lot.

The suction isn't very strong but it's not loud either. It works well though.The light is yellowish and works well, might attract bugsAfter you suck up the bug, you can remove the "barrel" and it becomes a bug viewing chamber with the front door becoming a magnifying glass.It's great for catch and release.The clip is really cheap and can barely hold the weight of the vacuum.

First I will say that the quality of the plastic/construction is really good.This is not a flimsy toy.There is a lot of detail on the dinosaur, coloring, skin, teeth etc.It projects dino prints as you move the truck. It's actually better than the pictures on the box lead you to believe.The trap doesn't "snap" shut, it closes as the weigh of the dinosaur is applied. It's still good though.The guy has only 1 movable arm but he snaps in the driving compartment.The cage/trap fits securely on the truck and it's easy to put on and take offWe are just impressed with the construction quality of the toy.

Very well-designed toy - almost every possible surface has a construction-themed mold for creating countless possibilities! Even the Play-Doh containers look like construction safety barrels. Seriously, who doesnât love an extruder?Sure, you canât remove every bit of the play-doh from the extruder mechanism and some might start coming out of the wrong places, and yes, to get the play-doh out of some of the molds can be a little tricky, but this also teaches a lesson. Not everything in life is perfect and easy. Sometimes you need to work at something to get the result you want. A little patience and finesse as well as manual dexterity go a long way!A Play-Doh Knife was not included - would have helped with the extruder and with removing excess Play-Doh from around the molded pieces.

You get the stroller, car seat, and car seat base.I have found 2 kinds of car seats Graco makes:1. The one I like where you can pull a strap and tighten the whole thing.2. And the cheaper one that you flip the seat over and fiddle with the straps. (don't like).This is the #1 kind (the good one).I have also found that Graco makes at least 2 kinds of bases:1. The one I like where it has a knob that changes the angle of the seat.2. And the cheap one where you have to put towels underneath.This is the #1 kind (the good one).This is my favorite Graco stroller so far simply because of the canopy. We had bought a different mesh canopy extender for our other strollers just to keep the sun out of baby's eyes (they don't do well if it's windy). So the canopy alone makes this worth it.So things we really like:-When you extend the canopy part if it is mesh and the baby can see out (not as claustrophobic)-The peek window rolls towards me and has a velcro closure to keep it open. Very useful.-We like the soft cup holder, better than a hard tray.-We like the padding on the shoulder straps (though they get wet as baby teethed on them).-We like the zippered storage container by the handlebars (great for sunglasses).-It folds pretty flat.-Very smooth ride. (quiet too, nothing rattles).-The brake system and pedal are nice too. It's not the cheap kind of brakes on cheaper Gracos.It was easier that other Graco strollers to put together (just click the wheels on and put the cupholder bar and tray on).Also it seems like a tall stroller (both for baby and us). The handle bar is higher and we think it'll be useful for many years as baby grows.

Like other Thule products, it's expensive but worth it.I'm in the camp of buy something once, what I mean is I'd rather buy something expensive once instead of buying cheap stuff over and over again.This bag is not too big (it's quite compact). You can fit a laptop in it (but I get some sort of sleeve for it).It provides great protection for your expensive electronics; form-fitting padding holds 3 GoPro cameras, 2 extra batteries, 2 SD cards, and more.I really like that you can remove the foam padding from the crush-proof compartment and rinse/clean it.Pretty cool that it allows you to âwearâ 2 cameras at once - one facing forward and one facing backward.The size is nice - big enough for all of your GoPro stuff as well as a few other items while not being too bulky.There are multiple ways to wear it - it has a hideaway detachable waist belt. There are also 2 compression straps on either side of the main body to adjust its size - helps keep your stuff from rattling around inside. It even has 2 hydration ports for if you choose to carry a hydration reservoir (not included) and a clip to attach the reservoir to inside.It has a pouch lined with some sort of felty material to ensure your cell phone does not sustain scratches.Several netted compartments inside the main body of the backpack as well as in the GoPro storage area. There are also side storage pockets as well as zippered pockets in the waistbelt.Very well padded for extra comfort. Zipper pulls are covered in a blue plastic coating that creates loops that are easy to use with one hand and ensure they last.It is extremely well though out.

While this may be a "classic toy" and "great for imaginative play", it is very cheaply constructed. I really donât expect this to last the week.The 24 play food items are actually kinda comical. They include: one bunch of carrots, a wedge of cheese, a bunch of purple grapes, a red apple, some sort of poultry (maybe a cornish game hen, since it is the same size as the apple), a six-pack of eggs, and 13 boxed items (including 2 half gallons of milk, three boxes of raisins, three boxes of rice, two boxes of laundry soap, and three boxes of cereal.) The carrots, cheese, grapes, apple and poultry are roughly the same size and made of somewhat sturdy plastic. I am sure if stepped on by an adult they would become misshapen, but should be pretty kid safe. The six eggs arenât quite as sturdy, which might actually make the more realistic!The shopping cart itself is quite easy to put together, but is made of pretty cheap plastic. While it can hold the included plastic perishables and empty boxes, it will not stand up to much realistic play.

I really like that I can use any bag I want in this pail - I absolutely hate purchasing a product and then having to keep buying stuff to use it (e.g., specific bags for a specific diaper pail).I really like the childproof safety locking mechanism to ensure baby (and/or pet) doesnât get into the diaper pail. I do miss the âfoot pedal-controlled opening mechanismâ, but am fine with trading it for the lock - I donât want to have to clean diapers and their contents from my daughterâs room or around the house! I also appreciate that you can leave the locking mechanism unlocked if you like to live on the edge or your baby isnât mobile yet.             The pail is quite compact and slim - doesnât take up too much room but holds a lot of diapers. (I used 35 - 40 size 4 Kirklands)Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Easy to load - just tuck the top edges of the garbage bag around the bag holder - making sure to place part of the bag between the bag holder and its attached clip. Once loaded correctly, it allows for an airtight seal when you close the pail. There is also an airtight seal around the little opening on top for the diaper.The only time an odor is detected is when you put a diaper in or when you are changing the bag. I donât see an issue with this because with every diaper pail I have used, there is an odor when it is open. When the Ubbi is properly closed, there is no odor. Also, the Ubbi is made of steel so it doesnât absorb any odors.

-It's great.-This is the "force touch" version so as of July 2015, it is the latest version.-Force Touch works great for me. I didn't have to do a single adjustment. It even had secondary (2 finger right click) enabled.-The reason I got this is because someone spilled water on my 17 inch 2011 macbook pro. I dearly miss the larger screen (even if it's not retina) and the matte display. Oh well.-I'm sure you know the specs so I'll skip over that.I bought it directly from amazon (sorry third party sellers I just couldn't get myself to trust you with this much money and seeing that some sellers putting older versions trying to pass it as the latest).I noticed that as soon as Amazon runs out of stock, the third-party-seller price jumps up a few hundred dollars, really made me angry. The out-of-stock Amazon direct price is also higher than the in-stock price... hmmm.My advice is: wait for it to be in stock from Amazon directly and buy it from Amazon directly. You are guaranteed the real deal and you save a few hundred dollars.

I was very excited to try this, but I'm somewhat disappointed.- "No tools" means we included the wrenches. It should be "tools included".- It feels very cheap. The plastic rings between the different sections are very cheap, fragile, and move around with the curtain rings.- I didn't use a measuring tape as the instructions indicated: It wanted me to measure the distance between the walls and set it up 0.25 inches smaller so I can tighten it by hand later. This is impossible to do because getting the angle of the end piece depends on 2 rods.It's better to just try to adjust it between the 2 walls and then insert the screws to set the length.-Oh by setting the length, I mean insert and tighten 2 screws on the bottom of the rods so that the screws deform the inner rods and lodge themselves in there.The good things.It works well.It's very secure.It looks ok.It does give you a little more room.We use the outer rod for towels and save some space in the bathroom.

The book tackles some big issues - the three bears are all âdifferentâ - a brown bear, a polar bear, and a panda.Lessons = unconditional love of a parent for a child and even parents make mistakes. The discipline given to the bears is very well-thought out.Only 4 stars because as long as we are tackling such issues, why not have papa bear make a mistake also? Why just mama bear?Interesting thing about the book: God is mentioned twice on the first page (first line: Three cubs God brought together have...) and once on the last page. If you take this out the book is pretty much the same. I'm not opposed to God being mentioned in children's but I didn't know it was there. The reason it's interesting to me is because it just seems tacked on at the end.

I really like the shape of the tip and that you definitely canât put it too far into babyâs nose but get a great fit for better suction.I also like that you can use this product with the tubing and mouth piece or as a bulb aspirator.Appreciate that the bulb can be taken apart for better cleaning and that it is transparent - you can see if there is gunk inside that needs to be cleaned. Also, you can see what you have sucked from babyâs nose - gross but we are all curious.It is made from material that can be easily disinfected in the microwave or on the stovetop.The only thing I donât like is that the directions state that the filter cannot be used more than once - it is disposable and thus you have to keep buying them. It comes with 7 filters but thatâs not very many if your baby has a typical cold that lasts several days.Has a weird/kinda nasty taste from the rubber tubing.Like that you canât accidentally blow in babyâs nose - there is a one-way valve to prevent this. 4 stars because of the need to keep buying filters.Â Â

This is my favorite Graco stroller so far simply because of the canopy. We had bought a different mesh canopy extender for our other strollers just to keep the sun out of baby's eyes (they don't do well if it's windy). So the canopy alone makes this worth it.So things we really like:-When you extend the canopy part if it is mesh and the baby can see out (not as claustrophobic)-The peek window rolls towards me and has a velcro closure to keep it open. Very useful.-We like the soft cup holder, better than a hard tray.-We like the padding on the shoulder straps (though they get wet as baby teethed on them).-We like the zippered storage container by the handlebars (great for sunglasses).-It folds pretty flat.-Very smooth ride. (quiet too, nothing rattles).-The brake system and pedal are nice too.It was easier that other Graco strollers to put together (just click the wheels on and put the cupholder bar and tray on).Also it seems like a tall stroller (both for baby and us). The handle bar is higher and we think it'll be useful for many years as baby grows.

This is a great idea. It works for a wide range of age.We all need to be able to put the baby down for a little while to take care of life, and this works great.The music is good (doesn't sound like other common stuff).It's gentle enough and comfortable enough.Can't find bad thing to say about it.

This is an ok tablecloth. Some observations- A little bit transparent- The way it's woven and feel makes it look natural (non synthetic)- I think it's a little expensive for what it is- Washes well (stains come out, not as wrinkly)It's 4 stars if you know what you are getting. 2-3 stars if you are expecting high quality...

I don't like toys that want you to buy other toys to be "complete".That being said this works well (even though it's not easy to put together).So even though it works, it really has limited replay value: Bring plane up by hand, it slides down, knocking out fires or tripping a switch to open the plastic thing that has flames on it. Kids might get creative trying to do other stuff with it. I'm just not impressed.

This is a great camera for kids.Yes the video is a little low res (video looks good though). Just think of it as toy.It uses a microSD card (they usually come with adapters so you can use the normal SD slot on your computer).It has a bunch of processing featurs, like picture frames. It even does stop motion videos.It is very durable (rubber edges, even has waterproof case).There is a case for it but it has be purchased separately: VTech Kidizoom Action Cam Carrying Case.I like quite a few settings, helps your kids learn about "real" cameras!.This is an "inexpensive" camera, so if you know that going it, it's good.

This is a good shaver if these types of shavers work for you.This is the 7000 series. It's cheaper than the 9000 series. What you give up is speed control (which doesn't matter), the lcd display (which also doesn't matter), and the drying time on the base (the 9000 series pretends to dry the shaver but it's just an led light show, so you are not losing anything there either)So if you are in the market for this kind of shaver, then this is a good pick.The cartridges are an expense to consider. You can rinse it under the faucet and leave in the base to dry/charger if you really don't want to use the cartridges.The included trimmer/clipper is of excellent quality. You can use it for sideburns or trimming a beard.The shaver is quiet (normal for this kind of shaver).I keep using the words "this kind of shaver" because I like foil and cutter shavers better than these rotary ones (this is personal thing though, these shavers come with guarantees, so you can use them for a few weeks and return them if they don't work for your face). I get a closer shave from the foil and cutter shavers. However the rotary shaver doesn't miss any hair (the foil an cutter refuse to cut some hairs close to my neck. But foil and cutter shavers can get really close to my nose (shaving area above upper lip in chin-dimple.So to conclude, if rotary shavers work well for you, then this is a solid choice

I have never used LeapFrog products. So when given a chance, I was excited to get it for my kid.So this review doesn't compare this to any other LeapFrog products from the past.I have to say that it is a bit of a disappointment.I think it has so much potential but it the games are like web based flash based games form the 1990s.There is some really good stuff in there.I got a few cartridges (Kindergarten, Science, etc).The Science one was more about rote facts than exploring or problem solving. The Kindergarten one had tedious tasks (making the bed, picking the right breakfast etc).I like when the education subjects are numbers/letters.The prices in the "app store" were reasonable (more reasonable than cartridges).It is a little bit slow.I didn't like that I had to agree to a privacy thing.I like the parental controls.I like the hardware, it is very sturdy.The camera is fun.So my advice is a very unhelpful: I don't know.I feel OK letting my kid play with it unattended. I don't know if I would have bought it if I got a chance to play with it yet.For example, I played with the PetPadParty app that's included. I tried to go to different rooms of the house and it said I don't have this room but I can get it at the rewards store. What is that? Is it real store costing money (or is it a reward for getting point playing, I haven't played it long enough so I don't know)? I can't find the rewards store so I don't know.... I will update the review as I know more

It smells great. I thought it was too strong in the shower but it's very very faint after you get done. It smells like men's perfume.It works well in hard water and leaves almost no residue.It doesn't burn sensitive parts.It's great to be down to 1 bottle in the shower (as I look at my wife's bottles... :) )

This is a fine, well balanced chef's knife.It is very slightly blade heavy.The spine is one of the thickest I've seen.The important thing is that it feel pretty good in the hand. And it's sharp out of the box.When cutting with a rocking motion, something is odd with the curvature. If you are near the tip it's fine, but when the handle is close to the cutting board it wants to stop rocking (the blade not curved near the base). Of the several chef's knives I have, this is the only one like that. It's not bad, I just don't like it.Also it is made in China, just FYI.I guess the number of stars this knife gets really depends on the price. I can get a swiss-made chef's knife for about $40.

If you want a cart cover, this is pretty good.I say "if" because I don't think it's a necessity. My wife does.You have to buckle a few straps to the cart and then buckle the baby in so consider that every time to want to use it.The pouches and toys are a nice touch, and I like that if folds into it's own pouch for portability.It is a nice product and it is soft. It does put some padding around the bar on the cart that goes between the baby's legs.

This is the best nail clipper I've ever used.This is based solely on performance. No other clipper can give me shorter nails than this. (I've tried Seki and hated it because I can't get short nails from it.You have to look at the directions though. Ignore all the reviews that say it doesn't cut because it doesn't close (they didn't follow instructions). You have to slide the top handle out then latch it on the groove on top.The leather sleeve included will loosen over time and will fit the clippers very well.I've included 3 pictures.1. Closed for travel.2. Incorrectly set up3. Correctly set up
It's for a cradle (not crib) so look at measurements carefully.It has adequate padding, and the color is nice (no warnings other than size)
The product is great and very soft and padded.Outer shell is cotton and very soft and it's machine washable.You should be aware that is for a cradle, not a crib (i.e. too small for a standard crib).
I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review. It is a well-made leash. The clip is strong and solid.

I received this in exchange for my honest review. It does stop my dog from barking, but I've used other bark collars that I like better. This doesn't have an on/off switch, so the only way to save the battery is to remove it. The prongs are also narrower and therefore sharper than prongs on other bark collars I've used. I think this is probably fine if it's what you can afford, and it should be perfectly safe for most dogs. Usually dogs learn pretty quickly with these collars so you won't need to be using it over a long period of time.

This gives very strong ankle support. It laces up under the velcro wrap, so it's not the type of brace you would wear under an athletic shoe, but it definitely gives good stability to the ankle. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
Nice gloves. Size is right, and the padding is much better than some other riding gloves I've tried. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I was expecting this to have a tingly "astringent" feel when I applied it, but it doesn't. It doesn't feel much different than water with a light citrus scent. But I've been surprised to find how much it has helped my face. I felt a slight change immediately, but what surprised me was to how firm and toned my face felt much later in the day. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Shea butter is not a lotion.  It's actually a fat extracted from the nut of the African shea tree, and it melts at body temperature. So it's really thick, almost solid, just like a chunk of hard table butter. You can't scoop it up in your fingers - you have to kind of dig it out. Then you have to rub it in for a while to let it melt and absorb into your skin.But this really works. It makes my skin very soft. And you can add essential oil to make it into a lotion.I can't comment on the price value for this because I received it at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

When I received this, I couldn't believe how small the package was! This is a full-sized hammock which folds into its own carrying pouch. The pouch is part of the hammock itself, so you can never lose it. It would be nothing to add this to a load in a backpack.The hammock comes with attached carabiner clips and strong nylon rope so you can hang it between two trees. I hung it on my porch instead, using large eye sockets and two huge carabiners that I picked up for a couple of dollars at a big box store.It's made of parachute-type material which seems to be very strong. I am a very large person and I feel surprisingly secure when I lie in it.This isn't the type of hammock with flat sides that stretch it out like a bed; this is a "hang it between a couple of trees and let it wrap around your whole body" hammock. It is very comfortable, a lot more than some other hammocks I've tried. And it actually fits back in its pouch without much effort.I received this in exchange for my honest review, and I really like it.

Good design. This is compact, the two 16" bars fit inside each other, very nice. When you attach them in an "L" configuration they give a lot more torque than a typical lug wrench, about the same as the breaker bar and sockets I had been using before.It comes with several different sized sockets, which is handy and should work on most vehicles. I can't comment on the price value because I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review. But I like it and I'll be using it regularly.

This is wonderful. I spend my summers in bare feet and flip flops, so I have very thick, rough callouses on my feet. This removed them.I've tried using a dremel to do this in the past, but it was tedious and sometimes painful. This was simple and fast. The wide sanding roller prevents me from going too deep in one place, and immensely speeds up the process.My only concern is that since my callouses tend to be so thick, I may have to replace the roller heads a lot. The kit comes with one extra, but I also found them on Amazon for between $3 and  $7 each.I received this in exchange for my honest review, and I'm glad I got it. I can't believe how much softer my feet are after using this. Highly recommended.

I purchased this primarily to replace my collapsable box grater because I wanted something that was smaller and easier to clean.This is definitely easier to clean. The blades are "wedges" instead of the "pyramids" on my box grater, if that makes any sense. So it's easy to turn this one over and wipe it clean. And of course this is smaller than a box grater, but I still wish it was about half the size it is. The blade is about 8: long, but lemons and limes are pretty small. Kitchen drawer space comes at a premium in our house, so I'm not thrilled when gadgets are oversized for no real reason.As some have mentioned, the blades are very sharp and could be dangerous, but it's not a problem for me because I have some cut-resistant gloves similar to these: NoCry Cut Resistant Gloves - High Performance Level 5 Protection, Food Grade. Size Medium. Free Ebook Included!I received this grater at a discount in exchange for my honest review

This is high-quality tape.. But I did have some trouble with it sticking to itself as I was trying to wrap my son's ankle, and it hurt his leg hair when we removed it.I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review

This definitely has a shock to it. I tried it with the side of my hand on low as the instructions recommended, and it was enough to make me pull back quickly. Later I accidently shocked myself when it was on high, and it kind of hurt. I don't think I'll ever use it past the low setting for our smaller dogs.This seems like a quality, durable product. I like that you have the flexibility to use a battery or plug it in.I purchased this at a discount in exchange for my honest review, with the goal of teaching our dogs not to jump on the kitchen table. I can't really tell if it's working because the dogs seem to be afraid of the plastic mat itself. Maybe because they were shocked when I wasn't around.

I only bought this because I received it at a discount in exchange for my honest review. I have never used any eye creams before, and I wasn't expecting a lot. But this seems to really work. I have had fairly heavy dark circles under my eyes for a long time. I began using this about a week ago, and from the second day it has seemed to be helping. I'm just still skeptical that a cream can do this, wondering if it's just wishful believing on my part or a trick of the light. That's why I'm giving it it four stars instead of five.

These are good gloves. They are comfortable and seem durable. The neoprene on the back of the hands feels great, and I like the leather palms. I ordered XL and they fit well. These were purchased at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Like this very much. My dog has been scratching like crazy recently. I almost took her to the vet, but  I decided to wait for this to come from amazon and try it first.  It came today. I sprayed it on her wounds and massaged it into her skin, and the scratching is noticeably reduced, enough that I don't expect her to need the vet. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This makes my face feel firmer as soon as I put it on, and I think it does improve my skin a little. As some others have said, it has a minty smell, which is neither a plus or a minus for me. I don't wear foundation, but I don't think it would be any problem to put foundation over this cream. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I like these a lot! I saw on some reviews that people complained because they are small. They are. They're really tiny, as in you almost need tweezers to position them in a locket the way you want. They run maybe 1/4" to 3/8" wide. But for the heart locket I have (like the one pictured), I really need tiny charms. I could only fit five in my locket without looking crowded, so I wouldn't want them any bigger. Very pleased. Ordering a set like this is a MUCH better deal than ordering individual charms. I got a set of 10 and was able to complete two separate lockets to give as gifts.

I like this. I don't wear a lot of makeup or buy brand name facial products, so I really can't compare it with other brands or price points. But it seems to firm up the skin on my face and I like the smell. I plan to use it regularly. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I really like this.  It is very unobtrusive - not too much larger than a regular belt. The pockets are folded up, expandable when I need them, but out of the way when I don't. And it's waterproof! This is perfect for canoeing, skiing, and other sports where my phone and cash could get wet. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review, and was very pleasantly surprised when I opened it up.One small con: although this fits larger phones, it is not convenient to use that way, because it's a tight fit and a bit of work getting the phone in and out. So I would use this with thinner phone cases or else for something like canoeing, when I don't really need regular access to my phone. If your phone case is very big, there may be better options to buy. Still, this is so nice that it's worth five stars.

I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review, and I wasn't expecting it to be much. But I love it! It's not like the old bulky "fanny packs" - it lays flat against your body and is barely noticeable under clothing. It's big enough for a fairly large cell phone in a thick phone case. There is a very nice little inside pocket for change, an extra mesh pocket (also inside), and a headphone port. All in all a great product. The only con is that my family has already confiscated this from me!

This was effective at removing the pet stain, but difficult to use. The directions require you to dilute the urine by pouring 4-6oz. of water on your carpet to dilute the stain before using this product. That's really a pain, and you're left with a saturated carpet. Then the directions say you can use a towel or a wet vacuum to remove the water after that.I've used a lot of pet stain cleaners before, but never one that was so much work. I like the products I already have, and only purchased this because I received it at a discount in exchange for my honest review. I really don't think I'll use this for quick cleanup of stains again. However, it should be GREAT in a carpet cleaner. I plan to use it that way very soon.

This selfie stick is small, yet very sturdy and durable.  It telescopes quite far, but can easily fit into my pocket.  It is not bluetooth: instead you plug a cord into your phone's audio jack.  The cord is small, convenient and attached to the stick.  Because it is not bluetooth, you never have to worry about your selfie stick running out of battery.  The part that holds your phone easily extends, allowing the stick to work with any smartphone.  My only complaint is that mine came without the wristband.  Overall, it is a great and convenient selfie stick. This product was provided at a discount in exchange for my honest review, and I like it a lot.Update: I emailed the GeeKee Direct to let them know that I didn't receive a wristband, and I received a satisfactory response within 45 minutes. Great customer service.
I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review. It is thinner than I like, but it moisturized my face much better than I expected.

This is a nice case. It's a hard shell case with fabric on the outside, so it protects with both softness and strength. There is also a second layer of protection inside the lid (a padded flap). The lid is also lined with a mesh pocket for more storage.This case is made for speakers, but I'm using it to store small games for travel. I love it. It's small but sturdy and holds a lot.The zipper is a little bit stiff, but I think that it will hold up fine. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This is very nice, The way it adjusts to the size of your phone is extremely smooth and user-friendly. I am using this in an air vent, and I have my charging cable hooked up under it, so it is extremely convenient. I received this at a discount in exchange for my honest review, and I'm glad I got it.
I like the way it feels on my face, and I think it is brightening my skin a little, but I don't like the smell.  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I have never tried Seoul foods so i was very interested in trying this book out and learning about Seoul cuisine.I have had this book for about 3 weeks now and tried a few recipes. 1 i didnt like but 2 were pretty refreshing and interestingly unique and thats what i wanted to experience.The book itself first takes you through some Korean food culture before stepping into the recipes. The recipes are pretty interesting ranging from stocks, sauces, appetizers, soups, stews, rice, noodles, fish, sweets and some unique items i have yet to try.The recipes are very easily shown with a short introduction into the dish. One thing the book lacks is PHOTOS, when it comes to cook books i think they should all have photos and all the recipes should have photos as a guide. When cooking someone else recipes i want to know if mine turned out like the authors finished product and not being able to see  the finish recipes. Being able to compare finished recipes is a great way to know if i done it correctly.All in all even with the lack of photos i ALWAYS enjoy a new cookbook. I have over 100, yes 100 cookbooks and this is my first korean cookbook and though its not perfect, the recipes is the most important and that it has a lot of. I was also lucky to receive this cookbook free to try it out and give my honest unbiased review of it.

I have been using these style of mouse traps for about 2 years now. I have tried others but they all tend to break fast or not good enough at getting the rodents.There is one downfall with these traps, if the mice are VERY small they can actually get on the trap and eat the bait and go. I have had a few times where the bait is missing and trap not sprung.FIX: I recommend you using a liquid bait like miracle whip, they love it and its a great way to stop them from taking the bait and running. Also, take the miracle whip and spread some on the yellow bar then set it. The mice will HAVE to climb on top of trap and will always spring it and they wont take it and run.I received this set in a discount to test them and give them an honest unbiased review but i have bought these a few times already and are great.

9:07 Mins I received this little guy as a gift for my birthday since they knew i love star wars and its a hot item to have for star wars fans and i love it BUT there are drawbacks for other people that might buy him that are not so much into being collectors or star wars fans.Who is this for?I would say this droid is a MUST have for any tech fans, robot fans, droid fans, toy collectors and of course star wars fans. Me being all the above i love this little guy. Its a very cute design, nice packaging, cute sounds, very tech friendly and fun to play with. Any toy, tech or star wars collector would love this little guy in their collection as much as i do.Who is this NOT for?I would not recommend this for kids or casual toy buyers. Though its cute it is very limiting not offering kids anything special except for the cuteness and there is a better option out there for kids that comes with a remote control and no need for smart device/app to control it. Being also very limited it can get boring fast so someone picking him up for the fun of it will be bored with it pretty fast.What do i like about it?Well i love the star wars factor of it. I love most things star wars so i guess that makes me a bit bias when it comes to it. I do love the uniqueness of it with the head almost floating from his body. He can also be a bit fun to control and play with at times and looks great as a nice display/conversation piece. I love how fast it paired to my device and how easy it was to control and get a hang of all the features. I think most people will easily pick up how to control it and have a blast. The hologram messaging is also a pretty awesome feature to have and play with.What do i dislike about it?It is very limiting, there are 3 main features only. Drive it, like it roam around on its own and the virtual messaging system. Two of them gets boring pretty fast and not so fun to use anymore. Controlling him is pretty fun but not much to do there. There is also the voice commands but again there are only a few and kinda are very similar to each other so not much there either. There are also a lack of instructions which would have been a bit more helpful to have. The booklet included should have went more in-depth with full instructions.Hopefully with an update if possible he can receive more voice commands to play with and features. As a star wars tech guy i love him and im glad to include him in my collection.As an adult i would not buy this for kids, i would buy the kids the remote controlled version instead as it is cheaper and will provide kids the same about of fun without having to deal with an app or smartphone.

The water quality is soooo good.I dont like that you have to buy the extension hose if you want to be able to fill it outside the sink and I dont like that there seems to be some kind of price fixing on the filters which have gone up in price considerably but I do like the water quality and slim size of the pitcher enough to keep using but if Filters jump up again in price im going to give these away.
Its a brush.

So far this is awesome. Perfect call quality. No issues of any sort and paying $100 for 5 years of service works for me :)sIve seen this on television for years but thought it might be to good to be true. Well, its all true. This is going to save me $400 this year alone and I purchased the extra 5 years of service for $100. You truly cant beat that.
This stuff is awesome for everything from a long trip, camping or an elderly family member with limited mobility. Great product and price.
I love the taste of my water with these filters but the price is getting ridiculous.

This is my second set. I purchased this when it first came out many many years ago. I use this to make everything from protien shakes to Pina Coladas. I consider this a must have mixer. It's strong, reliable, and so versatile.
These work better for me than more expensive enzymes. Id give these a try for sure :)

These work but for some reason not as good as my cheaper NOW foods digestive enzymes which have considerably less in profile and amount. I wont be purchasing again for myself but I would recommend giving a try because everyone's chemistry varies.

This extender is a must if you dont want your Clear20 in the sink while filling. Sometimes you have things in the sink or its just not sanitary to get food debris on your clear20 so I love being able to use this.I give it 4stars because I think it should come with this in the first place and I feel its just crappy way for them to sqeeze a dollar out of your pocket.

I saw reviews where others received this kit in exchange for a review so I was a bit hesitant but im glade I decided to go ahead and get this.The shears are very sharp and made in simple to make small precise snips. I needed that !The coil jig is simple and makes a perfect coil everytime.The ohm meter is spot on with readings.The pliers and wire cutters are high quality and solid.The 2 in 1 screw driver is very handy and although most mods and RDA/RTA untis come with mini screw drivers this comes in handy.The bamboo mat is a nice thoughtful inclusion and does a good job keeping the area clean.Im new to building coils , I have been vaping for 7 years, and this has everything I needed. My first build went flawless. What more can you ask for?The tools are of good quality and the case is great for keeping everything together. Good kit. I would recommend to anyone wanting an all in one kit for building and testing coil builds.Buying these things seperately wouldnt cost too much more but the fact that this is in a case with lots of room for my extras makes this a great overall value and very convenient.

Men love it too!! Too bad they dont market to men. Personally ive been using the serios skin care line since I was an acne ridden teenage boy.Now in my late 30's I contunue to use these glycolic products and people constantly tell me I look like im in my 20's.Yes, us men take care of our skin and appearance as well. The problem is, most products targeted at men tend to be super inflated in pricing.A similar mens products is $79 for similar ingredients !! Insanity.I'll continue to use Serious sin care til im an old unwrinled man :)

Best toaster I ever had !! Its big enough to allow me to cook chicken and pizza. I love the fact that I can put 6 pieces of toast and the toast is actually toasted all the way through. Delicious !!!Ive had this unit for Two (2) Months and my entire family loves everything about it. I consider this the best bargain among all Toaster ovens.Performance is consistent and incredible !!
Not quite sure if its working. I used the entire bottle and honestly dont see or feel a difference.

These are great. This is my third different type of enzyme product and the one I could actually feel and tell actually works.I purchased more expensive enzymes and they didnt work nearly as good as these.

This actually fit a 2014 Town & Country. I was surprised how it matched the original perfectly and the function was great. The fit was exact and took a bit of wiggling and pushing but the end result was perfection! Saved me $250

Awesome Mug. I find myself using this for everything all the time whether it be coffee in the morning , water through out the day, or a beverage with dinner. I guess what im trying to say is... I love it !!Perfect size and keeps beverage temps on point for a good amount of time. Steel is easy to clean and maintain. Im gonna buy a couple more. One for my dad who keeps eye balling mine :)P.S. Not just for Beer :)

You can find louder speakers and better sounding speakers but we are talking about speakers at the $40 price range and when it come to that this speaker is hard to beat.You can run it on batteries, which last long, I get 10+ hours or run via power cable. I like using this to play music on my phone or play movies on my laptop and this sounds great. Fills my room with plenty of surprisingly rich sound. Movies sound great.You wont be dissapointed if you tried other speakers at this price range. If money is no problem look into the bose minilink for $199.This speaker is a winner.

Melatonin is Melatonin right? Well, sure, but this product is exceptional. Melatonin is best taken in the dark 30 minutes before you sleep. The reason you should take in the dark is because light entering your eyes destroy Melatonin. This product slowly dissolves under your tongue and enters the blood stream for even faster uptake when compared to ordinary tabs. These taste very pleasant so you get to enjoy a nice flavor before dozing off.You get 5mg which is really high dose (Effective Doses can be as little as 1mg) and you can split these in half. The fact that you get 250 of these at 5mg means that if you split them in half you get 500 nights worth which is an incredible value. Natrol is a high quality company with quality control standards which means you get whats on the label.How can you go wrong with this deal? You cant!Great taste.High dosage.250 tabs.Winner!!!
Finally had an opportunity to try it out....and......Nothing. Hunk of Junk.

We just had our first a few months ago and were looking for a mirror for the back seat. I was able to get this product at a discount for my honest review - and here it is: It works well.It came quickly and was easy to set up. We installed it in my wife's Corolla and it took less than 5 minutes. It feels like it is attached well to the headrest and doesn't bounce around while driving. The mirror is crystal clear and large enough to see with minimal effort. It is nice to be able to see the baby while driving and I know it makes my wife more at ease with driving him around. I would, and do, recommend this to friends with new babies.

I purchased the SO&CO New York Men's 5006A.1 Monticello watch at a discount for my honest and unbiased review and I really like this watch.It arrived quickly (which is always nice) and the first thing I noticed was how nice the packaging was â so much so, I took a picture of it for yâall to see below. The watch was protected from scratches during shipping with the clear thin plastic that is easy to peel off.Once I removed the protective wrapping from the watch, I was impressed with how great it looks. Initially, I was confused as to how I opened the watch band, but figured it out pretty quickly. The mesh band looks great and is easy to adjust for a perfect fit â without having to hammer out any band pins.The watch face is a beautiful and dark black, which really makes the silver and white on the face pop. The instructions are clear on how to set the time and change the date. The buttons above and below the adjustment knob advance the day and date respectively and the time is easy to change. The watch comes with a small piece of plastic placed on the adjustment knob so that the battery isnât running before you get it. It is nice to know that I will have the whole life of the battery.I have been wearing the watch for about a week now and I am really pleased with it. So far, it has kept excellent time and looks great for casual use or for work, which is where I wear it most. I have attached some pictures to try and show you how nice this watch is.

I purchased a Stuhrling Original Men's 665B.02 watch at a discount for my honest and unbiased reviewâ¦and here it is. I think that this is a very nice looking watch at an excellent price.I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the (well packed) box to find high quality packaging. It is clear to me that they take pride in their products as everything was padded and all parts of the watch were wrapped with protective plastic to prevent scratches. The box is quite nice and reminds me of a high end scotch box. The warranty and registration information come in the box and are straightforward.After removing the protective wrapping from the watch, I was struck by how nice it looks â the pictures really donât do it justice. The watch face is a beautiful and dark black, which really makes the silver colored numbers and dials pop. The band comes with extra links, so it is quite large until you resize it â which is pretty easy to do. The watch came with the proper time already set; I just had to adjust the date, which is easy enough to doâ¦especially after reading the instructions (you donât have to spin the dial to set the date) which is nice.The watch band does feel light, but I wouldnât necessarily call it cheap feeling as some of the other reviews have. I actually prefer a lighter band as it keeps the watch from âflopping aroundâ on my wrist like some of my other heavier banded watches. I tested the chrono and chrono reset features and all worked flawlessly. I have been wearing the watch for about a week now and I am really pleased with it. So far, it has kept excellent time and looks great for casual use or for work, which is where I wear it most. I have attached some pictures to try and show you how nice this watch is.

These pads are great, total game changer!We use these to cover our baby's changing pad and have tried a few different brands in the past - but they leaked. Leaks don't happen with these, thank goodness. Changing the baby is challenging enough and I can assure you that we have put these to the test with LOTS of fluids of varying types and they do not leak through. They are super absorbent and the backing is completely waterproof. We also put them under the baby in the crib to keep the occasional night blowout contained and not have to do more laundry than we already do. While we use these for the baby, I have no doubt that they would be perfect for pets and incontinence as well. I received these at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review - and I 100% WILL be buying more when we run through these. I am thrilled to have pads that actually work, it makes life with the baby so much more convenient.

I jumped at the chance to provide an honest review for a discounted product. I absolutely love this thermometer. Somehow I have made it this far without one and usually end up burning everything I cook - I try to get it well done enough and go too far. This makes it simple, especially with the included temperature chart.You can tell that it is well designed and is made with care. The ambient temperature reading was within 1 degree of my thermostat and I am confident that it is accurate and will last a long time.

I spent 8 years in the Army as a tanker/Cav scout and wearing rings was something that we were all always worried about. Working out or working around that kind of machinery while wearing a metal ring can "deglove" or remove your finger if it is caught. This silicone ring fits me perfectly and doesn't fall off in water like my cobalt right. I use this for working out or whenever I need to do something that I don't want to lose/dirty up my regular ring....like yard work, swimming, or working around machinery.It is stylish and subdued at the same time and I don't worry about the safety of my finger while working out. I highly recommend this if you want to still wear a ring while being active and not have to worry about losing or damaging your ring...or your finger. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I received this cable and was immediately impressed with the quality and fit/finish. The connectors are a beautiful silver and gold and the jacket is shiny and gray. It is rigid and still flexible and the connectors came with covers to protect them during shipment. The cable shipped securely in a bag and the cable itself has twist ties to keep it wound properly.I ended up using this cable to run from my wall-mounted TV to my receiver, which included running it through holes drilled in the drywall. Usually this process is a HUGE pain, but with this stiffer cable, I was able to easily work it from one hole to the other. The signal quality is fantastic, my HD looks amazing - and of course the TV does most of that heavy lifting but having 4K HDMI helps a ton.I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

First off, I purchased this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I actually bought it for my wife who just had our first baby. She was thrilled and absolutely loves it. She uses it on her face and stretch marks from the pregnancy and couldn't be happier.You can tell that the roller is quality by the packaging and overall fit and finish of the roller.
