Perhaps since this is an uncorrected proof, those were not yet completed? She wants the second book, which we're always thrilled when we have another book series we can have our daughter get into.My daughter's input is: "There once were two sisters. One sister was a ordinary girl. Her name was Olive. She likes science. The other sister is a witch. She likes to play tricks on Olive and her friend, Eddie. One day Olive and Eddie decided to play a trick on Beatrix, the witch. They got a tin can, and went into the garden. They collected spiders to put into the tin can. They put it above Beatrix's door. When she walked in, she was covered in spiders. She had a surprised/scared look on her face. Then she was angry. Beatrix does not like spiders, even though she is a witch. Eddie and Olive high five. Then they heard a crash in Beatrix's room. A potion spilled on the spiders, and they turned HUGE! Done done done!"As we said, my daughter really liked it, and we're thrilled that we have another book series that she's interested in. We'll be pre-ordering book two once available.

We were in need of some under the bed storage bags, and we liked the design/pattern of these. It's a soft design that matches pretty much any decor. The see through top is nice to be able to see what's in it without having to open. The storage capacity is quite high compared to the big plastic tub bins we've typically used.After we got everything in, our kids were moving them out of the way, and the handle broke on one. Here it was the first day and they already broke. The kids weren't playing or being rough with it either. They were just using the handle to move it. Despite that, it functions, but the handle is no longer an option for the one. Because they're such a soft material, if you don't have it filled, the sides will collapse. When you don't need to use them, it is nice to be able to have them collapse and be easy to store away.Overall, we're glad we've got them. We needed the storage. Just wish the handle hadn't broken so easily. We're hoping the other handle holds up longer. As we pull it out from under the bed, hopefully it doesn't break soon.

We picked this book up for my 9 year old son. He loves Diary of a Wimpy Kid and Jedi Academy, so he was pretty excited to hear we had this book coming for him. Although it did say it was Calvin and Hobbs style, I forgot that when it arrived. That was fine though, and he breezed through the book in about an hour. He is even excited for the sequel that comes out in 2016. I can't even complain about my son reading, even if it is more of a comic book style. Any excuse to get him away from "screen time" and reading is a plus.His comments about the book are: "The book was really funny. I liked the comics. Hilo thinks how you say hello is 'Ahhhh.' He can shoot lasers from his hands and can fly. He's actually a robot. At the end, he goes back into a portal where he came from, and then DJ at night he hears Hilo. Turns out it's just his toe."

We picked up two new super soakers to replace some aging ones we had. Since it's now summer, we wanted to have some good family water fights.My kids were especially excited about this one, since it had four nozzles. It was the gun they were all fighting for. Even my 3 year old was able to operate it just fine. Note that unlike other water guns (and even regular super soakers), this gun doesn't really have a trigger. The pumping is what actually shoots out the water. I think this is why it worked well for my 3 year old. She was able to pump and shoot us all just fine. if she had to pump and pull a trigger, I'm sure it wouldn't have worked as well.The gun can hold a pretty good amount of water, although I do prefer the other new super soaker that holds more (43 ounces) and allows you to hook it to a hose. Unlimited water is the way to go! This gun isn't bad though, and certainly lasts longer than many of our older guns. Just compared to the other super soakers now on the market, this is definitely more of a mid-level water gun.

This thing is awesome. We've been in need of some good water guns, as our past ones needed to be retired. These were a great choice. We picked up another new super soaker, but these were my personal favorite.As advertised, you can put a pretty good amount of water in it. I LOVE the fact that you can even hook it up to a hose for non-stop water. We didn't do that originally, and still found ourselves having to refill fairly quickly, although our opponents were certainly soaked by that time.Unlike the super soakers I was used to as a kid, you really don't have to pump to get the water to go farther. They've got these things down where you pretty much get a pretty distant shot from the get go with minimal effort. Pull the trigger, pump, and you're soaking people with ease.

This is very soft and durable. Love the design, raspberry coloring,and fabric. It has higher sides where head is, so our 4 year old childcan lean their head nicely. It is a bit more bulky then I thought. Butit works just fine buckling it.It will last for years to come and has a lot of options for growingwith my child. Highly recommend!

We've been in need of some new placements for our girls. They had some others that were getting old, and the design was coming  off. Both of my girls (3 and 6) like Minnie Mouse, so when we showed them this they were quite excited. A 4 pack makes it nice too, since we'll have two extras to replace them with when they go bad.Both kids loved them when they arrived, and were actually fighting over who would get them. Luckily there were 4, so they were both able to have them. They thought there was just one as they're all packaged together.We've been happy with them so far after about a week. They're a little small compared to others we've had, which is really the only negative thing I can find. They do wipe off easily with a wash cloth. Even with sticky syrup from breakfast waffles comes off without issue. Otherwise, a 4 pack for $10 is probably a little too expensive too, but it's not horrible. We're overall quite happy with these.

I picked these up for my wife for Mother's Day. She was quite excited to open them and see not only the message, but how they looked. It's a very thoughtful gift, in my opinion, and one that she definitely enjoyed. My wife didn't realize it was a separate bracelet for the key. She thought it was both on a necklace. That added to the surprise.The item comes in a small grey cardboard/paper wrapped box. Not too big, but just the right size. Upon taking the top off, you can easily see the heart that reads "Here is the key to my heart." For the price, it's not bad at all for the set. I'm sure it's one my wife will enjoy for years to come.

I've had portable phone chargers for a long time, but have recently really enjoyed the cases that offer the same functionality. As one who travels a fair amount, it's nice to have a device that can easily charge my iPhone 6. I typically find myself charging my phone at least once during the middle of the day, so I can get through the entire day. This case has helped address that. I'd had a competitors version previously, but it literally stopped working after two times.Otterbox, of course, has been around for awhile with regards to protection. Finding one of their products that offered charging was a great find in my mind. Putting the phone in the cast was pretty easy, although it did take some force at times. I literally thought I might break the front panel portion at times, but it lived up to the Otterbox name, and didn't break. I simply then slid the phone in, and put the front protector back on.The back "button" for charging is pretty cool. It's a nice indicator, and is easy to touch when holding the case. I recently went to a trade show in Las Vegas, and brought the case. Once my phone hit 14%, I started charging my phone again. It got me back up to 80%, and I was able to survive the rest of the day just fine.A couple issues I had, at times my iPhone complained about "this accessory not being authorized" which was a little cause for concern. I was surprised, especially from Otterbox, that I'd receive such a message with the case.I also wish the case could be charged with a lightning cable. The micro USB is fine, but I usually have a lightning for my iPad. I prefer to not have to lug around another cable if I don't have to. Not a deal breaker, of course, but would've been nice.Overall, I've been quite happy with it. I wish it would've charged up my phone more, but it does it enough. It's certainly strong, and I'm sure it won't die after such little use as my last one.

We've been in need of a new towel for our 9 month old son, and thought this would be a good option. After arriving, we thought the monster face was cute (not that our baby really cares either way), but we felt that way. We washed it, and, since it is 100% cotton, it did shrink. It's now about 29.5" x 295." inches compared to what was advertised (32" x 32")The hood is nice to keep the baby's head warm and help dry it off. It's definitely not thin and flimsy like some other baby towels we've used. Definitely soft.
These sheets are extremely soft! The white seems to have a hint ofgrey to it but that doesn't bother me. They feel like luxury hotelsheets, nicer then I've ever purchased before.

We have been very pleased with the Star Wars twin comforter. The styling is very attractive and the colors are vibrant.  The stitching is well done and holds up to washing.  My son who has been using it says he stays comfortable temperature wise while sleeping under the Star Wars comforter.

With living in Utah, with the dry climate, we're always putting on lotion. Curel has been one of our more favorite brands. This lotion doesn't fall short of what we've come to expect from Curel. It goes on nicely, and certainly feels good afterwards. With kids though, we often find ourselves washing our hands, so we're back to reapplying the lotion.My wife gets really bad cracks near her cuticles here, especially during the winter, so she loves using this lotion. It's not as good as the O'Keefe Working Hands product for healing those cracks, but she finds it does work better than a lot of other brands.

We've been in need of a new shower head for a long time. We'd previously had a Waterpik head that I quite liked. We don't have a water softener, so it was, over time, getting the hard water build-up. Several of the holes were getting clogged. The Waterpik only had two options, one being a massage.This new shower head is pretty awesome. My wife loves the fact that it will make cleaning the shower easier with the removable head. There are a slew of settings. You can adjust settings for just the removable head, and then there is a switch in the back to make a couple additional settings. These include having both the removable head and the main head turn on/off. There is a massage setting you can turn on that utilizes the center of the removable head. Unfortunately, it's pretty obvious our water pressure is lacking, as that doesn't work too well. I'd be much more happy with the shower head if that was the case. I realize it's not necessarily a fault of the product, but it is something to consider.Installation was extremely easy. Screwed off the hold head, put on the new one. Screwed on the hose for the removable head to the main head and then to the removable portion. Then we were set.One other thing we ran into was with our wire shower basket. With how it was, it made it really impossible to position the shower head lower. We've ended up getting another one that has a split in the middle. Makes it lots easier to get our shower products versus having the cord hanging down the middle. We can, of course, now move the head position, which makes all the difference in the experience.

We got this book for my 9 year old son. He's an avid reader, and was extremely excited when we showed him this book. He's been really into books like Diary of a Wimpy Kid, Diary of a 6th Grade Ninja, Origami Yoda, and others. This, in his mind, was just as excited. Although I didn't read the book myself, I noticed he couldn't stop reading it. We received it on Tuesday, and he was done 3 days later. Not bad, considering he's in school half of the day.Here is what he had to say, "Pretty interesting. A boy named Max likes to learn about bugs. He goes to Bug Island, and helps out the Bugs during the battle of the lizards. I'm excited to get the other two books. When I looked on the back cover, The Poison Frog Assault looked very interesting."There you have it.. Can't complain when my son is happy with a book.

I've typically been a user of Degree or Dove products for deodorant for sometime. We've used Tom's for our kid's toothpaste, and they've liked it. A few other products as well. Seeing that they've gotten into the deodorant market, we figured we'd give it a try.I've been quite happy with it so far. I do think I'd prefer an anti-perspirant in it as well, but it's not bad. It has a nice, fresh scent, and not something extremely overpowering like others. After sweating quite a lot, it definitely works. Can't beat that!

We needed some new wipers for our 2012 Kia Sedona, so I thought I'd give these a try. The drivers side wiper is the correct size, but the passenger size is larger than the standard wiper for the Sedona. That being said, both fit, and work fine.Installation was a breeze, as expected. The included instructions have pretty good instructions for nearly every type of blade install. Our Sedona had the J hook version, so after sliding off the old blades, we simply had to pull up on the tab and slide the new blades on. Then close the tab. Very easy to do, as I expected. I've never really run into any issues installing wiper blades. They're a pretty standard thing to do.The quality of the blades themselves definitely feel more sturdy and superior compared to the old, standard blades they replaced. They reminded me of the blades on my 2014 Mazda 6.After trying them out, they definitely work. Very quiet, and slide over the windshield wiping the moisture away. There is one somewhat large section, slightly out of view (it's behind the rear view mirror) where the blades swipe, but don't actually seem to clear the water away. It's not necessarily a problem, as I mentioned, it's out of view, but I did find it odd that the wipers didn't clear that area as they should. We've had some pretty ferocious snow storms lately, and using them, even at high speeds, worked fine (except for that one area).Overall, I feel pretty good about these. Install was easy, they work as expected, are quiet, and feel sturdy. What more can you really ask for a pair of wiper blades? Hopefully they'll last awhile.

We've been potty training our daughter for awhile, but she's finally started to catch on the last week or so. We've been in need of some training pants, and these have been fantastic. They're, hands down, the best ones we've used. We particularly like the tab on the back that allows you to cinch up the pants afterwards, like a diaper. Others are more like pants. It's nice to be able to clean up when a mess does occur. Otherwise, they are pretty similar to pull-ups and the other generic brands we've used.The other side note we have is our daughter didn't like the "scary tiger" on the front, but it wasn't a problem. After we put it on her, she didn't care anymore.

We picked up this book for my 9 year old son. It looked like a great book, with a wonderful premise. He read through the first several chapters and felt it was a little slow, but by chapter 6, it started to get really exciting. That is when the characters from the books Billy was reading started to come to life.My son says, "Billy meets a boy named Walter. These 3 mean boys get a new game called Space Lizard, and Walter ends up getting trapped in the game. Billy saves him. The Sheriff of Nottingham puts up a wanted poster for Robin Hood and Billy."In the end, my son really loved the book. So much so that he wants to read the book before it about Mr. Lemoncello's library.

My wife and I have been using memory foam pillows for a long time, but mostly the ones from Costco. We've certainly enjoyed those pillows, although the new "craze" there seemed to be having gel on one side and memory foam on another. I've always preferred the memory foam side, as the gel side was always a little too hard for me.With this pillow, everything has changed. It features, gel as well, but versus having a solid gel side, it's all blended in with the memory foam. The shape of the pillow itself is a little different than a regular pillow with more rectangular ends versus a sloping edge. We were expecting that to be a little less comfortable. Boy were we wrong. It's fantastic. Extremely comfortable. My wife comments on how when she uses it (we've swapped pillows for a few nights to test) that her neck doesn't seem as stiff in the morning after using this pillow.Considering the price of the pillow compared to the previous ones we've purchased, I'm assuming it's a better form of memory foam, causing the price to be almost double the price we'd paid in the past. That being said, we've been very happy with this pillow. My wife won out, and gets to use it all the time, but I think I'm going to have to get myself one soon.

We've been in need of a new shower curtain for a long time. We've had one for close to 10 years, that really needed replacing. We'd recently replaced the bath rugs, and thought this brown would look nice with the colors we had for the rug. Of course, installation was easily done. Simply sliding the rings into the applicable holes on the curtain. We're really happy with it!The only real downside to it is due to the color, it does make our shower darker. It's not really a big deal, but that certainly was one thing moving from the lighter color (and somewhat see through) curtain we had before. I guess there is one other downside. It's not see through, so you can't peak in on your significant other showering. :-)

WOW! I was blown away after hooking up this speaker and using it via bluetooth with an iPhone. It's a pretty decent size (not too big), features speakers on both sides, and, simply sounds amazing, even when using lower bitrate MP3's. Beyond just how fantastic it sounds, it has some great features as well. 18 hour battery life makes it easy to use without having it plugged in to power. The ability to charge devices via USB, answer phone calls, are also nice features.We intended to use it for our daughter's room, but I'm a little jealous, and wanting to swap it out with a similar Panasonic bluetooth speaker we have in our living room. The Panasonic doesn't even come close to the sound the Braven offers.The product comes with several different power adapter types, enabling charging in different countries. A nice plus. You easily pair it with a bluetooth device by pressing the play button. The speaker begins to beep, and then shows up under the bluetooth devices to pair. Enter 0000 as the key, and you're set. You can also physically hookup an audio device using the included mini headphone jack input.Again, I'm blown away by this speaker. It sounds GREAT! For $200, it's well worth the price for what you get. I've had similar products in the past, and none even come close to comparison in features, and sound.

This is a pretty decent case. We're using it on my son's 7th generation Kindle. It fits just fine, and has a pretty decent design. He's 9, and likes it. I was a littler surprised that it advertises a microfiber interior, however, it's not like the regular microfiber I'm used it. It may certainly be microfiber, but it seems more like a vinyl.The case front folds backwards just fine to help reading be easier. It features a strap enclosure, which I personally feel is a little cumbersome. I much prefer the magnetic closures of other cases. Again, it's for my 9 year old son, so it's not really a big deal for him. When I've opened his Kindle, I've found the strap often twisted. A cosmetic thing, which really doesn't affect performance in any way, but I hate it when things are twisted like that.For $30, it's not bad at all. It looks fine, feels nice, doesn't add too much bulk, and does the job. It's 4 stars is merely from my personal preferences for other cases I've seen, which I think could bring the case to easily be a 5 star product.

What a great product! We've installed it in our master bathroom, and it's been working fantastic. We have a custom shower head added to our shower, and it slips right on behind it without an issue. The top shelf we use for our body wash, the second for the shampboo, conditioner, face wash, etc. The last one my wife has he razor and we have our loofahs hanging on the hooks.While we've not been using it long, it has yet to slide down like our previous shower holders. There is plenty of storage room for everything we need (my wife likes to switch off brands of conditioner and shampoo, so we have several of each). I love the fact that it won't rust (we've had that issue with past ones as well). Overall, a well designed, and great product. Price isn't so bad either.

I've been a long time user of Nivea post shave balm, up until recently, when Dove introduced their Dove + Men Care line. I've pretty much used Dove's product since, but really have enjoyed going back to Nivea. The packaging, of course, is much more solid, as it's not plastic like Dove's product. I've typically used the sensitive version, but adding the cooling sensation really helps me, personally. While my face usually feels better, adding that cooling really seems to help with the burning I occasionally have after shaving. I'll definitely be back to using Nivea product more.

We were blown away at how soft this bath rug is. It really does feel nice, especially on bare feet, and would be considered quite "luxurious" in our minds. Since we have a bunch of little kids, pee, throw up, etc always seem to end up on the bathroom rugs. Having a stain master version is a huge plus for us. We had a few "accidents" occur, and they washed out without issue, although, that being said, we've never really had problems with past bath rugs either.Why only 4 stars? Our biggest issue is the size. It's really small. 17 x 24 is, in our opinion, a size that really shouldn't even be made. We have it in a downstairs half-bath, which is a tiny bathroom, and it doesn't even cover what we'd like to have covered. It certainly works, but this particular size is much too small. the 24 x 40 in seems to be a much better size for us.

I love my iPhone 6, but usually do have to end up charging it halfway through the day. These new, ultra slim cases/chargers are a great concept, and still make it so the device isn't too bulky. It's still weighs more, etc, but that is to be expected..and for some, can be well worth it to suddenly have the ability to get through the day with a single charge.As one who travels fairly often, and finds myself away from convenient means of easily charging my device, I've been one who has carried around an external battery charger for sometime to handle this ability. It worked, but certainly wasn't as slickAfter receiving the ZuZo case, I quickly wanted to try it out. Packaging was pretty obviously from China, with UDB stated instead of USB in several  places, but the product itself looked nice. It appears to be utilizing the "painted rubber," which has a nice feel to it. It has two pieces that separate allowing you to slide the iPhone into place. This was fairly easy, but I did struggle with the top part. I couldn't get it to align properly, and it took several tries before I succeeded. Perhaps due to it being new, it was a little tighter, as I've not experienced this issue since.The battery itself was charged about 50%. My phone, at the time, only had about a 20% charge, so I gave it a try. The lights began flashing on the bottom and my iPhone gave the "charge" sound, and did show the lightning bolt in the upper right corner. After about an hour, the battery was depleted, and my phone was charged to about 70%. I did still use the phone fairly often during the charging process, so I was quite happy to see so much charged despite the lack of being fully charged.After plugging it in to charge back up, I was able to fully recharge the battery itself in about 3-4 hours. It's worked fine since for me, and has fully charged my phone after nearly being out of battery life. The best part is, it has a larger battery than my iPhone 6 does, so I can even charge it more after fully charging it once.All in all, a great device. Price is pretty comparable to others, and it looks fine. My only concern would be longevity, especially since other reviewers have commented on them failing pretty quickly. We'll see how mine does, going forward.

We've been a longtime Leapfrog fan, having owned most of the Leapfrog gaming systems. The LeapTV, obviously, is a new entrance for the company, and one that intrigued me.The Sports game, at least at first glance, reminded me of Wii Sports, although with the Leapfrog twist. My kids definitely enjoy the game, with my 8 year old son enjoying Karate the most. My 6 year old and 3 year old daughters both enjoy the swimming game. Throughout the game you're asked questions, mostly math, from what I've seen so far.There is a bowling game, skateboarding, swimming, karate, baseball, soccer, snowboarding and more. Lots of difference choices, with the options to play with up to 4 players. Some games, such as baseball, require you to adjust the controller to act like a baseball.As a parents, the biggest thing I like is the amount of activity it causes the kid to incur to play the game. For karate, they're literally karate chopping, trying to bowl a ball, swing a bat, etc. Again, reminds me of Wii Sports, but they're asked math questions to proceed through the game. The bowling game, for instance, requires you to "charge" up your bowling ball. This is done by selecting the correct amount of balls that the game indicates are required, and then asks a math question.The kids love it. I'm happy we have a game that, like the Leapsters, is one they can all play together while being active. It's not only the Wii U we have to play, they can play LeapTV. Very similar process to the Xbox Kinect system.My only frustration is with the stability of the game. This may be the LeapTV's problem versus the game itself, however. There are times my son was trying to start the game. Proceeded to a quick event, and next thing he knows, he's back at the main LeapTV menu. To make matters worse, the Sports game wasn't even an option to select. This required the cartridge to be removed, and then reinserted for it to work. Again, this may be an issue with the LeapTV itself, but since this is our only game, I'm unable to verify this further. It's definitely a frustration for my kids.Otherwise, great game/system, and one that certainly meets a need many parents are looking for in an entertainment yet educational game.

First off, Iâll say that if you need the infant insert (for a baby younger than 4 months they require that you use it), this is the item to buy, as you get the insert with the carrier. Not all Ergo Baby carriers come with the insert, you have to purchase it separately. My baby is older than 4 months, so I did not try out the insert, so that specifically will not be a part of this review.The first thing I noticed with my carrier is that the buckle on the waist strap seems to be backward. I had to twist the strap in order to buckle it so that the end of the strap that you pull to tighten and adjust is on the outside, not facing my body. This problem left me unable to tighten the strap once it was on me.  I ended up removing the strap from the buckle and turning it, so now it is correct.The carrier is lightweight, and not bulky. Overall itâs pretty comfortable to wear. The padded shoulder straps feel nice, and the waist belt helps to take some of babyâs weight off my back and shoulders.One cool feature that I like is that each of the straps (the waist one and both shoulder straps) have an elastic band at the end so you can roll the excess strap and secure with the elastic so you donât have straps hanging down and getting in your way. Another thing I like is the included âhoodâ which is permanently attached to the carrier, so itâs there when you need it, but it tucks away in the front pocket when you donât need it.The instructions included with the carrier are terrible, just some drawings with no detailed explanations of how to use it. They do not show clearly how exactly to use this carrier. I recommend going to their You Tube channel (URL is included in the instructions) and watching the how-to videos, which make it very clear how to use the product.It is a little awkward to try and support my baby and fasten and adjust the âchest strapâ (which is on your back when using the front carry). When the chest strap is placed properly (at your shoulder blades), it is hard to reach behind you to fasten the buckle. Itâs easier to fasten the buckle if the strap is placed higher, just below your neck, but then itâs too difficult to move the strap down in the proper place. I had my husband help me fasten this strap. This, along with other features, will just take some practice to do it smoothly (and on my own).I wish it had the option to carry my baby forward facing, because I think that would be nice when he gets a little older â heâd probably rather see out to where weâre going. You do have the option to side (or hip) carry, but I have not tried this method out with my baby as he is not quite big enough for this position.The first time I really used this â not just at home, but out at the store â my shoulders hurt a little after about 30 minutes of use. This was not bad, however, compared to another carrier I tried previously (when my baby was much smaller). With the other carrier, my shoulders and back hurt a lot after just 20 minutes of use. The next time I used it, I carried my baby for almost an hour, with no pain at all. I think the straps may not have been all adjusted properly the first time. My baby was content and even fell asleep both times in the carrier. He seems happy and comfortable in it. I sure wish I had this carrier with my first three babies! This such a great item to have.At first, I was going to give this less stars, but as I continued to try out the carrier and practice with it, it got easier to use, and I figured out  the little âproblemsâ I had initially that made me not like this carrier at first impression. As I continue to use this carrier, I like it more and more. I look forward to trying out the other positions â side/hip carry, and back carrier (when my baby is older).

This is my first experience using in shower lotion. I have very dry skin, especially in the the winter, so I use lotion (and plenty of it) on a daily basis. I thought the concept of using lotion in the shower seemed unusual, but I was willing to give it a try, and see if it helped moisturize my skin better than regular lotion. One of the first tests I do with lotions, body washes and the like is the smell test. The Nivea lotion has a light fresh scent just as I like it.  The result: it left my skin feeling very soft, almost slippery, but not greasy. I liked how my skin felt, but it did not feel moisturized as it does when I use regular lotion after the shower. Though my skin felt soft, it did not seem that the product penetrated my skin, but rather just made the surface feel nice. The softness lasted all day, which is a plus. While Iâll continue to use this product, I will probably not purchase this to use again.

This stuff is AWESOME! I own a 2014 Mazda 6, and recently went to a Mr. Hotshine car wash to have my car cleaned. They did the whole interior and exterior. A day or so later, I noticed this white film of residue from whatever cleaner they were using for my leather seats. Due to illness and other things, I never got around to trying to clean it off. Literally months later, it was still there, and was just an eyesore to me every time I got in the car.We had some leather cleaner from when we picked up another car that I figured I would try. I'm not even sure the brand. It was pretty generic and probably a private label deal from the car dealership anyway. When I used that, it appeared to have removed the white film, but after drying, the film was still there.Along comes the Chemical Guys leather cleaner. After receiving it, in a nice ziplock back with the sprayer separate, I gave it a try. It was immediately obvious this was going to work. I went through and followed the directions of spraying it on a microfiber cloth then using another cloth to buff the seats. Boy did it work! My car seats looks brand new again! This product is fantastic, and quickly went to work on out 2012 Kia Sedona as well. It did just as good of a job on those seats. I've been sold. This is awesome, and I plan to continue to use it.The ONLY downside I experienced was the sprayer I received had a tube that was too long for the bottle. I ended up cutting a bit off, and it works fine.If you need a leather cleaner, this is the one. No doubt in my mind.

I got this book for my 8 year old son. We were a little surprised to see it's in a comic book format, but he was more than thrilled about that. It's about 185 pages, and he breezed through the book in a matter of hours.His input on the book is, "There is someone in the book that says sandwich names differently. There is a group called Lizzarks that attack Herk's (the main character) Mom. Herk escapes. I'm excited for book 2 to come out."He really liked the book a lot (which was pretty evident by how quickly he read it). The comics are well illustrated, and, while I didn't read the whole thing, I was even entertained by what I read.With comics making a come back, I'm not surprised my son liked the book. He absolutely loves reading, and I found it nice having a book that was longer, but still with the great illustrations/artwork.

I've recently tried out the Axe version of the antiperspirant spray, and liked the product. I've been a big fan of the Dove Men+Care products, so was quite happy to see they'd come out with their own version. Although, I think I prefer the Axe scent over the Dove version (my wife feels the exact opposite), I was quite happy with the Dove product as well. It certainly does the job it's advertised to do. although, I do with it had a deodorant as well built-in. Compared to the Axe, you get 0.4 oz more, in a slightly taller container. The Axe also has a cool lid that you turn to enable you to spray. The Dove simply has a removable top, and then you spray. Both indicate to spray 6 inches from the underarm.Definitely a good product, and I'm eager to see what Dove continues to come out with for their men line.

I've typically not used Axe products in the past, but have on occasion. This one peaked my interested, so I picked it up. Once it arrived, before spraying it on myself, I gave it a try in the room to see how it smelled. My wife hated it, and couldn't stand the smell. She didn't want to go into that room for hours afterwards.I've since tried it on myself, and personally like the smell. I wish it was also a deodorant, but it seems to do its job as an anti-perspirant.

We recently saw the movie, and my 8 year old son was floored when he saw this. It looked like a pretty sweet toy, and so we picked it up for him. When it arrived, he tore open the box, and instantly went to work on putting it together. We were busy in another room, and it was close to bedtime, so when he came back to where we were frustrated, I assumed it was due to him not having time to finish putting it together.The next morning, he went right back to work on it before school. He couldn't get it to work, and tried asking my wife and I for help. We had a few things we were doing for our other kids, so told him I'd look at it later. When I finally got a chance, I could see why he was frustrated. The parts are a pain to put together. The biggest problem is they pop off. Once you get it on, you'll find as you're putting on another part that the one you had just done pops off. The instructions are just photos, so nothing is really explained. My wife and I tried out best to fully put on his armor, but were not successful.All it in, it looks cool, and would be cool, if it didn't require an adult to assemble. Very frustrating for kids at the targeted age.

My background is in pro audio and video. As a consumer product, the Samsung provides exceptionally clear sound at all volumes, with various EQ settings for differing music styles and purposes. The system is effective as a home DJ unit and the lights are a fun addition. Its multiplicity of inputs ranging from bluetooth to usb to stereo mini aux in, and the compatible TV mode, make it easy to stream music from any source. The karaoke mic input is a nice touch. It kicks out great bass and fills a large space well. It was not made to move around, but serves very nicely as a home component system with great sound. An excellent choice for house dances, audio for home video, and all around music listening. It plays back rock, pop and orchestra soundtracks with good detail. The speaker cabinets are particle board with veneer, the grilles are plastic. It does not have XLR or 1/4 inch inputs, but one would not expect that on a consumer product. Would be nice to have an auxiliary out jack to feed additional speakers or record karaoke, but you can record to a usb device instead.Overall well-conceived and executed, and perhaps a bit overpriced.

We've been in need of a replacement car seat, as our current one for our 2 1/2 year old is set to expire in August. We'd previously had an Eddie Bauer car seat, which she'd been using for sometime. It's been great, but it's nearly 5 year old age is showing. Fabric is fraying, etc.This one came along, and we'd never heard of the brand, Diono. My wife, as a result, was somewhat concerned. Checking other car seats by the manufacturer, however, were very positive. Most had 4 1/2 stars with over a thousand reviews. You don't see that very often on Amazon unless the product is good.Once it was received, the first thing my wife commented on was how heavy the box was. Later in the day, took it out of the box. It is quite heavy. Although they market it as being able to be very easy to fold up, etc. I'm not sure I'd want to lug around such a heavy car seat. I guess people do, however.Unpacking was pretty straightforward. I slid it out of the box. Everything was packed nicely. Some straps were folded up and secured with rubber bands, while others were with the zip ties you can purchase. It was, as a result, quite easy to unpack.Since the car seat comes folded up, I had to figured out how to unfold it. The manual had about 5 easy steps that helped me to do. I then followed the instructions for setting it up for my 2 1/2 year old. Literally, in 10 minutes, I had this thing unpacked and ready for install in our minivan.The next morning, I embarked on the task of installing the car seat. After removing the old Eddie Bauer seat, I placed the new Diono one in the same spot. Literally 5 minutes later, I had it installed. It was a bit more loose then I'd like, especially considering that I'd installed it with the latch system. I did also utilize the top anchor that goes around to the back of the seat for additional support.After further inspection, I noticed the latch belt was twisted. I was able to simply detach the latches with the convenient buttons they have built-in. I adjusted the belt, and snapped it back on the latch. Tightened the belt further, and it was as tight as I wanted. Right now we have it front-facing, but I suspect rear-facing would be just as simple.The cup holder solution is pretty slick. It has this built-in rod that you slide into a hole in the car seat. The fabric is cut to have a hole just the right size for the rod. Slide it in, and it snaps just fine.My 2 1/2 year old loves sitting in her "new seat." We're happy so far too. Nice to have a seat that will last 12 years.

We've been big fans of the Leapster, and all 3 of our kids old enough to use them have them. We're always in the market for good, new games, and this is another one that doesn't disappoint. My 6 year old daughter commented, "It's very fun. It's like Adventure Sketchers. You have missions, and learn lots of things."After hearing her say that, I had to give the game a try myself. I was quite impressed. As she mentioned, there are several missions (levels) you get to choose from. It's a side scrolling game (reminds me of the old Mario games). You collect jewels, can obtain hearts if you run into Wasps or other obstacles, and end up seeing various animals throughout your journey. You take photos, and are asked several questions about the animals. These include, what kind of animal is it (i.e. mammal, fish, etc). The game them goes on to explain more about the specific animal, and some interesting facts.Overall, I think it is a great game to teach kids about animal science facts. My 8 year old, unfortunately, didn't like it, but I think it's really because he found it too easy. For my 6 year old, however, it's perfect.The only downside I saw was how long it took for the game to load. There were often times when I was playing that it said, "loading" and I had to wait for 5-8 seconds before it proceeded. For kids with little attention spans, they may become frustrated with this.

I love to sew, so I was very excited to receive this Brother Embroidery machine to try out. I own a Brother sewing machine and a Brother Serger, so I am familiar with Brother products. I should mention though, that you do not need to know how to sew in order to use this machine. However, since I already knew how to thread a standard sewing machine, I was able to thread this one without any issues. Before setting up the machine, I read through the manual to familiarize myself with the machine. I must admit, I felt a little intimidated and wondered if this was going to be more trouble than itâs worth. That being said, the instructions were very well written; clear, detailed and concise. Pictures are included to help with the steps.Included with the machine is a seam ripper, small scissors, 4 bobbins, needles, touch pen (stylus for use on the touch screen if desired), a plastic cover to protect it from dust, bobbin thread, a cleaning brush, three spool caps for keeping the spool of thread in place, and a USB cable for connecting to the internet to download more designs. There is also a reference guide which shows the included designs in color, indicating which colors you need and in which order for each design, as well as the amount of time it takes to stitch it.Once I began setting the machine up, I found it very easy to do by following the instructions. (The first time took me some extra time as I was learning how it all went together.) After attaching the embroidery unit, winding and installing the bobbin, threading the machine, preparing fabric and attaching the embroidery frame, I was ready to select a pattern to test out. I as thrilled when, by just sliding a lever, the machine threads the needle for you! What an excellent feature; no need to squint my eyes to try and thread the needle myself. This feature is very helpful when changing the upper thread color in the middle of a multi-color design.The touch screen on the machine is very easy and straightforward to use. It was easy to navigate to find the pattern I wished to sew. I selected a pattern (I began with a one color letter), pressed the start button, then sat back and watched the machine do the work. The results were beautiful! When sewing a design with two or more colors, the machine stops in between colors, then tells you which color you need to use next, along with which part of the pattern it will be stitching. Changing the thread between colors is very easy to do. (You do not need to change the bobbin thread â I just keep white in the bobbin.) Once the machine stops after completing a color or the full design, with the push of a button, the thread is cut so you can either change to the next color, or remove the frame. (You can also set it to automatically cut the thread once the color is completed.) The machine comes pre-loaded with 70 designs including various alpha-numeric fonts, holiday designs, flowers, animals, and of course Disney-Pixar designs too! You can also purchase and download other designs from the internet, which can be saved directly to the machine.You can visit ibroidery.com to purchase and download more designs. The designs are a little pricey, especially the licensed character ones, but you get many more possibilities than just what came with the machine. I received a coupon code for a free download with the machine â 2 butterflies. I found their website to be less than friendly. Once I created an account, I had to keep signing in as I navigated through the process to register my machine and download a design. But, once that was done, I connected the UBS cable and loaded the design onto the machine.The machine is not super heavy (as my serger is), but seems solid. Since I donât have space to keep the machine out, I have to store it away when not in use. Itâs easy to move and pack away, then set up again when needed.In summary, this is a great machine. It is very easy to use, and does the hard work for you. Iâm pleased with the results and the designs that this machine can produce.

I have long been fascinated with the stories of World War 2, which is why I chose to read this book.  The story focuses on two sisters - Isabelle and Viannâ  in occupied France, and what they did to survive the war. While the characters in this book are not real, their stories are based on things that really happened during World War 2. It was a new perspective for me to read of what women did during the war; not just them surviving at home without their men, (fathers and husbands)  but what they did to save those in danger. These women endured incredible, unimaginable circumstances. They were faced with danger and difficult decisions. They had to be brave and strong and keep moving forward despite their hardships.Kristin Hannah has an incredible way with words; her descriptions are vivid; you see what the characters are seeing, you feel what they are feeling; you feel like you are there. I felt like I was experiencing what they were; hunger, deprivation, cold, separation from a loved one, fear, pain, etc. I found the book very hard to put down, as I had to know what the outcome for these two incredible women would be. Each time I did have to stop reading, I found myself thinking and pondering on what I had read, and what might happen next. I tried to put myself in their shoes, wondering if I would have been as brave as them, if I could have survived what they did, if I would have done what they did. This is an excellent book; it makes you feel, it makes you think, and it makes you grateful for what you have.

My son has been really into Star Wars lately, and is very excited for Episode VII coming out. He currently has a book about all of the various characters in the series, and having this book was a nice compliment to it (in his opinion).Having taken a look at the book myself, it really is a pretty comprehensive summary of the 6 movies. It takes the important portions of each movie, and sets up each scene. There are fun factoids about each scene (things like the midwife robots that helped deliver Luke and Leia), actual comments from the characters in the movie, and, of course, the background information about what is occurring at that point.Personally, I found the factoids among the most fascinating portions of the book. I particularly was intrigued by the scene where Obi-Wan and Anakin fight each other from the third movie. I was not aware there Obi-Wan did not have training to use the force for attacks, only for defense. He didn't have any choice, however, when he had the face off with Anakin.For my 8 year old son who hasn't seen all the movies yet, but is very excited about Episode VII, this is a good way for him to get caught up on all of the things that have happened in past movies.

We got this book for our 8 year old son, who has previously enjoyed several other Captain Underpants books. He was excited to hear we had a new book for him coming. It took him about 2 days to finish the book, although he, obviously, didn't spend the whole day reading.He said the book is about a talking toilet named Turbo Toilet 2000. He continued, "Wedge Woman created a couple robots, and one of them kicked a kickball to Uranus and made the Turbo Toilet 2000 come back to life. There is also this kid named Melvin Sneedy who has this squid suit that helps bring people back in time."It sounds like quite an exciting book, and he definitely enjoyed it. I'm sure we'll be purchasing additional Captain Underpants books for him in the future.

Out of the Ruins is a historical fiction that begins several months before San Francisco Earthquake. The first half of the book was a little slow for me. Abby is hoping for a miracle for her sister, Cecelia, who is being treated in the hospital in San Francisco for cancer. It was interesting to learn about early medical practices, especially in cancer treatment. We learn of Abbyâs relationship with her sister, a possible budding romance, and Abbyâs relationship with God. While I found this part of the story interesting, it lacked excitement for me. However, what we learn about the characters in the first part of the book carries into the second half. Part 2 beings several months later, and it is here that the book really picks up the pace. It tells of what happened to Abby during the San Francisco Earthquake, and the events immediately after. This part of the book was exciting, and I found it hard to put the book down. I enjoy a well-written historical fiction book, to learn a little about history in a fun and exciting way. In the end, this book did not disappoint. I look forward to reading other books by this author.

I've been using a memory foam/gel pillow for years from Costco (by Sleep Innovations). It's been a great pillow for me, although I couldn't stand sleeping on the gel side. It was too hard for me. Unfortunately, I sweat a lot at bedtime, and have found my existing pillow to almost be too unbearable to sleep on due to the bad smell.After seeing this one, I was interested. After receiving it, I did need to let it air out for about 3-4 days before I could bear the foam smell. The instructions say to let it air out for 24 hours. It was still too strong for me at that point.Once I was able to start using it, I noticed both sides were about the same softness (if that's even a word). That made me a little happier, as I could then sleep on both sides compared to my previous pillow. So far, after several nights switching between sides hasn't been a problem for me like the Sleep Innovations pillow.One other key difference is when I pushed my hand into the sleep innovations pillow it seemed to mold to my hand a little better and take longer to bounce back. I believe this is an indication of the quality of the memory foam. This classic brands version bounces back almost immediately. It's still comfortable, but that may be a consideration for some.At this point, I'm quite happy with the pillow, and have found a satisfactory replacement.

We've been looking for a balance bike for our 2 year old for awhile. When this came around, we were thrilled. It showed up, and my wife put it together in about 10-15 minutes. She indicates there were 5 parts to assembled, and it included the two allen wrenches required to do so.My 2 year old (3 in January), loves the bike. It's light enough that she often carries it around to where she wants it to be. Right now she's just scooting it along, as she gets used to riding a bike. She's definitely starting to get the hang of it, and can see her soon using it to lift off without keeping her feet by her side.Our only concern is with it being made of wood, how long it will last if left outside. We haven't had that issue yet, but suspect if it were exposed to lots of elements consistently it could become a problem. We're keeping it in the garage, so don't see it ending up being an issue in the end.We'll update this review as things progress, but so far we're very happy with it. Price is very comparable to other brands as well.

This is a great little gadget for quick shredding or slicing jobs. If I only have a little cheese to grate, I will use my box grater. For large jobs, the food processor is the way to go. But for those in-betwen/medium sized jobs, I like to use the drum grater. Itâs easy to put together, and easy to use. It will quickly grate or slice cheese or veggies. The instructions say to first clean the bottom of the suction base. This is important because if there is dust or food residue on it, the base will not suction to the counter. I found that you need to make sure the suction is also completely dry, or it will not suction. Then insert the grater housing, lock the base to the counter, insert the drum, lock it in place, then insert the handle. Make sure the handle is locked completely â or it will come flying off while turning it! You use the pusher to press food down while turning the handle and the sliced/shredded or grated food comes out of the center of the drum. After use, you disassemble everything and wash the parts. Disassembly is easy â except for removing the grater housing from the base unit. Every time I have used it, it has been difficult. You really have to push HARD in order to remove it. Itâs not enough of a frustration to make me not want to use it â because I like using it. Itâs beats manually sliding a chunk of cheese across my box grater. But it is a frustration, which is why I gave it 4 stars.

I'd had a pair of Sanuk sandals I'd picked up about a year ago. They were wonderful, extremely comfortable, until about a year later. I felt like I was walking on the floor with my bare feet. They were awful, and I couldn't stand to wear them any longer.Being a HUGE Ecco fan, I set my eyes on their offerings. As expected, they were everything I could've ever imagined. They fit just fine (easy considering the Ecco size I know I am). They were comfortable from the moment I put them on, and I have no doubt they'll last for much longer than a year. My wife has even stolen them a few times when she has to make a quick trip outside, and has commented on how nice they are.These are a great purchase, and one I have on regrets about whatsoever.

You always need soap, and with kids, babies, and just the normal things of life, we're finding ourselves constantly washing our hands. We've been a big fan of Seventh Generation, so were very happy to try out their hand soap. The scent is wonderful. I certainly like the combination of the mandarin orange and grapefruit. Not too over powering. Just the right amount.12 ounce is a good size bottle. We typically see far less than that with the other types of soap we buy. Typically we find ourselves closer to 8-9 ounces from other comparable brands.Finally, how was it actually washing? It lathers up quite quickly, smells great, and seems to do the job just fine. The only negative we have is that there isn't any moisturizer. As a result, your hands feel pretty dry afterwards. Throw on some lotion, however, and you're back in good shape.It's a good product. One we'll probably continue to buy. We'll have to try out some of the other scents, but we've been quite happy with this one.

We've been in need of a soap dispenser at the office, and when this came along, I thought I'd give it a try. Unfortunately, Amazon shipped these with no packaging in a pretty large box (at least in comparison to the product). The first one I received was broken. The top broke off, and we were unable to repair it. The replacement arrived in much the same manner, but, luckily, wasn't broken. Although this is merely a review of the product, I did feel it might be good to know how Amazon is shipping these. Yours may arrive broken.Now, onto the product. The size is pretty decent, with it being able to hold 10 ounces of whatever you desire to put in it. As mentioned, we used it with soap, and had a gigantic refill container of Softsoap. We put it in, and were able to dispense soap without issue. At least for me, one push dispensed enough soap that I was satisfied. I feel like I'm often having to get two pumps from other similar products to obtain the desired amount. It's definitely working for our needs, but it's nothing really amazing for what you're getting. I'd consider it a pretty average soap dispenser. It does the job, holds a good amount of soap, opens easily, isn't messy, etc. Really can't complain.

I've been using a similar Targus product for years, which has been good. It only charges my iPhone up to about 80%, however, before it died. I was eager to try the Xgrid out, considering it promises up to 4 charges for a smartphone.Last Friday, I went on a trip down to Las Vegas. I'm often using my phone, and find myself needing to recharge about halfway through the day. This trip was no different. About 1 PM I found my phone at 7% and decided to give the Xgrid a try. Within an hour, I was back up to 80%. Unfortunately, I had to unhook it at that point, but the Xgrid still had plenty of juice in it. I have no doubt I'd be able to use it multiple times before having to recharge it. There are several indicator lights on the front (as you can see in the photo). By the time I unhooked the Xgrid from my iPhone 5s, it had only gone down 1 light (to the yellow.So far, I'm very pleased. I've yet to recharge it, and plan to keep using it for upcoming business trips I have. I'll have to try it on my iPad Mini as well. and update the review once I've done so.

My six year old daughter LOVES art. We saw this book, and thought it would be a fantastic one for her. We were not disappointed. The book is pretty simple. About Louise, and her love for art, and her desire to create a masterpiece. Once we finally does, it's time to hang it on the fridge! What happens though, her younger brother, Art, gets to it.The message is cute, and really reminds us of our children. A good lesson at the end as well, which makes it the perfect children's book. The artwork is superb. The book isn't too long (takes a few minutes to read). We can't complain at all. It had all 3 of my kids (8, 6, and 3) all gripped as I was reading.

I was excited to receive these towels as my current kitchen hand towels which were looking dingy and worn. These are very nice towels. I like the basic design (stripes) and color (I have blue); they will look nice in any kitchen. I washed these before I used them, and, as expected, since they are 100% cotton, they shrunk. But despite shrinking, they are still large enough to use for hand drying or dish drying. They are soft and absorbent, and donât feel thin or cheap. Iâm very happy with these towels.

The hot pads are thick and protect my hands from the heat.  However, they are not too cumbersome to grab thin things like cookie sheets or pizzas out of the hot oven.  I have smaller hands and they are a good fit for me.  I like the fun apple design. These are a great pair of hot pads that will last.

I've been a fan of Belkin products for sometime. My last car charger was actually Belkin branded, and has worked great with a monoprice licensed cable I've had. I figured getting something with Belkin with a built-in lightning cable would be just as pleasant of an experience.I was really surprised. This didn't work well at all with my Retina iPad Mini. It charged it, but half the time didn't. When it didn't work, it actually complained about not being an authorized cable and may "damage" my device. I've seen that before with unlicensed cables, but was very surprised to see it from a Belkin product. My iPhone 5s, surprisingly, never had an issue with the cable, and continues to charge it without issue. Luckily I use it for my 5s most often, but it is still nice to have something that is reliable for my iPad Mini.All in all, it's a decent product. Something I'd not really expect from Belkin. This isn't up to their standards. If it worked all the time, I'd be happier with it, but, at this point, it's a so-so product.

We've been a big fan of Charmin for a long time. We've typically purchased the Ultra Soft from Costco, and have always been very happy with it. It's definitely soft, and does the job when it comes to keeping yourself clean. What's better than buying more? Suddenly having 4x the amount on each roll. It's very obvious there is more toilet paper on  the roll compared to the regular ultra soft we get at Costco.A normal roll lasts, in our busiest bathroom, about 2 days. The mega roll, after having been set out Friday is still in use today (Monday). We also still have well over 1/3 of the roll left. Not bad at all. Storage is also a little easier, since you don't have 36 regular rolls lying around. Only 24.We like them. Price is pretty comparable as well.UPDATE: Interestingly enough, although the roll is definitely bigger, the squares are smaller compared to the Costco ones we normally get. Perhaps a way to make it seem like they're even bigger than they really are?

This stuff is amazing! I have a 2014 Mazda6, and really like keeping my car clean (probably from my sports car days). I've traditionally only used a micro-fiber cloth to dust off/clean the dashboard. It usually works, but with the black interior I have, it really doesn't seem to stay dust free very long. Within a day it's usually right back to pretty much how it was before. Others like Armor-All seem to be similar. They don't keep it clean very long.Along comes the Cockpit Premium. I've never used an Einszett product before, but it really reminds me of a screen cleaner from Bryson that I've used. It simply works, and almost "repels" the dust. After having used the product Friday, my car is almost dust free still today (Monday). I'm hoping this will continue for a couple days longer, but, even then, I'm sold. This stuff is fantastic. I'm glad it comes in such a large bottle, as I'm going to be going through this pretty quickly.

My kids have never really been fans of the Octonauts. They certainly are aware of who they are, but have never watched the show. That being said, they absolutely love the game. Even my 8 year old who claims he's not interested in ever playing it hovered over my 6 year old as she played the game.Of all of the Leapster games I've seen, this has to be in the top 5% from a learning perspective. I was really impressed with the challenges my kids are given. The kids have to go through various levels, each in different ocean scenarios. The game goes through identifying several different plants and animals that live in the ocean not only by how they look, but also by how they sound.There are also some fun "missions" where they're required to move things out of the way to go past, rescue various animals, and more. It's really a cute game with lots of educational properties that you don't always see in the Leapster games.

My daughters LOVE to color. I have boxes and boxes of pictures they've drawn, so we were looking for something that might help save some paper. We thought this would be a great product to do so. It's a good size, but folds up, and makes it easy to transport. It includes markers, and so we thought it would be great to take along for trips as well.Unfortunately, after 24 hours, 2 of the markers, despite being capped, dried out. We're a bit disappointed by that, considering we'd only had the product for a day. As some other reviewers commented, the markers are a bit light, however, we found that the color begins to darken on the surface after a little bit. Some other reviewers mentioned using dry erase markers as another option. We haven't tried that yet, but are considering purchasing some since we're now out 2 markers.Overall, the product is pretty good. Our only disappointment, as mentioned, is the markers drying out. My daughters certainly love using it, so it serves our purpose rather well.

We've had a lot of family gatherings, parties, and get togethers lately, so we were in need of some decent paper plates. These happened to be available, and we decided to give them a try. A good size box showed up with 120 plates, and we've yet to have been disappointed. We've used them for cake, stroganoff, jello, vegetables, and more. The plates held them without issue. The raised lip certainly helps with the more runny/liquidy foods you may be eating. For disposable plates, these are excellent. Price-wise, they're certainly a bit more expensive than your cheap paper plates, but they're worth it for the quality and stability you receive.

This is a very fun book, especially for kids that like cats (like mine do). The book essentially is about this cat named Bob whose owner passes away. He follows an ambulance, but eventually can't keep up. He ends up wandering the streets for sometime, and eventually finds a man named James. The man, James, takes him in, and brings Bob around while he plays music on the street.The book is not too long. The words aren't too difficult for my 6 and 8 year old to read, and they both were memorized by the story. It's always nice to have a positive book like this that kids can read. Despite the difficulties we experience in this life, there often is a positive twist in the end. Definitely recommended!

The Get Ready for Kindergarten Learning Game is FANTASTIC. Usually Ihave to coach my 3 yr old to get the hang of games. This one, shepicked up on right away.There are three learning games teaching reading, math and life skillsfor school. Get letter-ready with Ozzie Otter and Friends was one ofmy daughter's favorites. It has letters and numbers on lily pads youidentify. Recognize letter sounds and feed them to the bug. Then youearn stickers to place on your name. My daughter LOVES this game!Dragon cafe: You identify numbers by counting the food for thedragons. Trace lines and shapes, and then numbers. It's a lot of funwhile learning.Stretchy Monkey is fun--solving puzzles and avoiding obstacles as youhelp monkey get through the jungle. The child learns life skills asthey help monkey make their bed, brush teeth, make healthy foodchoices, etc. Then you earn stickers if you deliver bananas withoutgetting hurt. The stickers are very motivating for my daughter.This will definitely help her prepare for kindergarten, and I don'tfeel bad at all about having her play this while we are out at drappts, etc. What a great game--highly recommend.

I've been in need of an external drive that was small and yet fast to use for my Macbook Air. This was a great option, and has worked out great for me. Copying over 40 GB of content from the main SSD to the Touro took about 10 minutes. Not bad for USB 3.I, personally, like how small it is, and that I suddenly have an extra TB of data I can haul around with me very easily. No extra power cables. Simply plug and play! I've also partitioned the drive, and am using a portion of it as a Time Machine backup. It's worked just fine so far.This really is a great drive. Does everything I was hoping for, all in one convenient package. The only thing that would be better would be a USB thumb drive with 1 TB of data, but we're not quite there yet. :-)

I have naturally curly hair, and therefore use a lot of product daily in my hair to keep it from being frizzy and to help it hold the curl. Because of this, the products build up in my hair, weighing it down, and causing my hair to not look as good as it could. I have used the Fekkai Apple Cider shampoo for several weeks now (once a week, as recommended on the bottle). After using it, my hair feels lighter, cleaner, and smells great. I love the apple scent; it is fresh and clean smelling! Would recommend this product.

We haven't had a bouncer in years, so receiving one for our upcoming 4th child was something we were thrilled about. Once we received it, setup wasn't bad, although my wife did have a bit of trouble assembling it. As always, directions can usually be a bit better (video directions are the best!), but we were able to assemble it fine. The only thing we ran into was the fabric covered the on switch depending on how it was slid onto the metal bars. Also had to find some batteries, since we usually only have AA's around.Unfortunately, our child despises this bouncer. Hopefully that will change as he gets older, but at 3-4 weeks, he can't last more than 5 minutes in it without screaming. It's the same with the baby swing we have, however, so I'd say it's more due to his personal tastes versus any fault of the product.

My husband loves these - he has large hands, and though these are a tight fit, these work really well and don't rip or snap. It isn't overly powdered either, so it isn't a big mess when removing them. He uses them mainly for cleaning guns - he can still manipulate things well and they hold up well to mineral oil and unburnt gunpowder which are rather corrosive. He is very pleased with them and when this large box runs out, I know we will be ordering them again!

My husband was very excited about this scent choice, as I tend to gravitate towards flowery candle smells and bread and butter is a favorite treat of his. Unfortunately, this candle doesn't really smell much like buttered bread. It smells kind of like candy corn or caramel corn when unlit, and after it has been lit for a while smells more like a pretzel baking... It is just kind of weird. It isn't bad for fall, though, but I wouldn't burn it anywhere other than a kitchen that's for sure!

Good deal for three razors - this is a better choice than the more expensive five-blade razors and my husband feels like he gets a closer shave with these than some of the other disposable brands that he has tried in the past. They are well-constructed and works well for shaving both his face and his head. You can get a full week's shave (including your head) out of one razor. They have a nice grip to them as well!

I have read and enjoyed a few of Toyne's earlier novels, so I looked forward to starting his latest book. This latest novel kicks off a new series and opens up with one of my favorite tropes of popular fiction - amnesia. A man comes to running down a desert road, with a plane crashed and burning behind him. An impressive amount of knowledge stands at the ready for him, but not his own name or how he came to be on the outskirts of the small town of Redemption, Arizona. Meanwhile, the town buries one of its leaders and other plots come to light as the day continues on with drugs, bloodshed and even a historical buried treasure story. The elements of the story and the layers of the plot work well. Toyne has a real talent for cliffhanger endings which makes this 450+ book move very quickly. Some twists of the plot are genuine surprises, while others are a bit more expected, considering all of the hidden agendas. The ending serves as a neat explanation and lays the groundwork for more to the series - and I will definitely be keeping my eye out for the next installment!

The description of this novel really intrigued me, but I didn't enjoy it as much as I had hoped to. It moves a bit too slowly and rather predictably, too. The writing is pretty stylized and though the young horse thief is likable enough and his relationship with the young woman is rather sweet, neither character is very developed. And the historical detail that I expected for a Civil War setting isn't really there either. Because the characters aren't very easy to connect to, their romance isn't really very vivid either. I almost set this one aside a few times, though it isn't very long...Ultimately, I did finish it, and it ended as I expected it to... My favorite character was the horse, to be honest. I just didn't care for the style of the writing and it just distracted me throughout and made it hard to like any of the bipedal characters. Maybe this would be a good choice for book clubs or discussion groups because I think that different readers would react to this in different ways, but then again, with the simplicity of the plot there may just not be that much to talk about...

This Young Adult debut novel could have also been titled "My Big Fat Senior Year" as there are some definite similarities to that movie... but it is an engaging teen novel that deals with grief (the book opens a few months after Georgia's mother passes away from complications with her diabetes), body image (Georgia, like her mother, is a larger girl) and friendship - along with a little teen romance. Georgia's poetry adds to the emotional level in the book (but be warned, some of the descriptions of her mother's illness are not for the faint of heart). Georgia's mother's dying wish is for her daughter to try everything - which may not exactly correlate with the message some parents of teens want to pass along to their teen daughters (Georgia smokes, cuts class, eats edible drugs - with an experience that seems to glorify it to rather ridiculous heights). There is some swearing, too, and maybe all of these experiences are just par for the course of our rougher world... but I'd not blindly recommend this one to every young adult reader.The Chicago setting, though, is quite nice, though the relationship between father and daughter is not what I would have hoped for. But, by the end, this is a satisfying read. It's a bit predictable, but not in a terrible way. I am curious to see what Kottaras follows this one up with.

This is a Young Adult fantasy novel, set in some sort of dystopian America (but with only names, places and some "relics" serving as clues to the origin of the setting). A war has ended and two sisters anxiously await on their family farm for the return of Thom, husband and brother-in-law. When the younger sister, and narrator, hires on a veteran for the winter, it brings change and further troubles. The characters - and their development - is handled fairly well, the plot itself and the type of magic that is the basis for the war isn't very clearly defined and doesn't always seem very sensical - though that may be because of the vague details offered. The development in the relationships - particularly between the two sisters - isn't terribly complex and since it is resolved in one conversation, that's not very satisfying. Plus, the pacing is a bit slow and though the ending's resolution is pretty finite, the very end suggests more books may come later and while I am a bit curious to see if a second installment provides more of the details that I wished for, I doubt that I will be first in line to read it.

This debut Young Adult novel and its premise of firestarter teen twins, Alice and Celia, is certainly attention-grabbing. My affinity for teen fiction featuring twins will never dissipate, I think, no matter how old I get! This book opens with a lethal fire and an escape from an Oregon mental institution... and though I had the plot twist figured out from almost the very first page (this actually goes into another guilty pleasure of mine in fiction!), it is a fast-paced read that I read in one sitting (it is nice to be proven right - though a little disappointing ultimately to have it figured out that early). It is an engaging read - and I also have a fondness for diary entries embedded within fiction. A few of the supporting characters provided a few surprises to the plot, but ultimately I suppose this book was too predictable to be completely enjoyable. It is definitely fast-paced, though...

I have heard good things about Gerritsen's writing, but this is my first experience with her books - and though I am not sure what I expected from this book, it definitely is a fast-paced read that completely captured my attention. The narrative follows two storylines - the modern focuses on violinist Julia who discovers in a Rome antique shop, a book of old music - with a never-before-published piece inside. Her obsession with the new music wreaks havoc on her return to domestic life in Boston.The historical storyline opens in Venice and tells Lorenzo's story - a talented musician who soon falls in love with another musician, though the time and circumstances makes their love impossible. It's an engaging novel and not overly long (under 250 pages) and is definitely hard to put down. The plot carries some surprises alongside some more predictable tropes and bits of it range into far-fetched ridiculousness. But the two plots blend together surprisingly well and the book is easy to read in one sitting (perfect for a plane ride to Italy!). I am curious to see what other books Gerritsen has written!

When the title of a book makes you laugh, it is definitely a good sign! This is actually the author's second collection of essays from her popular blog with the same punchy title. I tend to gamble quite a bit on essay collections... David Sedaris is one of my favourites, but in between the long waits for his books, I have uncovered a few other gems - but a lot of duds too. This collection, though, is one of the better ones that I have found. It is laugh-out-loud funny at times and the holiday experiences and decorating is all surprisingly relatable. It is funny and though a bit edgier than some holiday collections (I wouldn't pass this one along to conservative relatives), it isn't overly negative or mean (which is a bit surprising, considering the title). I really enjoyed this quick read and definitely plan on checking out her first collection and keeping an eye out for future essays as well!

I don't read much science fiction, actually - the fantasy side of the genre is more typically what I read, but this one sounds promising and I am glad to have read it! It opens up in an exciting way, with a spaceship boarded by intruders, but it does take some time to become acclimated to Higgins' world and his word choices. But as the lay of the galaxy becomes more familiar, the book becomes much more engaging and downright thrilling. The setting is limited to the advanced space ship, and the cast of characters is small. Because of this, it gives this decidedly modern story a surprisingly old-fashioned feel in some ways (kind of like a locked room mystery). The pacing slows a bit at times - with lots of telling through some long scenes of dialogue, but the story that they are telling is fascinating.But, it certainly isn't one that I can see easily being translated to the screen - it is a LOT of talking and the action scenes are fewer than I would have expected. And yet, the book never really feels boring. There are layers to the limited cast of characters and it all seems to building up to a plot far-reaching from the confines of the spaceship. And there are nice clues along the way, and it's fun to be proved right about some of them! The book shifts gears in the third section of the book (think 2001) which adds an entirely new layer to the plot. The shifting perspectives work really well and though some of the phrasing is kind of laughable ("spaghettification of the lungs" for example) - it certainly increases the drama and excitement that is somewhat lacking in the first two-thirds of the book.
