It's nice to connect with Amy and Luc and all their friends and enemies. You won't believe the trouble they get in to with their magic and drama. Who knew that cupcakes could cause such angst. If you want to kick back and relax, this is the book for you.

Carrie Logan can't believe that her business website has been hacked and her private photos are on the internet. She's proud of her work as a photographer and has tried hard to make everyone proud. Now she's an object of scorn and ridicule. She contacts Nathan Jackson, an internet security consultant, for help. Can he protect her? This story is very emotional. As I read Her Secret Protector, I felt anger and outrage at the judgmental attitudes of Carrie's friends and neighbors. Carrie is charming, gutsy and determined. She loves her life in Cherry Lake and her job, but how do you deal with gossip and rumor. Nathan was a rock. He understood all to well what Carrie would have to face. He had been there and seen how it could destroy a person. He's trying to start a new life away from the pain he endured in New York, but he has an enemy who is filled with hate and jealousy. When these two are together, I felt their attraction and their caring. I wanted them to put the hurt and pain behind them and find love. I felt such anger at the narrow minded people. I want to scream. Nathan's dogs were a perfect addition to the story. They showed Nathan's love and determination as well as Carrie's caring nature. Roxanne Snopek did an outstanding job. Her Secret Protector is well-crafted and realistic. She pulled me and made me care.

Butch McCormick is back home. He needs a break from the craziness of his life. He loves being with his family and slowing down. What he doesn't realize is it's the calm before the storm. When Kate Riley arrives, passion and danger do it. Can he win her heart and make her his? Butch and Katie are amazing characters. They are likeable and intriguing. He's a talented country superstar and she's a woman working in a demanding, physical job. They are complete opposites, but they can't deny their attraction. I was hooked in an instant. The small town and her residents add humor and drama to the story. The rural setting provides the perfect stage for this romantic suspense. I'm hoping that Jeb, Butch's older brother, will get his own story. He has secrets that I want to know. Anita DeVito did a wonderful job. She provided twists and turns that kept me on the edge of my seat. I loved Lost in Tennessee. It's going on my keeper shelf!

Lady Abigail Hurst believes in true love and happy ever after. Now she's engaged to her childhood sweetheart. This should be on top of the world. Why does she feel a stirring of doubt? She doesn't know Robert any more. Things get more difficult when she discovers that he has a mistress who has been murdered. Can she marry a man that she doesn't love or trust? Lady Abigail is a strong woman. She will do as her father asks and stand behind her fiancÃ©e during the scandal. I liked that she doesn't accept her fate. She starts investigating with Lord Edmund Longcroft and his sisters. They will find the truth. As danger surrounds them, Lady Abigail and Edmund begin to care for each other. Their attraction was powerful and very romantic. These two are perfect for each other. I didn't want them to let society keep them apart. I couldn't stop reading Say You'll Love Me. This story is a perfect blend of romance and mystery. The characters are well written and their banter is witty and clever. I was kept guessing as to the identity of the murderer until the very end. Ally Broadfield did an excellent job. I hope that Lord Longcroft's six unwed sisters find their true loves. I want to read more of this family.

Isabelle Cooper's life is changing in a big way. Her parents have sold their flower shop and are moving. Suddenly her new boss is Devon Donovan, the man she has had a crush on forever. Can she work with him knowing that he doesn't see her as a desirable woman? Izzy is smart, funny and attractive. She's the real deal. I liked her immediately and wanted her to get her man. Devon is cool and aloof. He doesn't believe in love and commitment. His abusive father destroyed any illusions that he had in that department. Now he and his family are wealthy and want for nothing. His attitude while understandable was a turnoff. It took me awhile to warm up to him. I enjoyed seeing him fall for Izzy. His rationalizations about love and commitment made me smile. I wanted him to realize what he had and keep it close. Susan Meier has written characters that are charming and likeable. It was easy to care for them. I was hooked on the Donovan Brothers and was happy to see them find their perfect someone. I loved the small town setting and the people who lived there - even the nosy ones. The dialogue sparkles and the romance had me sighing. This series is a keeper.

Kadan Carson and Hollis Remington meet again. They are both at a crossroads in their life. Their future is uncertain and their past has left them with painful reminders of a love affair that imploded. Can they pick up the pieces? Kadan is a world famous surfer who suffered an injury that can end his career. He is hiding and trying to sort out his options. Hollis has lost everything. She doesn't want to face her family with this difficult news. When she goes to her grandmother's beach house in San Clemente, she finds Kadan in residence. She still loves and desires him, but can't trust him. Can they recapture what they lost? This is an emotional story filled with passion and desire. The attraction between these two is scorching! Their desire is so powerful that it blazes uncontrollably. I couldn't stop reading Wrecked. The characters are larger than life with their sizzling dialogue and white hot desire. San Clemente is a big part of the story with its surfing culture and sexy surfers. Sinclair Jayne did a wonderful job. I enjoyed Wrecked.

The danger and the romance ramp up as Gabe and Jo continue their torrid affair. They won't let the leader of the counterfeit smuggling ring escape justice. They've received a tip that he's hiding in South Carolina. They travel there to help the local authorities. Will they be successful this time? Gabe and Jo are perfect together except when they are working. He wants to protect her and she wants to be in on the action. Talk about a battle of wills. The suspense is non-stop as these two charge into danger. Martinson wants her dead and is working hard to achieve his goal. Who knew that stopping knock-offs could be deadly? Adrienne Giordano has out down herself with this second book in the Justifiable Cause series. I couldn't stop reading. Jo is in danger and Gabe is all alpha male. It doesn't get any better than this! This book has it all! There is passion, danger and suspense. Now I want a HEA!

The Happy Hoofers are at it again. Wherever they go, these ladies find trouble and murder. Paris is no exception. This story is so enjoyable. The characters are charming and feisty. This group of friends are good at what they do both on and off stage. I could feel the love and caring that they had for one another. It added depth to the story. The dialogue was interesting and Paris provided a romantic and mysterious setting. The highlights of the City of Lights was a nice touch as were the recipes. This story is a strong addition to the series. There were plenty of suspects and potential motives. I didn't know who the culprit was. I was kept guessing. This was an exciting and exhilarating adventure. Mary McHugh does a great job weaving romance and mystery together. I enjoy this series and am looking forward to the next book.

Lord Munro "Bear" MacLawry is the clan enforcer. He loves and protects his family with fierce determination. He, also, feels isolated and lonely. He's a bad boy who doesn't want to settle down. That is until he meets his "wildcat". Catriona MacColl is different from any lass that he's met. She doesn't simper and flatter him. She wears trousers and tells him to go away. She helped her half sister escape from an arranged marriage. Now these women are hiding. No one knows they are there until the "Giant" tracks them down. When Bear and Cat tangle, sparks fly. The battle of wills between them took my breath away. I loved their passion and their fierceness. Bear is willing to defy his family and hide her. If only Cat would trust him. Cat has her secrets. She thinks that she is an oddity because of her manly dress but Bear can't keep away. She's his! I loved this story. The characters touched my heart. I wanted them to over come their problems. I was frustrated that Munro's brothers were so stubborn. I couldn't put this book down. I feel under Lord Munro's spell! What a hero. When he taught Cat how to wear an evening gown and braided her hair, I feel in love. Suzanne Enoch wrote a story that had outstanding characters, a dangerous setting and a love that was intense. This book is a keeper!

Molly is a witch. She needs to find a way to protect her husband, Joe. She had to tell him the truth about who she really is. Now he's in danger. She makes a deal with the Bone Man to protect her family from the Witches' Council. She needs to bring his wife to him and he will protect her loved ones. Now the trouble really begins. She needs help and her group of friends are not very powerful. How will they find one witch among many? I loved all the characters in this story. Their personalities and abilities are so different but they care about each other and are there to help in times of need. There is even a ghost who wants to bond with her just-found daughter. As Joe struggles to find a serial killer. Molly searches for the Sea Witch who is killing young males in the coven. Everyone is in danger. This story pulled me right in. The port of Wilmington, North Carolina made for an interesting and, at times, spooky setting. Looking For Mr. Good Witch has it all. There is danger, humor and young love. I'm enjoying the Retired Witches Mysteries. Joyce and Jim Lavene never disappoint.

Clare Morgan is willing to risk her reputation in order to save the village where she lives. For the help of Lord Nicholas Aberdare, she agrees to live with him for three months. Nicholas is a wicked charmer with his gypsy heritage. Is Clare in danger of losing both her virtue and her heart? Clare is a strong, independent woman who wants to help the men who work in the pit. The Demon Earl is a devil with the ladies. He has wealth and power but he's not happy with his fate. He feels alone and an outcast. He has endured so much pain and abandonment in his life. He has hardened his heart. Now that Clare is in his life, his resolve has weakened. As these two struggle with their attraction, they work hard to improve conditions in Penreith and find who wants the Demon Earl dead. I enjoyed the interaction between Clare and Nicholas. I could feel the passion and desire. The scenes where Clare played pool with the Earl were amazing. I loved it. Their dialogue was flirtatious and their desire was palpable. Wales provided an intriguing backdrop for this enthralling story. The supporting cast is great. Mary Jo Putney has written wonderful characters with a storyline that captured my attention. The plot moved swiftly and was filled with unexpected twists and turns. I was hooked from the first page. This is a wonderful start to the Fallen Angels series. This book goes on my keeper shelf.

Summer Redding is proud of her blog, Area 8. She has uncovered scandal and corruption before, but now she has the chance for the story of a lifetime. The Washington Massacre, which wiped out the Delvaux family, had almost brought the country to its knees. What would happen if she revealed that Jack Delvaux was alive and hunting for the people responsible? Summer is an interesting and intelligent character. She has endured so much in her life. Her parents were careless and uncaring. Jack was a former lover who broke her heart. Can they work together and make a life? She loves her country and will risk everything to reveal who is behind this deadly plot to harm it. Summer and Jack are an unstoppable pair. Jack is driven by hate. These traitors destroyed his family and they will pay. His pain broke my heart. I loved watching him come alive as he fell in love with Summer. This story is amazing. It's filled with suspense, intrigue and violence. I wanted justice to triumph. Lisa Marie Rice's Men of Midnight is a powerful series. I was hooked from the first page.

Jo Pomeroy is an attorney who is working with a task force to stop knock-offs. These counterfeit goods are hurting reputable companies. Gabe Townsend is an NYPD Sergeant who is carrying out the raids. These two may be on the same side but the butt heads regularly. Both are stubborn and determined. Will they ever play nice? Jo is such a feisty woman. I admired her. She finds Gabe sexy and trusts him, but she won't let him push her around. Gabe is attracted to Jo. He wants to keep her safe. How can he get her to realize that she's putting herself in danger? It was enjoyable to watch these two bicker and it was even more fun to see them become lovers. I liked these two. These characters are interesting and they won't back down.  New York City with its high energy is the perfect setting for this suspenseful novel. The action is non-stop and the unexpected twists add to the highly intriguing story. I was hooked, but be aware that this is part one of a series. The ending leaves the reader with unanswered questions. I'm looking forward to the next book. I want to see how Jo and Gabe deal with their relationship and the kingpin behind the knock-offs.

David Hennings is back home. He's immediately caught up in the craziness that's his family. His mother asks him to convince sculptor Amanda LeBlanc to reconstruct a skull of an unknown murder victim. This is a cold case. She reluctantly agrees even though it brings back painful memories. Suddenly her life is falling apart. Thank goodness David is there to help her. They need to find who is behind this chaos and why? David is a strong man. He's attracted to Amanda and wants her in his life. It's so easy to be charmed by him. He's tender, caring and very sexy. Amanda is a talented artist. She needs order in her life. She struggles with her attraction to David. She finds that being  around him is never dull. These two are perfect together. I enjoyed seeing their interaction. The Rebel is an exciting, suspenseful story that that kept me guessing until the very end. I loved the characters and the action. It was good to reconnect with the Hennings family. They are  entertaining. They're a magnet for trouble. The hustle and bustle of Chicago is the perfect background for this story. I was hooked from the first page. I love Adrienne Giordano. She's a terrific writer.

Ella has been estranged from her manipulative father for years. She's independent and proud of her accomplishments. Suddenly she's dragged back home by her father. He needs her to charm and marry Donato Salazar who is extremely rich and powerful. Ella is blackmailed into helping. She wants to protect her siblings. Once she meets Donato, she's stunned. Their chemistry is amazing. He can't believe that this amazing woman is his enemy's daughter. He still plans to exact his revenge on Reg Sanderson but he is sad that he will hurt this kind woman. Can love rise from the ashes of deceit? I felt sympathy for Donato. His life has been filled with pain and loss. He may be successful now but his heart still hurts. I was sorry that he was using Ella as his weapon. He was much better than that. Ella needs love. She knows the pain of rejection. It was wonderful to see how loving Donato made her glow. I hoped that he would realize that he cared and not hurt her. It broke my heart when he told her the truth. Annie West wrote an emotional story that touched me. I cared for Ella and Donato and wanted them to be happy. The glamour setting highlighted that money can't give you love and happiness. I enjoy Annie West's writing. She writes with intensity and passion and this book is no exception.

Jacie Rose has come home to face her demons. She had runaway when she discovered that she was pregnant at 18. That was ten years ago, but the bad memories haven't faded. When she sees Brett Jackson who was to be her groom and savior, she feels the same attraction. Can they put the past behind them and find their way back to each other? I found The Secret Bride was an emotional story. Jacie was traumatized and physically abused by her stepfather, Clinton Calloway. His actions have made her protective of her daughter. She won't let any man hurt Darby the way that she was. Brett is a strong and loving man. He's a hard worker and honorable. He's fallen for both mother and daughter and wants to love and protect them both. It was impossible not to fall for him. He's definitely a keeper. It was easy to be drawn into this story. I cared for the characters and was charmed by Cherry Lake. The people who lived there added so much to the story. Jeannie Watt did an excellent job. I loved the romance.

I enjoyed this romantic and flirty novella. The characters and their meeting are romantic and filled with snappy dialogue. I liked Sheridan Farlow. She's a career woman who will do her best regardless of the circumstances while Mac aka B.A. Mackenzie is a romance writer like no other than I've encountered. Their role reversal caught my interest. I loved that the background for this Vegas story was a Romance Lovers Convention. I so wanted to be there in the midst of all the action and craziness. This was such a romantic story about dreams coming true. It hit the spot. I enjoy Sara Hantz writing style and I want more!

What happens when two people who have been hurt by love agree to pretend that they're involved? Paul has given up on love when his girlfriend cheated on him with his cousin. Libby Harris was dumped by the man she loved and is bullied by her controlling father. Now she doesn't trust men and their motives. What happens when she finds herself with a sexy man who makes her feel protected?  Paul and Libby have great chemistry. Too bad it's all make believe. Paul and Libby are such interesting characters. I liked them and wanted them to find each other. Their vulnerability broke my heart. I hoped that they would find the happiness that they deserved. Paul is such a stubborn man. I wanted to shake him and tell him to accept that he and Libby are perfect for each other. This story was touching and romantic. The secondary characters were colorful and fun. I loved being at the wedding of Gracie and Des (from the first book). I enjoyed Paul's family and their lively dialogue. Stefanie London wrote a fast paced and romantic story that kept my interest. I'm enjoying the Behind the Bar series. I hope that there will be more books to read.

Alex has always felt alone. His father left when he was a child and he lost his mother a year ago. He wants to understand what happened between his parents. When he receives a birthday card from his father, he's determined to get answers which is why he goes to Cherry Lake. He doesn't tell anyone there who he is. He meets Emma who loves the town and its people. She challenges Alex and awakens his desire. What happens when Alex faces the man who left him and learns that he has a new family? This is an emotional tale that is filled with both heartache and love. Alex hates his life and wants to change who he is, but his past haunts him. I liked that he shows his father compassion and love under very difficult circumstances. Emma is a caring woman who has the strength to take a chance on love. I found it very difficult to like Robert Jackson. What he did was cowardly and I couldn't respect him. I feel that Joan Kilby did an excellent job with a difficult storyline. I did enjoy The Secret Son.

Kacey Winters is a popular author of erotic romance. Her success brings about some unexpected consequences. Now she has a stalker and a bodyguard. How is she going to get an writing done? Her plans to go to her favorite retreat and write are falling apart. Who knew that her bodyguard would consume all her attention? Zack is definitely a surprise. I fell for him immediately. He has a wicked sense of humor and a devil-may-care attitude that is irresistible, but he's, also, dedicated and honorable. Kacey is not letting him distract her. She's an intelligent and feisty woman who can stand on her own two feet which is why she wants him gone. I love that sparks fly when these two are together. Their dialogue is filled with zingers and the story moves at a lively pace. The isolation of the resort gives the story a touch of danger. I was hooked from the first page. The characters are amazing. It's impossible to put this book down. I love Amanda McIntyre's writing. She has that special talent to create characters that are unique and interesting. Stranger in Paradise is such a heartwarming and humorous story. It made me smile.

Vaughn and Emma live in a corrupt world. They are determined to stop the evil. Vaughn is a powerful vampire who is a Border Patrol officer.  Emma is a strong alter witch. They are enemies. Can they work together to defeat their common foe? The wizard Loghry wants them dead. They are a disruption that he wants to eliminate. This story is an exhilarating adventure filled with danger and intrigue. The heated sexual tension between Vaughn and Emma is amazing. These two forge a bond that allows them to shared each others powers. Their connection was compelling. I was pulled into the story immediately. Emma is a strong willed heroine who will stop at nothing to bring down Loghry. She is determined to save the innocent victims. Vaughn finds himself attracted to Emma. He has endured so much but he knows that he can trust Emma with his very life. When they are together they are unstoppable. I enjoyed their bond. The Flame Series is skillfully crafted. The stories blend perfectly together. I'm looking forward to more books in this series. I love the paranormal element.  Caris Roane created an alter world that kept me on the edge of my seat.I received a copy from the author in exchange for an honest and unscripted review.

Deanna Devlin finds herself investigating a murder. The victim certainly had a talent for making enemies. Everyone including his family hated him. When Deanna's best friend becomes the main suspect, she knows that she has to find the killer. Can she do it? I enjoyed this fast paced, humorous cozy. The characters were likeable. There are plenty of suspects and motives. This well told mystery kept me guessing until the very end. I liked the desert setting and the humorous dialogue. This was a very enjoyable read.  I'm looking forward to seeing more books by Bridget Bowman.

Tavish Matheson is determined to make Julia his  mate, but the fae beauty is stubborn. How can this Highland warrior make her his? I fell in love with Tavish. What a hero! He's a bear shifter who is a proud warrior as well as the current Matheson clan doctor. He and his bear are determined to protect Julia from every danger. Their romance is tender and very passionate. Julia is feisty and loving. She will do what's necessary to make sure that all she loves are safe. This story is filled with danger and intrigue. The Chief of the MacKenzie Clan is determined to kidnap Julia. Will he succeed? I was hooked and couldn't stop reading. I needed to know that these two got their HEA. Also, I love seeing familiar characters from The Matheson Brothers Series. The Highland setting is perfect for romance and the character's snappy dialogue charmed me. Joanne Wadsworth has that special touch that makes her characters come to life. I love her writing and can't wait for her next release. Her books are keepers.

Phantoms is going to Nebraska to investigate a very dark and dangerous haunting. This is very personal for Sammy Hanesworth. Her mother died here. Now she's back and has to face the past. To make matters worse she's being paired with psychologist Cain McCutchen. Their reaction to each other is off the charts. Can she work with him? Sammy and Cain make a great couple. Their interaction is amazing. Their bond has great emotional depth. Sammy fights the connection. Trusting another has caused her too much pain. This story is a wonderful mixture of danger, romance and mystery. It's incredible. The intensity and the raw emotions took my breath away. I couldn't put this book down. This plot gave me the shivers. The setting oozed evil and sorrow. Kelly Moran's edgy suspense pulled me in and wouldn't let me go. This book is the most powerful in the Phantoms Trilogy. I could feel the evil which is a testimony to Kelly's skill. I enjoyed being with the team as they faced another challenge. It's enjoyable catching up with familiar characters and seeing their growth. For readers who love the paranormal, this series is a keeper.

I enjoyed Claimed by the Mate. Both authors did a remarkable job creating characters that caught my interest. I gravitate to stories that have the paranormal element. I love the feeling of an different world within our world. Feral Passions by Kate Douglas was filled with passion and love. Cherry is a multi dimensional character. She's a woman who doesn't believe in herself. She feels that no man can love her. When she comes to this private resort, all her preconceived ideas are blown away. I liked the werewolves of Feral Passions. They were tender, passionate and caring. Will her two lovers be able to convince her to bond with them? I couldn't put this book down. I loved the characters and the setting. It was interesting that this women only resort was home to wolves searching for their forever mate. The Alpha's Woman by A.C. Arthur evoked different emotions. Kira Radney is a kick-ass woman who won't be subjugated. She's an Alpha in her own right. Forced to flee to save herself. She's caught by an alpha wolf who wants to protect her. As these two battle they fight a strong desire for each other. Where will their story end? The characters are dangerous and compelling. The setting is dark and brooding. Kira was a powerful character. I liked her strength and courage. When she an Blaez are together the sparks and the passion are amazing. Claimed by the Mate was a very satisfying and sexy. Be aware that the heat factor is hot.

The residents of Snowflake, Vermont, are upset. One of their own wants to build a car wash in the center of town. The people are going to protest. Then the unbelievable happens. A skeleton is found on the site. Could it be a Revolutionary War soldier? That's just the beginning. Harry Hodges, the local mechanic, is murdered. Things are going to get worse, before they get better. Lucky Jamieson is in the middle of the action. She loves this town and wants answers. Connie Archer gives us a cozy mystery filled with non-stop action and surprising twists. I was immediately pulled into the adventure. Lucky is a feisty heroine who is tenacious when it comes to helping her friends. She won't give up. I liked her spunk and her determination. She and her friend, Sophie, work well together. The small town atmosphere makes the perfect background for this story. I, also, liked the tender romance between Lucky and Elias, the town doctor. There is crisp dialogue and likeable characters and careful plotting that kept me guessing until the very end. I'm loving this series (A Soup Lover's Mystery). Both the story and the recipes will keep me coming back.I was gifted a copy of this book by the author in exchange for an honest and unscripted review.

As treachery surrounds them Cullen, a powerful dragon shifter king needs to find Kas, a half-light with the gift of healing. His dragons are dying and only she can save them. He captures her but finds that she is afraid to use her power. The last time she did things went very badly. Can these two help each other and defeat their enemy? Cullen is stubborn and unyielding. He is determined to  accomplish his goal. Kas is his opposite. She's afraid. She has always been told that she's unworthy. Guilt and pain are her constant companion. Her magic caused the death of her family. Now she's surrounded by unfriendly dragons who want her dead. Cullen and Kas fight the attraction that they feel, but sparks fly when they are together. I love how they interacted. He helps her become strong and shows her that she has nothing to fear. I could feel their love. The story is well plotted and filled with dangerous surprises. The action is non-stop. The setting adds to the atmosphere as does the dialogue. Susan Scott has created a world that pulled me right in. I enjoyed the first book in the Kingdom Come series. I can't wait to read Hank and Muriel's story.

Jenna Hart lost her husband a year ago. She needs to start living again so she's opening a culinary book shop and cafÃ©. Crystal Cove is the perfect place since her family lives here. For her grand opening she asks her old college roommate to appear. Desiree Divine is a celebrity chef. Things don't go as planned when Desiree is murdered and the police think Jenna did it. This is not the way to begin again. Jenna is a interesting character. She's smart and determined to find who killed her friend. Who knew that being a marketing expert would help her track down a killer? Her Aunt Vera is a great help with her psychic abilities. This character appealed to me. I liked that she lived life on her terms and didn't worry what others thought. Daryl Wood Gerber wrote characters that are unforgettable. I either liked them or wanted to kick them in the shins. It was so easy to be pulled into this cozy mystery. There are plenty of suspects who had reason to want Desiree dead. This is a well told story that had plenty of surprising twists. I was left guessing until the very end. Daryl Wood Gerber gave us a tale that was exhilarating and exciting. This is a great start to her new series. I can't wait to see what happens next in this small California town.

Julian MacTavish is madly in love with his wife as she is with him. When a jealous woman plants seeds of doubt in Patience's mind, they fight and she goes to visit her family. She needs time to think. Can she trust her Highlander? She's a Rockwood and won't give in to fear. Tragedy overwhelms her when a deadly fire sends Caleb and Devin plunging to their death and she is scarred by the flames. Broken in spirit, she hides from Julian even though she still loves him. Can their love survive such a tragedy?  Monica Burns has outdone herself. The characters are wonderfully written. I was drawn into their story. I understood their pain and wanted them to overcome all the heartbreak. The Highlander's Woman is such an emotional story. My heart broke. Monica Burns wrote a deeply touching book that brought me to tears. The Reckless Rockwoods series is a keeper.

Keira Turner has just found out that vampires do exist, but she's not afraid. She confronts one of the most powerful vamps in Chicago. Alex Sanchez is a police detective and protector of Vamptown. He's stunned when he finds out that she's the Executioner's granddaughter. Can he keep her from revealing their existence to Chicago and the world? I loved the immediate attraction between Keira and Alex. They may be enemies but they are drawn to each other. Alec is her protector. No one will harm her while he's there. The feisty heroine and the bad boy vampire shake things up. His friends in Vamptown are humorous and interesting. They made me smile. They may be her jailors but they become her friends. The action is non-stop and the story is filled with surprising twists as they try and find out who is behind the blood thefts. I loved the scene on the Willis Tower. How romantic! Cat Devon wrote an enjoyable story that is the perfect combination of romance and the otherworldly. I love the idea that there are others living among us. The Entity Series is a keeper.

Joe Tesla and Edison are back and I couldn't be happier. They're ready to face a deadly killer who lures his victims to the tracks under Grand Central Terminal. Joe's world has been invaded and he's fighting back. Joe is such a fascinating, multi-layered character. He is a brilliant man forced to live inside. Agoraphobia has changed his life. He needs to understand his disability and gain his freedom. I found the secondary characters are strong individuals who are as compelling as Joe. The setting is perfect and helps create a feeling of tension and suspense. Rebecca Cantrell has done a masterful job! She combines truth and fiction into a breathtaking tale of consummate evil. I couldn't stop reading The Chemistry of Death. The story is so carefully plotted that the surprising twist at the end left me in total shock. I hope that we see more of Joe Tesla and his group of friends. I would hate to say good bye.

Xander Blue had never wanted a permanent relationship with a woman. He loves them and leaves them without a backward glance. When he meets Bailey Richmond, he's attracted and so is she. She doesn't want anything lasting. Why is he upset? This is an emotional and sexy story. Xander and Bailey are an amazing couple. She's a single mother who raised her son by herself. His father ran out on her when she was pregnant. She doesn't trust men. Xander came to Whiskey River to get to know his new family. He and his brother never knew their father. These two have emotional baggage, but their chemistry is amazing. He's falling for her. How can he convince Bailey that he's the man for her and Seth? Their relationship is frustrating. The attraction is powerful but so is the pain and uncertainty they both feel. I was drawn into their romance. I hoped that they could overcome their issues. I wanted them to be a family. I like Whiskey River and the people who live here. I'm ready for more stories from Eve Gaddy.

The Purple Door Detective Agency is where magical beings go for help with their problems. Sunshine Merryweather is a witch with unusual flair and a special talent. She's up to any challenge, but it becomes personal when her werewolf lover is murdered. Can she find who or what did this? I was hooked from the first page. The paranormal element gives this series a special twist. The characters are quirky and from the otherworld. I loved their differences. Aine of Ulster is the beane sidhe doomed to follow the O'Neill family. She wants help, but she and Sunshine end up as partners. Watch out world! Are you ready for this Banshee? The action is non-stop and the story is filled with surprising twists. I loved Jane, the office assistant, who is an unusual shifter. Joyce and Jim Lavene did an outstanding job. This is a well told mystery that was filled with both humor and suspense. Who knows what mythical creatures will inhabit the next book. I can't wait!

The story of two strangers forced by inclement weather to spend hours alone in a car as they drive to New York is both touching and humorous. Cher Debusshere is the black sheep in her rich and entitled family. She just can't live up to their expectations. Now she is spending quality time with Nathaniel Oserkowski a blue-collar mechanic. They are opposites in every way. They battle and fight continually and sparks fly. They dislike each other. Right?  Nathaniel is a sigh-worthy hero. He loves his sister and nephew and sacrifices his dreams to help them. He doesn't understand Cher who lets her parents control her. She won't even try to do what she wants. I had difficulty liking Cher. I kept wanting to shake her and tell her to grow up. The chemistry between these two is amazing. They were perfect together. I wanted them to be together. I just wasn't sure if Cher would stand up to her family. I enjoyed Driving Her Crazy. Kira Archer is a new to me author. I like her style and inventive mind. I want to read more of her work.

James Connor is a vampire working as a Border Officer of the Crescent Territory. He's good at what he does, but he's driven by guilt. The darkness of his past haunts him. Why is he drawn to Iris Meldeere? She's a powerful witch who could kill him with a touch, but he wants her. They're assigned to work a double murder and suddenly they're in danger. Who is setting them up? Blood Flame is filled with non-stop action and suspense. I was hooked from the first page. Connor and Iris are strong, powerful characters. They do their job and and won't back down. They can put aside their differences and work together to find the perpetrator. This commitment make them powerful. These characters are complex and I was quickly drawn into their world. I loved watching them give into their desire and fall in love. My one wish was to know more about the corrupt officials that governed this world. I felt their shadowy presence but wanted to see them. Caris Roane does a wonderful job building this world. I'm looking forward to learning more in the next book in The Flame Series.

Can a man who lives his life in the fast lane find love and happiness with a prim and proper lady? The Billionaire's Temptation answers that question. Steffi Harlan is dedicated to her work. She is afraid to take a chance on love. She saw first hand how a partner's betrayal can devastate a person. Rocco De Luca has lived his life on the edge. His passions and desires have ruled him. Now he feels restless and dissatisfied. Can these polar opposites find happiness together? I loved the battle of wills between Steffi and Rocco. When they are together sparks fly. I wasn't sure that she would be able to trust Rocco. His past exploits were not reassuring. The setting is the perfect backdrop for romance. How could they resist with such beauty and luxury surrounding them. Katherine Garbera knows how to write a sensual story. The characters have amazing sexual chemistry. The Billionaire's Temptation is an enjoyable romantic tale. I'm looking forward to the second Amalfi Nights Romance.

We all have our demons that we need to overcome if we are to find happiness. Just ask Flynn Bensen and Katherine Robinson, but they keep going and face each day with hope and determination. When these two meet in Marietta, Montana they form a bond of desire and awareness. Can they find love and happiness together? Kat has endured so much that she's afraid to believe that she has a future with someone that loves her. Her ten year old son needs all of her attention. She's shocked by her attraction to her new boss, Flynn Bensen. She can't believe that her life is so complicated. Flynn is starting over. Montana is the perfect destination. His brother is here with his new fiancÃ©e. As he settles in he dreams of love and a family with Kat. Can he get her to share her life with him? I was drawn into Montana Hero from the first page. I loved the characters. Their story is a roller coaster ride of emotions that pulled at my heartstrings. Marietta is a quaint and friendly town where people care about you. It's nice to see familiar characters and catch up with them. Debra Salonen writes from the heart. Montana Hero touched me and had me shedding a few tears. I'm looking forward to more stories in the Big Sky Mavericks series.

What happens when you sleep with your boss? Author Jessie Jameson is finding out. She's a popular author of erotic romance and renowned bad girl. A year ago she spent the night with a sexy stranger. He turned out to be her publisher Grayson Reynolds. He walked out without a goodbye. Now he's back and ready to help her. She knows he has an ulterior motive. She just needs to find out what he's up to. This story is filled with humor and passion. Jessie and Grayson are perfect for each other even though he looks down on romance authors. Sparks fly whenever they are together, but  he's a workaholic who doesn't want commitment. She wants a man who will love her and be her partner. Their battle of wills is fully of witty dialogue and sensual tension. Las Vegas provides the perfect setting for their battle. I enjoyed Tame By The Outlaw. Michelle Sharp created characters I liked and a romance that had me sighing. I loved this romance!

Saria Sands is finally safe. The ruthless killers that have hunted her and her twin have been arrested. Trouble is she can't bear to be away from her Bodyguard. Ben Hammers feels the same. He cares for her, but doesn't want a relationship. Where do they go from here?  I was happy to see Lydia and Tyler from Book one. Now it's time for Saria to find her passion. She wants Ben, but he fights his desire for her. These two have powerful chemistry which makes for a very sensual story. Ben is a keeper. He's protective and passionate and he cares deeply. He needs to put his tragic past behind him and trust in love. This story is well written with great characters that I connected with. This story had a great mixture of romance and danger. The setting is romantic and the dialogue is witty. I enjoy Joanne Wadsworth's writing and Bodyguard Pursuit is no exception. This was a perfect summertime treat.

Harrison Thornwick has lived a wild and dissolute life. Now he wants to change his ways. The unexpected death of his brother and his entire family has made him an Earl. Filled with guilt he works hard to become a better man. The Prince has decided to help Harrison by finding him a bride. If he refuses he will be punished. What's he to do! Miss Angelina Rule is his intended. She doesn't want him anymore than he wants her. The battle has begun! The characters are well written and interesting. Angelina will not marry a man that she doesn't love. She's strong willed and determined. She cares for her family and will do all she can to protect them. Even if it means flaunting the rules of society. Harrison finds that he is attracted to her which is very unexpected. He's always been a rake with the opposite sex. Now he must exercise patience and let the lady realizes that he's the man she truly loves. This is a sensual love story that is filled with witty banter and excellent writing. The Earl Claims a Bride appealed to my heart. The secondary characters added depth to the story as did the setting. I couldn't put this book down. This story had me enthralled. Amelia Grey did not disappoint. I'm enjoying The Heirs' Club of Scoundrels.

Dawn Freeze has crushed on Hawk Rain forever. Now he's home for a little while and he can't keep away from her. The Lady Elks are determined to help her. Can Dawn get her man? Dawn and Hawk are two strong willed people who go after what they want. Sparks fly when they are together. They make a powerful couple, but he won't commit until he fulfills his promise. He will bring a former friend to justice. The setting added great atmosphere to the story. The vast Montana landscape was beautiful and deadly. The people here are loving and protective as well as nosey especially Mrs. Poppins and Mrs. Hudson. The advise from The Lady Elks Secret Archives was spot on and laugh out loud funny. Rebecca Zanetti had me on the edge of my seat. The characters were larger than life, the drama intense and ending satisfied my desire for a HEA. I enjoyed Over The Top.

Who knew that a one-night stand would turn the universe upside down? Certainly not Bennett Langdon. Linc Monahan is the best man for his best friend and her partner for the night. Now life throws them a wicked curve ball. She's pregnant. Linc vows to care for her and the baby. He becomes over-protective and she fights his dominance. Where will this lead them? Bennett is such a feisty woman. She can and will make her own decisions. Linc has always had things his way. He is drawn to her, but he won't back down. Their battle of wills is monumental. I enjoyed every minute of it. Candace Havens throws in some unexpected plot twists that had me hooked. The dialogue is humorous and snarky. I enjoy a paranormal romance and this is a great one. I want to know more about the characters. I know there is more to their story. Baby's Got Bite was a quick, charming read.

Nancy Parsons is engaged to a Hollywood A Lister. What she doesn't realize is that he's a controlling jerk. Her family tries to be supportive but they are worried. Her bachelorette party is a rafting trip. It allows her to reconnect with a childhood friend and her former crush, Wyatt. He makes her see the truth about her fiancÃ©e.  Does she have the courage to stop the madness? I liked the Nancy we see when she's with Wyatt. She's feisty, funny and her own woman. Wyatt is still drawn to her. This rugged mountain man wants to help her. I liked his caring, supportive attitude. What a keeper. As always visiting this familiar Montana setting is like coming home. I love the caring attitude of the people. This is a tender, romantic story that pulled me in from the first page. Kat Latham did a great job. Wyatt and Nancy are a compelling couple. Two Nights With His Bride is a great addition to the Montana Born Brides series.

Kathy Harris is back in Harmony Valley. Rehab was difficult, but the worse is yet to come. She wants to reunite with her young son, but she has shattered his innocence with her addition to alcohol. While she is working at the veterinary clinic, she meets Dylan O'Brien. He works with injured and broken horses. They are drawn to each other and she feels that she can trust him. What will happen when she learns that he has been hired by her brother to make sure that she stays sober? I loved Kathy. She is strong and determined to become a better person. She struggles with temptation every day but keeps fighting. She loves her son and wants to be there for him. My heart broke for her pain. Dylan is a compassionate man who has gone through hell as a child and now wants to help others who have suffered as he has. Redemption Ranch is where he helps both man and animal conquer their demons. These two belong together. I wanted them together for ever. I feel at home in Harmony Valley. It's a quaint and friendly town where neighbors help neighbors. Melinda Curtis wrote a story that has it all - love, forgiveness and healing. The characters are well written and the author writes from her heart. I admit to shedding tears as I read Time For Love.

Lindsay Reynoso is a single mother who loves both her work and her son. She's a cultural archeologist and her latest job is to evaluate a California mansion. Unfortunately she has to work with its owner, Chris Brandt. The former tennis star had been her lover as well as the father of her child. The problem is that he doesn't know that he has a son. How can she work with him? Lindsay is a strong, caring woman. Her son's happiness and security are the most important thing in her life. Can she fight her attraction to Chris? What will happen when he knows the truth? Chris was known as a bad boy for his wild and reckless ways. Now he's reformed and has become a successful business man, but he has a lot of baggage. His parents were not supportive. He never gotten over their rejection. The setting of this story was interesting. Sea Cliff House and Lindsay's work to find it's treasures was fascinating. It added history and heartbreak as a background. This second chance at love was touching and romantic. The battle of wills between Lindsay and Chris pulled me into their romance. This is the next book in the Love In Wine Country series, but the novel can be read as a standalone. I enjoyed Pamela Gibson's writing. The characters are captivating and the story is skillfully crafted.

Valerie Dimitri knows what she wants and that's love and commitment. She won't marry to be a pawn to a man's ambitions. Which is why she is on the run. Her intended wanted ties to her family's criminal enterprise. She has been in hiding for a year and has a new identity as well as a successful business. Sex Talk With Serena is very popular. Boone Sullivan has a bone to pick with her. Her advice resulted in a very public breakup with his bride right before their wedding. Now that the sexy ballplayer has found her, sparks fly and her world turns upside down. What a romance! I love this story. Boone is floored when he falls for Serena. He wants her as his lover, but he feels that his career is more important. These characters are so charming that I was drawn into their story from the first page. Their chemistry is off the charts. I'm a great baseball fan so I enjoyed the baseball background. The dialogue is entertaining and the couple's battle of wills is both amusing and passionate. Catherine Mann and Joanne Rock did a wonderful job with this quick and entertaining read. This is a great addition to the Runaway Brides series.

Samantha Dekker is a Hollywood screenwriter. After her husband's suicide, she's been ostracized.  The paparazzi have stalked her and lurid tabloid stories were regular occurrences. Now she has a second chance to work at her craft. The only problem is mega-star Gage Cutler. He's the man she met years ago and was attracted to. Can she work with him after she publicly blamed him for the accident that injured her husband? Sam is a wounded creature. She lived through hell and even now she's being stalked by an unknown person who wants vengeance. Gage suffered just as much as Sam but he's trying to move forward. He's in love with her and wants them to have a life together. I was frustrated by Sam's reluctance to change. I wanted her to realize that life is too short and make a future. The secondary characters were interesting and good at causing angst. Ethan's family was way out there in their hate. Malibu Betrayals was filled with suspense combined with a passionate romance. It was cleverly plotted and kept me reading. The behind the scenes look at Hollywood had a ring of truth. I enjoyed it.

Alexis Wyndham is a crusader. She learned a bitter lesson when she was betrayed by her best friend. She was humiliated and lost her ability to trust. Now she keeps people in line by fear and intimidation, but a high school project may just be her undoing. She's working with the most popular guy in school, Brett Pederson. He's a jock and captain of the football team. He's the type of person that she detests on principle. Can we say disaster? Alexis has a good heart. She just wants to protect herself from more pain. Suddenly she's out of her depth. The more she gets to know Brett the more she likes him and is attracted to him. There is a kindness and gentleness in him that surprises her. Maybe you can't judge people by their labels. Crista McHugh has written a charming, humorous story that has a lot of heart. Her characters are interesting and the dialogue is snappy and snarky. I loved it! The high school setting brings back memories and is the perfect backdrop for Confessions of a Queen B* This story was great fun. I loved the romance. Alexis and Brett were great together. There are no surprises here, but plenty of fun. I enjoyed this novel.

If you like space operas, ideas SF, strong world-building, and good writing, you'll like Superluminal.I enjoy all of those and have really enjoyed Superluminal and the first book in the (abbreviated) series, Metaplanetary. Daniel has imagined a pretty interesting future for the solar system with a fully realized concept of virtual worlds, interesting AI, and cool concepts for engineering, military, and generally what it means to be human in many new ways that technology makes possible.There are two downsides to the series: number one, as others noted, that it is sadly unfinished. "Ames" took over the publisher, I suppose. And second, the fundamental plot motivation is a bit hard to swallow: that a genocidal dictator is somehow swaying the whole inner solar system. The latter doesn't bother me too much. In fact there have been inexplicable genocidal dictators in history, which just proves that reality is stranger than fiction (although it doesn't excuse inexplicable fiction). But more to the point, the books are satisfying for many other reasons and I'm able to shrug at the but even more you can just keep reading despite a bit of incredulity.It's worth a read despite the unfinished nature; the book delivers plenty for SF idea and space story readers, and is one of the most interesting, best-imagined examples of world-building that I've read in several years. I wish Daniel would be able to finish it!Do you need to read Book 1 (Metaplanetary) first? Technically, no, this book explains everything. But you will enjoy the series much more if you start with Book 1, I think: the characters will be richer and in particular you will have a much better understanding of the AI converts and how the virtual world works.Update: on first review, I gave it 4 stars primarily for the clunkiness of the plot and the fact the series is unfinished. After thinking more about it, I decided that was too harsh: the publication problems are out of the author's control, and the book itself is clearly top 20% in SF despite the slight silliness. And I keep wishing there were more! So I'm now saying 4.5 and rounding up to 5.

This novel starts with a great idea: what if Asimov's psychohistory (here called cliology) were taken seriously today? I won't go into the plot, except to say that it leads to the idea of a secret society and dangers for the protagonists. The good part of the book is the idea and how that plays out, and the kinds of ethical issues that arise. Flynn handles those parts well.Unfortunately, it lets us down on two other fronts. One is purely modern: the book already seems dated in far too many ways. It's only been 13 years since it was published but the plot lines involve computer details in ways that seem absurd today. I don't expect older SF to get everything right, of course, but neither do I expect to wade through pages of plots that depend on point-in-time details about online searching, that fall apart in the presence of cell phones, and so forth.The second problem is the sheer complexity of the plot line as it nears the finish line. It seems to me that Flynn wrote his way out of a plot mess simply by adding players.Finally, the plot itself involves secret societies in ways that were perhaps somewhat unique in the 1990s, but today seem like just a stale rehash of Alias, Lost, 24 and other such conspiracy shows. Overall, the dragging technology, absurd plot, and stale conspiracies make it a slog for today's reader.I give 4 stars for the concept, take away 2 for the old tech and plot silliness, and finally add 1 back thanks to the thought-provoking scientific appendix (yes, science -- of a sort -- in a SF novel!)

I got this to use with a mini LED projector to connect a Macbook Air to HDMI. It works just fine for that; picture quality on the projector is good, and it's nice to have the adapter separate from the cable. If either one stops working, I could still use the other.The reason to dock 1 star is that the cable is so heavy. It's very sturdy, more so that I really wanted for portable business usage. It takes up quite a bit of room in my case or on conference room tables. Of course for other uses, the sturdiness may be advantageous; I just wish I had known that it was so heavy.

I got this to use for brief meetings in typical conference rooms. It works OK for that if the room is slightly darkened (e.g., shades pulled or bright lights turned off). In many conference rooms, you can just turn off half of the lights and this will work fine.To use it, you will need to supply some kind of cable to connect your computer. In my case, I wanted to connect a MacBook Air, and thus used a Mini DisplayPort to HDMI cable.Getting the Mac to recognize it was slightly tricky the first time; had to select the projector for external HD input, and then go to Mac system properties "displays", mirror the displays, and reduce resolution to 720p. For some reason it did not show a constant display but blinked on and off. However, after disconnecting it and trying again, it worked fine and continues to do so every time so far (about half a dozen times at this point). There is no longer any need to mess with the Mac settings, but the projector requires selecting the external input. It would be nicer if it recognized the input automatically.Another wish is that it had a remote control. Using the buttons on top is adequate but a remote would be better.The picture quality seems perfectly good enough for business presentations. Just focus the slides using the controller and presentations will look good. The keystone feature is nice for business slides, as it automatically makes the picture "square" even when projecting upward from an angle on a table.Overall, I'm very happy with it and would buy again for portable business usage.

I got this for my daughter's Nexus 7 (2013 version). It replaced the official cover that did not fit properly (it seemed to be slightly bent and the corner popped off). Unlike that cover, this one fits perfectly.It is slim and light and looks very nice on the tablet. My daughter loves it and several people have commented how much they like it (the giraffe photo version).Overall, if I need another Nexus case anytime soon, I'll order a Poetic cover again.

This show makes you think, "Wow that must be exactly how things work in Washington." Not literally of course, but in the kind of distilled essence and feeling that fiction can communicate.The high point is Kevin Spacey's acting; it's a one man tour de force. Some of the sexual intrigue is clearly overdone ... but again, should be taken more as an exaggeration or metaphor that reveals the core of relationships.Will you like it? If you enjoy Homeland, or going back farther, The Wire or The Sopranos, then most probably you will. I'm eager for Season 2!

I got this because I was tired of plugging my phone into my stereo to listen to music. With this HomeSpot device, I can now stream with Bluetooth from across the living/dining room and control the music and volume easily.Setting it up was simple: plug it in and connect the mini-mic cable to stereo (comes with both mini-mic and RCA plugs). I searched for BT devices on my phone and it paired the first time (and every other time so far).The range is good; it's working at about 25 feet distance with modest obstacles in the way (a chair and a partial corner in between the phone and receiver). The connection breaks up when I add more obstacles (a complete wall full of appliances), which is to be expected.The only downsides are that it requires yet another fat mini-USB adapter to plug in somewhere, and the device is so light and tiny that the cables pull it and make it difficult to lie flat. Overall, I'm very happy and would gladly buy again.

My favorite SF books are idea-driven space opera -- Alaistair Reynolds, James Corey -- and the like, and this is one of best. If you like literate, idea-packed SF, this is well worth your time.The ideas are superb and present concepts that still hold up well a decade after first publication. Indeed, there is very little in the book that seems dated at all; it could just as well be a current SF novel. Many of the ideas about AI and how humans might be in the future are surprisingly unique and well explicated. The style throws you right into the world with a minimum of explanation (which is a good thing).The one issue with it is this: the world it lays out is sufficiently complex, and some of the characters are so unique, that it takes a while for the plot to get going. I almost abandoned the book about 100 pages in, because I thought it was too slow and I didn't relate to the characters. However, I kept going because of the interesting ideas. And then at about 150 pages, it started to take off -- by page 200, it was really rolling. So, if you do start it, plan to keep reading for 150 pages to evaluate well.I'm looking forward to the sequel, Superluminal!Update: I just finished reading Superluminal, and it was great, too. My only regret is that the series was not finished apparently due to the publisher. Yet the ideas and world-building are great, and it's well worth reading. I hope someday the third volume will be published.

I ordered the clear case for a Moto X phone. The case is OK -- it fits tight although the clear case (as warned) hides basically all of the phone's color.The case is a tough, fairly thick plastic and seems that it would work well to protect from a fall onto concrete, etc. Also note that it covers the buttons on the sides -- which I like, as that adds more protection and keeps dirt out of them. They work OK even though they are covered.The one minor thing I don't like about the case is that it seems just a little bulky. The product info says  "ultra thin" but it definitely has a bit of bulk around the edges; I guess I thought it would be thinner. But it's OK and if anything is better protection so that is a minor issue. I like that it is non-slippery but not as grippy as a silicone type. It's just about right to be easy to hold.When the case first arrived, it was for the wrong phone -- but I sent a note to the seller, and received an email reply within 20 minutes. They sent a new case that arrived in 2 days and refunded the purchase. That's great service. Mistakes happen but this makes me feel very good about recommending Diztronic.

If you're working on journal articles or a monograph using LaTeX, this is a great book. In particular, it serves two audiences quite well: newcomers to LaTeX who want a thorough and readable conceptual introduction, and more experienced LaTeX users who are ready to move beyond the basics.For my part, I had used LaTeX for a couple of years to do things like Beamer presentations when I needed technical slides. Then I started work on a monograph that needed a much more complete set of LaTeX features: table of contents, index, chapters, bibliography, and so forth.The core of this book is coverage of articles and books, so it's great for those. It does NOT pretend to be a systematic reference; there are a number of tables of symbols and the like, and an excellent index, but it's designed more to teach than to be purely a reference volume.Sure, you can find "the answer" to most LaTeX questions online -- but only if you know what to ask, and with no systematic presentation. This book helped give me a much more systematic perspective and saved me tremendous time with its tips and directions of where to look. It is also surprisingly readable, as much as a technical book can be. I find it enjoyable to flip through or take to the doctor's office and browse topics, and I always learn something.Finally, for anyone working on a book, this volume stands out for its very helpful (although brief) coverage of issues related to longer documents such as monographs: include, includeonly, indexing, and so forth. In addition to the core LaTeX functionality, it also briefly examines the Springer monograph class (which makes sense because it's a Springer book).Overall it's the most helpful of the few LaTeX books I have. Thanks to the author for the care to produce it!

Best of the deals for this size MTD part,Found that MTD changed thread sizes at one point so from what I see in print,  1996 and older uses 3/8" female threads and 1997 and newer use this 7/16" female thread.These OEM links were sold and shipped by Amazon, other sellers might or might not be selling MTD branded so pay attention.

Large unit capable of strong wind,  but can be set to a calm breeze speed of 200 RPMs as wellFull range speed control without detents so you can dial in whatever speed you desire between 200 & 1200 RPMs(10 CFM to 5800 CFM)Speed control can be left on last setting and turned on and off by rocker switch beside it letting the fan resume at preset speed.Seems well built using good materials..31" tall x 30" wide x 11" deepWeight on digital scale is 38 lbs (easy to move around with wheels installed)Direct drive 1/4 HP motor with aluminum 24" three bladed fanSteel drum is 19 to 20 gauge steelTube legs and frame have outside diameter of 1 1/4"Legs have large rubber feet on all four, but you can install the 2 included wheels on one end in about 5 mins with phillips screwdriver if needed.NOTE;  product description says it has "castors" but it does NOT, only normal style wheels and axles.Heavy Duty three prong electrical cord is 9' 9" long.Shame it does not have a cord wrap area built in to hold the cord for you when moving it around.I will be adding a couple to this one on one end of the frameLoosen the knobs on each side and turn the drum to any degree you need, even straight up.So far I four star "like" it....  time will tell if I five star "love" it but will be back to say so if that is the case.
Quality seems just fine, much like OEM part,  but...Photo shows two ball joints and header description has plural "Joints"  but price is for one only....

Three Amazon stars for "It's Okay"  as it seems just fine all around but is not unlike several other brands on the market and offers no special features that others don't have.Life of the fan would be the main critical feature and that can't be found without the passage of time in use, but materials used should be fine for years of service depending on humidity it lives in.Good airflow CFM for average attic ventilation but remember, it has to pull that air from somewhere so be sure you have air inlets to the attic where you want or need them.Air FLOW is the objective not pulling a vacuum in attic with exhaust only.Underwriters Laboratories (UL) listedNeeds to be hard wired into your electrical system so if you don't know what you are doing with electrical systems, install the hardware and external louvers or hood, but be sure to hire someone that knows to wire it up, test & approve the install.Steel used is about 19 to 20 Gauge120V 60Hz3.15 Amps220 Watts

This is going to be great when our arms are full...  just be sure and know how push/pull/twist is set up and that this is a non locking unit.I've used this on an outside door but only because it has a separate deadbolt lock and doesn't need a locking knob etc.This is good quality item and works very smoothly, comes with everything needed to do a new install or replace and old install....Took about 15 mins to change out old unit with this one. Works just fine but be sure to note that TOTAL output is 3.1 amps so one outlet is for 2.1 amp (left side ~logo upright~ with white USB port) and the black USB port on the right side ~logo upright~ is 1.0 ampThey state 1A for smartphones and 1.2A for tablets BUT....  many Smartphones now need the 2.1A charging to get a full and fast charge so just know if your requires 2.1A then plugging into the 1A side will be slow going.  Check your charger that came with your phone if you don't know the rating, power pack output should be printed on the AC wall chargerFor us, the only 1A charge rate devices we have these days would be the smaller bluetooth ear buds etc.Trim ring does light up if you like that sort of thing...QuickVolt has many many colors and logo styles to pick from if you click on the "quickvolt" hot link you'll be amazed...  seems all the colleges, teams, military branche logos are available on this item12-48v input with No fuse in deviceSeems fine, no way to know how long it will last until it stops working

Finally got rid of those nasty factory lug nuts with outer metal jackets that split and fall off and leave you with a Jeep lug wrench that does not fit the nut....  These are one solid piece of metal with precision cut  threads.Don't think they are triple plated chrome (no claims made by Mfg) but still better than factory nuts and look good for as long they look good..  after all they are out in the environment all the time and the wheels themselves have some blemishes anyway.Note that these are 1/4" taller than the stock lug nuts and stick out that much past the surface of the wheel spoke face, but not a problem since there is no hubcap over them and do not stick out more than the center of the wheel etc.Glad I bought them... great price as well

Proper part for Jeep Patriot, well made and grease fitting will help them live longer than original part from factory.Just be sure you don't need the whole lower control arm before you order these.. Moog makes those as well and they come with new bushings and ball joint installed, also available here at AmazonMoog RK620066 Control Arm/Ball Joint AssemblyMoog RK620065 Control Arm/Ball Joint AssemblyEven if you don't have bent or rusted control arms and/or bad bushings, the area around the ball joint can be weak with cracks or other defects....  if in good shape these ball joints are the way to go.  Amazon pricing is the best I've found anywhere, Prime shipping makes it even better.Patriots seem to go through stock ball joints at a pretty fast rate for some reason,  before buying these I researched them and found many owners giving praise for how well they work....  have yet to find anyone that has had to replace the Moog part so no mileage numbers to quote.Be sure to replace in pairs for best results and a bit less worry for the future.

Not many six blade EDF units to be found in the 50-55 mm class it seems...  this is a six blade 55mm unit of nominal qualityInside diameter is 55mmOutside diameter is 58mmFront curved rim is 68mmFront rim to back is 41mmMotor opening is 25mm x 18mm deepFan blade unit is 27mm front to backDigital scale reads 16g  including fan

Not just for truck or RV, Keep in mind that you don't have to make a 2" hole in your pretty painted fender or quarter panel to use this, there are many places you can mount it on a vehicle that keeps it out of sight but still stays easy to plug cord into...  behind the grill , fender well etc, etc  you just need to look around a bit to find a good mounting spot.You ccould even use this in the side of the garage to keep from running an extension cord out the door or window when you need it.Like other NOCO products I have, this is a quality item and designed very well for it's purposeThe rubber cap has a very tight weather seal to it when pushed in place, and the rubber lanyard keeps it where you can find it when open.This is something I can use for many things and will have to order a couple more I'm sure.

First test out of the box was with two couples playing cards and talking... music was clear and plenty loud enough to enjoy without going to full volume even.  Other couple was impressed enough that they will no doubt buy one for themselves.Very fast pairing with multiple devices and not one drop out so far...I found that I like the sound better when the unit is standing on end rather than on the rubber foot as pictured, but depending on where you place it..  one side is the powered speaker and the other side is the passive non powered port, so one side is louder than the other.  Just bounce the sound off of other hard surfaces to get what you want.Nice large rubber covered control buttons on one end, and all plug in ports with tight seal rubber cap on the other.I DO wish the rubber cap over the ports had rubber as hinge or lanyard so the cap could not be lost.  Seals well, but a little too easy to remove I believe. No doubt the rubber cap is not replaceable item.This device has been rated IPX-5IPX-5 test rating means it is protected against low pressure water stream from any angle.Under the cap is an LED set to show state of charge, Micro USB in port for charging, full size USB out for charging another device, plus 3.5mm phono plug sockets for sound IN and OUT for non Bluetooth use if needed.Note that the power supply for the LUX is 1400mah which is great for speaker use, but if used to charge your MP3 player or smartphone it would be slow going if device normally needs 2.1A charger rate.Still, a useful thing if you need some power in your phone even at slower charge speed.LUX itself charged up quickly using a 2.1A ac adapter12.3 oz on the digital scale and can fit in most coat or jacket pockets.

Love the way 5 mil thickness works, comes out more like a plastic shell than just a soft cover.  Not always needed, but price is not that much more than thinner versions and results are very pleasing.I do know that 3 mil pouches have their place and can work well for most single or double sided pages, and do use both when called for.No way to test the "Image Last" UV protection with the passage of time, but don't think a well known company would claim it works if it does not.  You can count on me returning to say if it fails over time.And if you can't think of anything to laminate, Fellows offer free downloads from their "Idea Center" to print.... clever move.Just as a point of interest, I think this is the first product I've ever had that is made in Vietnam.So far, no problems using these but nothing different in the process than any other large pouch, just make sure your laminator is up to the job of heating and rolling 5 mil plastic.

Too cold now to do any automotive testing but plastic and rubber is plastic and rubber so used these on all indoor items that were looking dull and faded..Computer case, TV frames, humidifier housing, and more all done with one towelette and looking new again.Biggest thing to note is that this does not air dry and you must go back over the item with a clean dry paper towel to remove all excess protectant.  Not difficult and wipes off without hard work needed.Mostly black plastic in the house here, but should do the same good job on any color of plastic, vinyl or rubber item.Will use for automotive dash when it isn't below zero again...Reading the back of the package, I'd recommend that you wash your hands after use and don't touch your eyes until you do.Also available in 32oz pump bottle and 1 gallon bottles;303 (30313) Aerospace Protectant - 32 fl. oz.303 (30320) Aerospace Protectant - 1 GallonUpdate 5/2015;Gave them another test and these did a wonderful job on my old black nylon convertible top, took quite a few to get done, but worth the effort for sure.

This is a nice set of "Impact" rated driver bits with wood drill bits with countersink collars in a fairly nice case with metal hinge pin and slide latch.Unlike the typical lower cost softer metal bits you see everywhere at low cost, these are made of high grade steel using the cold forged method in order to make the square and phillips bits last several times longer than the lower priced bits.Note that even though all the driver bits are stronger than most you see for sale, Irwin does not make the 3x longer life statement for the Torx, slotted or Hex head bits and HD long life feature does not apply to the drill bits themselves according to the product details listed.If you are not going to be using them with an impact tool, they should last even longer I'd say.The driver bits also have the notch to allow them to lock into devices that support lock in feature..  Power screwdrivers, full size drill/drivers, some with 1/4" hex impact feature or attachements.If you have a need for these, then you no doubt know how to use them so won't go into the basics of woodworking here etc.Good quality set in decent storage case at a fair price

Yes, it's part plastic, yes at 9.5 ounces it feels like less of a staple driver than the larger, heavier,solid metal, chrome plated brand out there...BUT...I found out within the first full row of staples loaded and driven that I could tell it was going to be better all around than that all metal beast I've had for so many years now.  You know the one......I fired staples into every type of wood I had on hand from soft pine to hard oak, new wood and some very old wood... tested with a full strip of 5/16" staples and the only (three) staples that did not go flush or below the surface were the shots that I did not hold the Tacwise firm enough or flat enough to the surface and had a bit of bounce back, and even then they were not very far from flush and only needed a light tap to seat fully.However your results will depend on the material(s) you are working with and the size and material the staples are made of.  Some cheap staples will never work well no matter what staple gun you use.First thing to try if you don't get a flush staple is to place your other hand over the top of the gun to help keep the kickback down.  Most times, this will cure the problem of not keeping device hard against work piece.Uses 140 series staples from 6-8mm (5/32 thru 5/16") Be sure to buy a good brand made of the proper metal and length needed for your projectLever/trigger pull is much lighter and less of a reach than the old stand by brand also, and the big thing noticed is that with the textured plastic it did not want to slip and slide in my hand like the big chrome plated jobs do.Lever lock works well as long as you use both lock buttons at the same time, one on each side.  Then a simple slide will lock and unlock the handle.THEN, to top things off, a METAL belt hook that keeps the gun handy while you use both of your hands on your work piece.You'll also find they added a little clear plastic removable window that keeps a paper with the owners name easy to read.

Four Amazon stars for "I like it"Plastic containers rather than glass.  Good, bad ?  Time will tell, but wish they were glass based on the fact that this will pulverize whatever you put in it including nuts and ice.  Can't be good on the plastic.Only other concern about being plastic is the handle for the 32oz blender container.  Seems the plastic handle is only glued to the side of the plastic container.  Would feel better if it had straps all the way around or some sort of bolt on system.Of course I could be wrong and this will stay on for the life of the machine, we shall see.The seal on the 32oz blender is wide with three sealing ridges and looks to be a pretty good seal and takes a bit of effort to push on and pull off... but if you use (as example) the "smoothie" or "frozen drink" setting, be sure to keep one hand on the top as it will build pressure enough for liquid to get past the seal as it pushes the lid up a bit.We made sure we did not fill past the max fill line but this thing has lots of power and the contents come to the top with some force.Each catagory of blending has a button on the front panel with an LED light for each when in use...  When you select a function it goes into preprogrammed action.  For example, if you tell it you have ice cubes in the mix, it will pulse on high several times before it goes into the speed for frothing up the drink etc.  Pretty cool...The rubber feet on the base unit are actually suction cups to keep it from walking around the counter when in use..  great feature.A bit of noise involved, but then the more power the more noise as a general rule I think...Ours did not come with any kind of owners manual at all, but don't know if that was a packing mistake or if none come with instructions.Two blades, but easy to see which is the HD cutter and which is the mixing/blending blade.For some reason they used a cord with VERY stiff insulation covering on this machine... Feels more like plastic than rubber.2 year warrantyUPDATE 12/2014;The hard and stiff electrical cord is really annoying and not easy to deal with when you move the blender around the counter top.  Sticks up in the air and will not stay down like a soft cord would.
