The once-exciting hero of the series, Michael Murphy, has become predictable and a real snooze, just like this book.

The BOLT is a cute, lightweight vacuum for small spaces and yes, it does pick up pet hair. It is not a replacement for a full-size upright; the power is less and the small suction area means going over the same spot several times. The handle is not fixed in a straight line with the handle, but swivels on its own. The vacuum does not roll on four wheels; it feels like pushing a heavy book across the floor with a yard stick.I would much rather use the hand-held vac part for small clean-ups.  It's effective and easy to use and, for me, is the best part of the BOLT.The bright pinkish-purple color is pretty and fun and very un-vacuumy.

In Book 2 of the Babylon Rising series, professor/adventurer Michael Murphy is off on another trip - this time, he's looking for Noah's Ark. As usual, he's being followed by the deadly Talon who is, in turn, controlled by the mysterious Seven.  Will Michael live to find the Ark?!This book wasn't nearly as much fun as Book 1; the writing was the same (despite a new co-author), but the plot involved so many ridiculously implausible action scenes - Michael accomplishes things no one else in history has ever done - and he does them soooo easily.There is some preaching in this book, as a character considers becoming a Christian.  This may put off some readers.  Though I felt let down after Book I, I will still finish the series.  I really like Michael Murphy and want to see how it all ends.

This is a fast-paced adventure story about an Indiana Jones-type professor/adventurer who finds ancient artifacts to prove the veracity of Bible  stories.  This time around, he's hunting for Moses' long-lost bronze serpent, but little does he know that he is being hunted by a vicious killer.I loved the book.  It's different from the "Left Behind" books; this is  pure adventure with scary scenes that really unnerved me.  There is no evangelizing here, although the plot involves the Book of Daniel.  I like the author's style of introducing disparate storylines that gradually merge into one.This story would make a fun movie. I can't wait to get the next book in the series.  Heartily recommended for those who enjoy thrillers.

I'm not computer-savvy, so I had someone set up the printer for me.  It took over an hour and I never could have done it.  The printer is, however, very easy to use.  So far, I've made 8X10 and 4X6 photos  with glossy photo paper; they are as sharp and colorful as professional prints.  I don't know how long the color cartridges (included) will last; I think this for occasional use only.This is the first Epson printer I've used. I like the small size and the look of the printer.  The price seems reasonable and I'm very happy with it.

This very pretty side table is made of real wood.  The photo shows the top center and drawers to be a lighter color, but this is not the case.  The table is one deep, solid, cherry color all over.The assembly is simple, although one leg opening required some heavy sanding to fit the leg.  The drawers are handy and have classic ring-pulls.The table comes securely packed and there were no chips.  I have two of these and like them very much.

What a disappointment!  This book is nothing more than a detailed timeline of Judi's career, an endless list of jobs she's held in the theatre, TV, and movies.  It lacks any semblance of emotion; this is especially noticeable when she mentions her husband and child in the same shallow monotone that she uses for co-workers (I don't think the word, "love" was ever used).Each page is crammed with the famous names she's worked with and she's certainly had a wonderful life, but this isn't a memoir.  It's a resumÃ© .

This is my Filipina wife's 3rd winter here and she just could not stand looking at another several months of cold toilet seats.  Our bathroom is not central heated, so it stays much colder than the rooms we stay in most of the time unless we turn on the heater.  That does not help on short toilet trips.  She yelled from the bathroom a couple of weeks ago asking if there was any kind of cover for the cold toilet seat.Well shame on me!  Of course there are covers and I should have had one that first winter.  I looked through the Amazon and Walmart sites and this was the ONLY cover that looked nice, a little padding as well... so I ordered one.But you can't tell from the photo that the UNDERSIDE of the toilet seat is very nice looking as well... compared to the other types of covers at least.  No it's not smooth like a sleeve, there's no way to do that, but it is totally covered with just a neat ring around the middle.  It kind of snaps into place with the spring ring you poke through the top and then wrap it around so the elastic outer edge covers the bottom up to where the spring ring is.  It's very nice.. no straps, no clips... just a nice, clean looking cover.  I was going to say it looks just like the picture, but actually mine fits better than that one.  Top Marks.Of course it's new, so we will have to see how well it washes, if it stains, or if it doesn't maintain the elastic hem, but I'm fairly certain I'll be ordering at least one more, and I won't be exploring all of the cheaper ones that are not in the same quality category at all.It arrived in one week, unlike most of the listings that come from China in a month or more.  Well worth the money.  I wish there were more colors.

I had to chuckle when I first hooked this guy up and turned it on... forgot my phone equilizer had the bass at max :)  I have a huge audio system with double 12" subwoofers, and the first song played was a very bassy song, so things started jumping up and down all over the room!Sound is good, though.  Very good.  Every bit as good as listening directly to a CD or other input.Easy to hook up... one power cord into the USB port to keep the little battery charged and one earphone size output jack that splits into two RCA jacks to go to my amp input.Charged the battery... it's tiny so takes only a few minutes, plugged in the wires, turned on the system and the Unify Roverbeats, which started searching automatically (blinking red and blue).  Turned on my BLU Studio Energy 2 that has a huge SD full of music and 5000 mAh battery, told bluetooth to pair, it was instantaneous.  Selected a song and.........................BOOOM BOOOOM BOOOOM BOOOOM

5 stars for VALUE, meaning that I am not comparing this "starter" phone to flagship iPhones or Samsungs, etc.  If you are looking for a top of the line phone, you know already that you are in the wrong place.What the Dash M will do for you:1.  Good phone circuitry that allows you to talk to anyplace your provider allows, plus text to your heart's content.  You can download apps like SwiftKey to make typing a little better if you want, but actually it texts just as well as almost any Android on the market.2.  Social Media works well if you have a data subscription3.  Browse the web, but pretty much only one site, maybe two at a time, since you do have a limited Random Access Memory (RAM).  It will go as fast as your provider will allow... it does not do LTE of course, but for web pages you won't notice the difference.  For videos, it should work ok in most cases.4.  Music will work fine, and sound fine through earbuds.  Only problem here is lack of storage memory, but you can add an SD card and store just about all the music you could ever need.  A simple 8GB SD card costs 3 to 4 dollars and will hold a LOT of music... and I think you can use cards 8 times bigger if you want to carry around a whole library of every song you have ever heard.5.  Games... yes it will play simple games just fine... Don't expect to play online shooters with your friends, but simple games, yeah.6.  You can download and use almost any app available and there are thousands to choose from.What it will NOT do:1.  It will not work for a long time without a charge.  It has a small battery and will need charging every night at the very LEAST.  If you listen to music or play games all day, you will need to plug the charger in often.  Or step up to the Blu Energy X for $40 more and get almost 5 times as big of a battery.2.  You will need to get a good case and screen protector.  This is the first Blu that did not include those items, but I  guess that's part of why the price is low.  Just remember most high priced phones don't include those things either.Recommendations:  If you don't need to play high speed games or to do intricate stuff, this phone should work just fine for you at a price that will not bring tears if you lose or break the phone.  You will need to remember to charge the battery and learn good RAM procedures to keep unused apps from eating your battery.  Great for teens or even kids, also good for gramma or someone that just needs to phone and text and maybe message on Facebook.For the money, this phone should not disappoint you.  I plan to give it to my 8yo if he can show me a good report card next month.

The product itself is fine for what it's designed to do.  Easy to understand if you understand electrical wiring at all, easy to operate and diagnose any issues.  I give the product FIVE STARS and I give the design and production groups a medal for achievement.The packaging and information group gets fired.  While there is ample room on the INSIDE of the flip open card, it is blank, and out falls an EXTRA sheet of paper telling you to look on the internet... it tells only the sperryinstruments.com  website and NOT the actual URL for the supposed manual you are promised on the tiny sheet of paper.  Well, THERE IS NO MANUAL on that website, only sales info, once you find the product.  There is a sales video that shows it working, which is slightly informative, but not much else.  You actually have to work pretty much from the info offered on the Amazon site and your own knowledge and intuition.  This group is hereby fired by me.

Set-up on this was a frustrating affair.  The quick start fails to tell you anything about how to load paper, you learn that on the tiny LCD screen and it is tiny, goes by too fast to understand and is difficult to get the idea.  Punching in your router password is done like an old fashioned cellphone, with abc def, etc.  archaic.  Should be done from the computer setup.  I got very upset.Used on a brand new ASUS M32 using windows 10 operating system.First let me talk about the OUTSTANDING advantage of wireless printing:  In the past, each time Windows jumped to a new O/S, I have had to buy a new scanner.  Those are days of the past now, because with this all-in-one running WiFi, the O/S doesn't make much difference.  So if you have a scanner you like, you don't have to put it away and buy a new one.  Obviously too, the other advantages include printing from your laptop, tablet or even your phone.  And of course, no danged wires.The printer is slow compared to my great HP8100, but not that bad, plus it responds even from cold very quickly.  Photo quality is the BEST of any printer I've owned, but very very slow... that's ok, if I don't need quality I can use the other printer or degrade it on the software.I have not used the autofeed on the scanner yet, but normal scanning is simple and results are clear and quick.  That will probably be my main use for this unit.  It is very much like using a Xerox, but better quality.The only fax I've received was the test fax they sent me on setup, but it "looks like a fax"... not much more I can say about that.Overall, other than my temper tantrum when I set the thing up, mainly because it just didn't seem organized and I thought the paper feed would be a little more modern than a stack of 30 sheets or less standing up from the back, illustrations on the tiny LCD screen on the printer itself rather than anything printed or online, and trying to read the quick start flyer, the manual and the online setup instructions all at the same time....... I really like this printer a lot.  I apologize to HP for expecting more, but for under $80, it is not bad at all.  Ink cartridges are tiny, obviously because they want you to sign up for the subscription service... if this was my only printer I would probably do that.

I have waited for my wife to put on make-up so she could use this product to remove it.  Yesterday she sat at her make-up station and tried out several of her new eye applications (different bases and one with glitter that she's used before) and said for me to give this full marks.  She was very pleased with the efficient way it took off the make-up and cleaned her face (multiple times) and was pleased that she did not need to rinse afterward.  Today she says she felt NO discomfort with her face and she is totally pleased with it and will buy this brand from now on.Side Note:  She does have problems with facial blemishes from time to time, so I will report that if she feels it is the fault of this product, but as of now she says she is not worried that could happen.

This is NOT a Vine review.  I paid $429 for this computer just like everyone else.  This review is totally spontaneous, no gilded edges, no embellishment, no BS.Disclaimer:  After saying the above comment, need to say I have only been using this computer for a week and I am still downloading and installing programs and apps that I am comfortable with.  I will continue to update as I find things I like or dislike, along with remedies or work-arounds.  Since this will be my prime computer, and because I spend 10 hours or so a day pecking away at it, I cannot tolerate things that don't work.  Some of my complaints will NOT be the fault of the hardware or software ASUS used, but will be caused by experiencing the Windows 10 system for the first time, as well as general difficulties installing the various apps and dingleberries required.Also please note that this is for the M32 that has Windows 10 preinstalled.  It will update further automatically during setup.  Mine took almost no time at all to update.  I say this mainly to let buyers know that this review is NOT for the 8.1 version that had to be fully updated, so rest easy and maybe skip over those reviews complaining about issues related to the update... you will not experience that problem.Initial Review:I was a bit worried when this unit arrived that there was not an instruction manual.  Every other computer I've bought since the first one in 1982 have had details so complex that I had to study it carefully before turning the thing on, and then to troubleshoot various difficulties.  THE M32CD REQUIRES NO MANUAL!  Instead, there is just a little sheet with 5 steps for setup:  (1) Plug in the Keyboard and Mouse (I used my old ones rather than the ones included), (2) Connect the monitor cable, (3) Connect the LAN cable or make sure your wireless router is on, (4) Connect the power cord and plug it into the wall, (5) Push the big power button on the front.  ASUS and Windows will guide you through the rest of the setup.Minor Difficulties Encountered:  Due to the ASUS hard drive formatting, there is a C: drive which is only 149GB containing all of the system software, etc.  and a 780GB D: drive for your data, music, videos, games, etc.  I saw nothing to warn me that my downloads would go to the C: drive unless I otherwise intervened. So I had to move a few things manually onto the D: drive.  If I'd known I could inform the computer to do that automatically, it would have saved a little trouble.  Back in the Vista days I had many hard drives installed, so I'm OK with using something like that, but it would have been nice to be prepared for it.Things I Like:1.  Since I hated a Windows 8 unit I bought a couple of years ago and returned it, buying a cheaper W7 unit instead, I'm happy to report that I had no problem adapting to most of the Windows 10 rituals.2.  Even with (now) most of my applications installed and working, the ASUS/W-10 is noticeably faster, with a brighter, sharper display (and I'm using the same monitor as before, so this must be related to the onboard graphics).3.  For the first time on a desktop, I have Bluetooth, so I can use my high quality, comfortable QY8 Bluetooth headset and eliminate lap wires... that's a big yay!  Of course the strength of the Bluetooth signal is dependent on both units paired, but I can get up from my computer, located at the back corner of the house, walk out of the office without the wires rudely snatching the earbuds away, walk through the bedroom and into the kitchen before my headset says "Out of range".4.  Fairly silent.  Yes I can hear the fan, but it is not suddenly speeding up and blowing hard to cool an under-powered  AMD CPU... so far.  Maybe when things get dusty inside the  case I will see what happens.  I have not opened the case, but I understand there is no case fan, so I guess that's the reason.5.  Full sized tower case.  My last computer was a small case that did not leave much room to improve the power supply, add better graphics, or do whatever else was needed.  YES I DO SEE THE SEAL ON THE BACK that says it voids the warranty to break the seal, but that's just BS... you would have to break that seal just to vacuum the dust, so I am not worried about that at all.  Plus if I'm dumb enough to break my own computer after all of the years I've been addicted to them, then I deserve whatever retribution ASUS has planned for me.Things I DO NOT like:1.  Some of the Windows 10 stuff, especially the useless W8 squares in the "Start Menu" and the fact that removing one thing from the Quick Access menu adds others, and others and others ... maybe I'll find how to kill that.  Most of W-10 is intuitive and easy to figure out if you are used to W-7.2.  Many reviewers have said there is no bloatware, but some have complained about it.  You don't really see the bloat unless you are looking for it in the right place, and actually there is NOT that much... in fact, what appears to be bloat is just a link to the download.I'm sure I will find other things I don't like, it's only been a week

1.  This requires a full size drill press... will not fit a mini by any means.2.  There is noticeable slop in both directions that I think can be fixed somewhat.  Some slop is to be expected, but this is a bit more than I'd like.3.  Boat anchor heavy... that's a good thing.4.  Cranks are a little wobbly, but that should seldom be a problem... plus can be fixed with a washer or two.Luckily I don't have any high precision jobs at the moment, and I don't have a boat either, so I'll put it on the shelf for now.
Wife enjoys the scent and says it lasts a long time.  She likes the convenience and says it was a bargain at the price.

First off, I BOUGHT these earbuds at full price of $24.99.  In fact I bought two (explained below).  I did not get these at a discount or for free in return for my review... what I say below is totally spontaneous and true, no gilded edges, no embellishment, no BS.Bought these for my wife.  Paired up instantly (once I'd read the tiny instructions).  Listened for 5 minutes and ordered a pair for myself.  Best buds I've ever heard, and I have MANY.  Bass rocks (if you have one and it hasn't got bass, you don't have them in your ears properly).  Absolutely clear, phone works perfectly by pausing the music and announcing the number calling you.  Volume and fwd/back will take some practice, but they do work.  Range is about 7 meters, but that's fine because the phone can stay in my pocket or on the table/desk.  If I get up from my computer desk and walk out the door, through the MBR and into the kitchen, it starts reporting "Out of range" intermittently until i get far into the kitchen.  When I get to the coffee maker, the signal is gone, but it returns as I am walking back through the bedroom to the office.  If it's a football game, at least I keep up with most of what's happening... if it's an action movie, I just pause it before I go for coffee.My wife will use these for her million calls a day and listen to music on her two phones... wirelessly.  For me it is more complicated because I watch TV entirely on my computer, plus I use e-cigs... so I have toooo many wires at my desk.  This will UNcomplicate that situation.TIPS:1.  They will be hard to insert into your ears the first few times, then you will learn the positioning.  Put the AYL lighted bud into the right ear, wire pointing down, the other into the left.  Lock by holding the little horns, then pull the horns forward until the wing tab goes under the big lumps at the bottom of your ears... you will feel when it is in the right place.  The wing tabs are flexible, so it's easy to remove the buds without hurting the buds or your ears, and if you somehow snag the wire it's not locked so tight it hurts when the bud pops out of your ear.  They are just enough so that movements when doing things like jogging or exercise don't easily dislodge them.  I like this system better than the big wings used by most earbud manufacturers.2.  Opening the charging port is hard at first... just dig your nail into the top and pull it upward.  I keep a little jeweler's screwdriver near the usb charge source that I can carefully stick under the bottom edge in case my nails have been filed too short.SUGGESTED IMPROVEMENTS FOR QY9 MODEL:1.  Instead of the little switch for volume and skip forward/back having tiny braille bumps, please put a large enough spike or tab on it so it's easy to find and press up or down.2.  The cover for the charging port is very difficult sometimes.  I'm hoping it will get easier, but I worry that I will get so frustrated I actually pull the thing off.  It shouldn't be hard to make it thick enough to get a thumbnail under the bottom edge... possibly even a little groove there to help get a grip on it.You are not likely to be unsatisfied with these MAGNIFICENT Bluetooth Buds.  I am totally tickled with them.UPDATE after 2 hours:  Comfy.  One downside if you buy these for your wife, you'll need to wave a hand in front of her face if you want to talk to her, she can't hear you. :D

My Filipina wife gets cold easily in winter.  Often she wears two layers of clothes in the house!  So this item is VERY welcome.1.  Very SOFT !!!  So soft in fact, that once it's warm, you will lose weight because you won't want to walk to the kitchen to get something to eat.2.  Warms up quickly and can get just as warm as you would like.  Just the "warm" setting is perfect for my wife.3.  Big enough to cover her from shoulders to feet... but she's just 4'9"... you will probably want to go diagonal if you are taller.4.  Washable... for when you send your spouse to bring you food because you don't want to walk to the cold kitchen.I tried it myself, room temp is 72, I'm wearing shorts... niiiiiiiiiice!

I am a snorkel diver and spearfisherman.  I seldom go below 6 or 8 feet.  That said, ALL of my previous watches, even the expensive ones, now LEAK after changing batteries.  The water here is already too cold for me to check for leaks, but I do trust Invicta to have tested it well enough... I have no problem with that.My problem is that, like the other review with the photo, I have slim wrists, so this watch looks pretty much like that photo on me as well.  For that reason, this watch will be used only when I'm swimming or doing something else that would damage my Seiko.The complaints about the small dials being unreadable do not seem to be a problem on the watch I received.  With my glasses on I can read them just fine, and without my glasses I would not be able to read them no matter what color the print was.  Besides, I don't care what date it is when I'm snorkeling.The strap does look like it might not like water very much, but again, I do trust Invicta to have taken care of that for me.No, I will not wear this watch every day to every occasion, but I still recommend it for you if you don't mind the large size and weight.  Who knows, maybe you'll need a blackjack someday.

UPDATE 11/5/15:  I ordered this phone as a backup for my BLU Vivo Air, since when my wife drowned her phone, it took a couple of weeks to get a new phone and set it up satisfactorily.  But, I thought... what a waste!  This is a darned nice phone, big battery, good audio... I'll just go ahead and set it up so all I have to do is slip in the SIM card and use it when needed, but I'll also load in a 16GB microSD and fill it up with music to use as a music pod... low and behold, it works great for that, without a SIM card.  It's getting more use than my main phone! Plus "IF" I want to play a game, browse on WiFi or take a picture... it can do that too!  So now it's hooked up to our high quality AYL QY8 Bluetooth headphones and it goes either with me or with my wife any time we want it.  Cool Deal for the price.  Too bad the NFL can't find something useful for their backup players to do while waiting. :)ORIGINAL REVIEW:As priced, this is a 5-star phone.  Obviously, if it was priced the same as flagship phones it would not be.Using this phone with an AT&T SIM card and GoPhone service, it has enough speed for most games (not all) and service is very cheap.  We live in a rural, hill country home with a metal roof and screens on porches, so finding signal is sometimes difficult with our other phones, but this one is doing just fine.  Very pleased with that!OK, the phone itself:1.  It has Lollipop 5.1.  I'm still using KitKat on my Blu Vivo Air and my wife has Lollipop 5.0 on her Zenphone2... so even at this low price, the phone is elite from the very beginning.2.  4000 mAh battery makes it almost immune from running out of battery as long as someone remembers to plug in the charger before bedtime.3.  Gorilla Glass, plus the soft case and screen protector, make this phone fairly bulletproof.4.  Sufficient CPU and RAM to pair with a large SD card will allow you to have a large number of games and music.  You might need to learn RAM management in the process, meaning turning off unused apps :)5.  720p resolution is perfectly sufficient for a 5-inch screen.  Even small text is easy to read and online graphics are just fine.6.  Cameras are a bit sub-optimal, but surprisingly sufficient .  2 megapixel selfies require careful framing and stability, 8 megapixel main camera makes carefully snapped photos look pretty good with practice.  You might be surprised how many people don't know their camera can do more than snap a grainy photo... the software included can do a good job, plus there are apps available to improve it even more.7.  Being an Android phone, there are all sorts of games and fun apps, plus learning apps.  This phone will keep a teen entertained and thirsty to learn new things.So for the price I paid for a really horrible Samsung Flight II five years ago, this phone is immaculate.  In fact, I would have loved to have this phone 1 1/2 years ago when I decided to get MY first smartphone (Nokia Windows phone).

I've been around perfumes, etc. a lot in my life, but this has a truly expensive essence.  It is powerful enough so that you can apply it very sparingly and it lasts a long time.  I can imagine it could be over-applied, but that would be sad.  Just a tiny dab here and there and you're going to be noticed close up, but not from a distance.  My nose is not refined enough to describe the scent but I will always recognize it from here on.A lavish gift for a verrrry special person.

4:05 MinsMost "telling" moment:  After I'd set up this phone with MY sim card, I showed it to my wife.  Her first words were:  "Wow Nice!  It's Mine!"Preliminary remarks:  There are already a dozen or so YouTube "unboxing" videos online and I am attaching the one by CLE Tech.  As always, most of the other reviews are idiotic, done by nobodies who made up an official-sounding name in order to get early deliveries of new Android products and did not bother to even read the specs and notes on the bluproducts site.  One "commentator" continually made a fool of himself saying "I guess" this and that and failed to know the box contained a quick charge system.  CLE Tech reads the promotional info and gives you the facts quickly, accurately and with their camera focused.If this is your FIRST Blu Phone, please do not overlook a special section at the end of this review that I've written especially for you.REVIEW:Upon Receipt, I opened the box and saw that all of the normal Blu accessories were there INCLUDING the soft case and the screen saver, earbuds, QUICK-charger, cables, etc.  Turned it on and saw the first change from previous Blu phones I've seen... BRIGHT amoled screen.  So they've learned that the YouTube reviewers base their review on that first impression.  I looked around for the normal Blu sim card drawer and it was not there, then saw the notch for prying off the back, which to me is a good thing.  Other models I've had used a dainty drawer that held the sim card and I'd rather just pry off the back, since I have a hard time finding the little key and also worry I might damage or lose the drawer itself.  This back has MANY snaps on it and is held very securely, so many in fact, that it's hard to get them all snapped when replacing the back.Sim card in, back replaced (I didn't have an available SD card to try yet) ... turned it on and it went into loading all of my apps from my Blu Vivo Air.  It pulled them all in, and added them to the stock apps that are included with the phone, many of which I will never use and probably delete, but it's nice to see what they are wanting me to use.  It did not turn on my Google Now Launcher, so I had to make that change myself, but the launcher had been downloaded into the apps available.  I like to at least start off with the Google Now Launcher since everything is right where I expect it to be and it also loads my custom wallpaper.One thing missing from this download was my phone contacts.  Instead it came up with a contacts list from the ancient past, and I'll have to look into that... IF I plan to keep the phone, against the wife's wishes.INSTANT LIKE:  Very strong signal!  The phone sensitivity is very good!  I get strong signal throughout the house, which is MAJOR since we are rural and 12 miles from the cell tower.  ALL of our other phones find the dead spots and have weak signals anywhere inside, mainly to do with the metal roof on the house and screened porches, probably.The extra RAM included (1.5GB total) keeps this unit responding at a snappy rate.  I had no problems with my apps today.This phone is a little heavier than my Vivo Air, thicker too..obviously because it has double the battery.  You'll see it when you take off the back... it is HUGE!Calls are clear over the phone speaker, music is loud and clear over the back speaker.  I have not yet used the earbuds.I should note that the phone came at 50% charge, I used it for hours without charging and it still showed about 50% when I put it on the charger.  I did not time the charge, but it was full when I looked 3 hours later.  There is a LOT of battery here.This was just my first impressions... MUCH MORE INFO TO COME.  My reviews always start small and growwwww until they become books, so check back for tips and likes and issues.Update Day two:  We took our first snapshots and selfies this morning and the selfies are very clear and crisp.  The rear camera is still a little suboptimal, but will do quite well for 90% of your pics.  It will not compare well against the big name Samsung, but for less than half the price, it does better for the money spent. It has the same specs as the Blu Vivo Air, but as a point-and-shoot it did a lot better without special settings.  I would not reject this phone on the basis of the cameras.If this is going to be your first BLU phone, here's some info about Blu Phones in general just to help you understand their concept.BLU (Bold Like Us) is an American company based in Florida, and they sell Chinese-made phones rebranded to their product name.  The phones are sold in other countries under other brand names.They are sold UNLOCKED, which means they work without needing a contract, and should work with any GSM SIM card such as ATT and the likes.  They do not work with Verizon or Sprint.If you are using the Blu to replace another GSM phone, all you need to do is open the back and slip the SIM card into the Blu and then let the software set you up (follow the instructions)Blu phones, as a rule, are well designed and fast, but with cameras not quite on the same level with Samsung and Apple.  They are generally sold at half the price of the big name phones or less and do not have replaceable batteries.  That does not mean it's a disposable phone by any means, it simply means they expect you to keep the phone for two years or less and then get something new.  They have many many models and more coming out every month.  Being contract free, you can save a great deal on your monthly service and data plans if you shop around.

Bottom Line First:Simple and convenient to use and store.  Heavier than most 16" electrics, but has adequate power and speed for most quick jobs.Background:I live on a multi-acre rural place in SW Texas.  We get self-seeding cedar and hackberries and chinaberries that pop up in places where we can't easily mow them and they grow quickly.  Using loppers when they are small is the preferred way to deal with them, but sometimes they manage to grow unobserved until they start towering over preferred shrubs, so a chainsaw is required.  I have several gas chainsaws... have not had an electric until now that I've thought was adequate or that lasted long enough to earn its worth.  This is actually the first electric I've had any hope for, but still has obvious limitations.Review:Somehow, over the years, I've gotten old.  I enjoy working on my place, but tougher jobs tend to fall into procrastination which results in me getting exhausted.  Removing small unwanted trees and trimming the big oaks and pecans fall into this category.  I have some good gas saws, but sometimes just getting them started and keeping them running while I cut many trees or limbs just absolutely kills me.  An electric would be a great help since you just pull the trigger and go, but there are complications.  Many of the trees are beyond extension cord range.  Battery chainsaws are not worth spit.  So it's all a tradeoff.I bought a few corded electric saws years ago but was never happy with any of them.  They mostly had poor chain blades that dulled quickly, were only adjustable with screwdrivers or allen keys or nuts and bolts.  By the time I ran an extension cord and got started, once I found that the job was too much for a weak, dull electric, my patience wasn't good enough to make me walk back to the shed and gas up a powerful saw, so I'd just burn the poor little electric out by forcing it to do more than it was designed for.This Black & Decker CS1216 (so far) seems to have a moderately good quality chain and power enough to do trees and limbs up to about 3-5" diameter just almost as well as the gas saws (only slower), without wearing myself out pulling the cord to restart each time I had to put it down and the idle died.  Within the 100 foot range of my extension cords, it will be a quick and easy way to do the work required without all the bother.  NOTE:  If you have experience with quality gas-powered chainsaws, you will not say this one "cuts like butter" because it is slow enough to actually feel the links of the chain hitting the tree.  It has a 16" bar, so "theoretically" it can cut something nearly that much diameter... but you'd better bring your lunch because it's just that slow.  Also it doesn't take much of a pinch to slow or stall the motor.Adjusting chain tension (required several times during break-in) is very simple but does not "look" like it will be trouble free in the future... I'll give it the benefit of the doubt for now, but will come back here and update if there is a problem.  In all honesty, though, I've never found any chain saw that I thought had a good chain adjusting system over time, but some were better than others.  This one is just a little feeble looking and feeling.This item will be fine for most homeowners needs without needing a big gas chainsaw, but please LET ME WARN YOU that if you have never used a chainsaw, ALL chainsaws are VERY DANGEROUS.  At very least, watch some of the training videos on YouTube and please use your head, especially when you are exhausted.

I've had hard and soft cases before, some even well thought out, but they were not as nice as this one.  In fact, I think this bag was designed by someone exactly like me... seems to be a custom design I would have drawn up myself.It's well-padded, all but the bottom side of the laptop compartment (but that's where the zipper slot is located for paperwork, which would add some protection) and the material is VERY well sewn and rugged.  There is even padding between the slot for the laptop and the slot for the tablet.  There is a large zipped section for manuals or paper materials, accessory pouches and of course the bottle holders at the ends, which are tight, but probably should be.Smoothly lined with bright material that allows things to slide in and out easily, and the bright color of the lining makes it easy to see inside to find things.Comparing to my other bags/cases, this one is just so convenient and simple to use.  With a hard case you have to find something to lay it on before you open it so you can get this or that out... this bag you just unzip the top, of course, (opens wide like a doctor's bag) and slide out the laptop or the tab (carries both at the same time) or your paperwork or accessories... or your bottle of water or pop.  It can be standing exactly like the picture, on the floor, on a table, in your lap... so convenient.This will be a perfect carrier for our HP laptop and Samsung 10-inch Tab 3.  We fly a lot and this will be part of our carry-on gear.  WELL worth the few extra bucks in price.  Rugged and protective while being very smart in appearance.Highly Recommended for business travel or simple commuting.  This reviewer is very impressed.

Due to other meds that I take, I am having difficulty optimizing the effects of this supplement.  I need to publish my Vine review, so IN HOPES THAT I CAN HELP SOMEONE WITH SIMILAR ISSUES, I will put this up as a âwork in progressâ.Results to date:1.  Disclaimer:  I already take Huperzine A and Vinposetine for improved memory and mental acuity and tenacity.  These have been working well for me for two years, but over the past couple of months seem to be weakening in effect, thus this attempt at boosting myself back to optimum.  I have a fairly high IQ but due to my advanced age, seem to be losing my edge without chemical help.2.  After only two days of taking two PS-PA capsules, my mental abilities returned with a vengence.  I test my ability to think by playing Spider Solitaire at TOP difficulty.  Without medication, I find myself not caring much if I win or lose and plod along using the suggested actions.  With full doses of my HupeA, Vinposetine and PS-PA, I win "almost" every game easily (I do have a "system" that helps, ask in comments if you want to know about it).3.  The caveat with adding the PS-PA on top of my original nootropics was HIGH stress.  After only two days I was jumpy and nervous, even though Jarrow's claim was for less stress... can't blame Jarrow though, I took them on top of other meds!sooooo...4.  I stopped my Vinposetine and Huperzine A and for a week took only the PS-PA.  To my extreme disappointment, I slipped quickly into brainfog.5.  So I added the Vinposetine back, still not taking the HupeA, which had been my main helper for past years.  At the full dose of 3 PS-PA caps per day plus the 10mg Vinny... stress returned!6.  I decided all of this was not worth the trouble and went back to my original Huperzine A (increasing daily dosage from 200mcg to 300 a day) and the 10mg Vinposetine.  I'm already feeling sharper than before I tried the PS-PA and no stress, but not as sharp as when I was taking all 3 meds.  For this reason I will continue working on the mix, but I will not update unless I find a positive change.  Sorry Jarrow.Yes I know that the PS-PA is not supposed to show full results on its own until up to 30 days, but I have many things to do that require my brain to be working, so I can't sit around being stupid when I know I have meds that actually work.

Small but very decorative.  My wife is the judge of course, but she was thrilled with the color, size and build quality.  She put them on immediately and posed in her selfie camera for quite some time.  If I can get her to approve one of the shots, I'll post it.  These are very very understated, but once you notice them, you can't take your eyes off of them.  Nothing flashy, just elegant.

Even though the picture in the listing makes this ring look a little cheap, on the hand it is pretty close to stunning!  Fits my wife's middle finger and she is delighted with it.  If i can find the close-up lenses for my Canon DSLR, I'll get a good shot of it for you.  It is NOT rough and flecky, but smoothly crafted and looks very nice.  Size 7 was on the money and I'm sure she will be proud of it all of her lifetime and more.

I was about to re-order my bottle of Magnesium but saw this and realized that for about the same price I can get a full mineral supplement.  I take these daily and don't have the leg cramps at night that I had before discovering the benefits of Magnesium.
These don't have the snip snip feel of regular barber scissors, but they are light and easy to use.  They cut hair and paper perfectly and I can think of nothing negative to say.
Bigger than expected, very clear, not heavy.  At the price paid, who knows (or even cares) how long it will work.  Could not be more pleased!

Ordered by my wife along with a load of other makeup items:  She was very happy with the little note enclosed and tried this item first, immediately, playing around with it for close to an hour.  Sorry if that sounds sexist in any way, it's not intended to be, I just enjoy watching my cute wife with a new type of item like this.  She absolutely loved it and started trying to think of places to wear something so "dressy".  I really don't know if it's easier or harder to apply than other eye products, but let me tell you, it made her eyes look great, standing out above and beyond other products she usually buys.  I'm sure she will be trying other products in this line as well.

Bigger than expected and MUCH nicer.  We've bought quite a few "gold plated silver" items before, many from Amazon, with varying results.  This is probably the only one that has achieved the 5-Star rating.  The picture shown does not and cannot tell you what you're getting, because you just naturally expect it to be small and dull, like the pic.  Actually it's pretty good size and the chain is connected up high (as shown), so it hangs low for an 18" chain.  The gemstones are a lovely color and would do well over a black blouse or top... But the main surprise is the way they've done the plating allows the silver to show through on the peaks of the wire, giving it the flash of diamonds.  There are no diamonds and I guess that's why they've chosen this picture so that you don't expect it, but in a lighted room, there are sparkles all over the front of the pendant.  My wife opened the box and started with the wows and giggles... she absolutely loved it!Just our own experience justifies our warning not to wear gold plated silver where it makes close contact with the skin as it sometimes results in tarnishing when  the plating wears thin... may not happen to you or to this item, time will tell.

OMG this little guy is ADORABLE!  The other reviews and the Amazon page cover what it does and says quite well, so no point repeating all of that, but let me tell you, once the little crawler of our family saw this, it was hers and nobody was going to get it from her.  She absolutely loved it.And let me testify, it is just as entertaining for the PARENTS watching their little crawler scuttle around with this thing, giggling and grabbing.  We had some great laughs.  You will not be sorry giving this to a child or grand child.  I can't see anything to complain about with it.

Lost one star (perhaps unfairly) simply because this little treasure is not unbreakable.  When we first opened the package there was a storm of activity for a few hours until there was a crash and then a lot of crying.  We glued it back together pretty well, and a lesson was learned about being careful with things you love.  He is still playing with it a few weeks later, but in a much more subdued manner.  I think it was a cheap lesson for him to learn and he still adores this toy, but knows now that the board cannot actually fly!Great toy for a 7 year old, talks and sings to him a lot, actually inspires imagination, which most toys no longer do.  Thumbs up.

Before voting this "unhelpful" please understand that Vine only allows me 30 days to review a product, which would be impossible with grass seed, of course.so.....I have pre-rated this item midway simply because it would be a waste of time for me to go to all of the prep work and watering in late September.  I will, however, plant a very small container of about 4 square feet to estimate a germination percentage and post that in about a month.  In late March I will do the full planting, provided my sample yields something worthwhile.  I am in SW Texas and April is the normal time to plant grass.I previously bought a bag of Scotts coated Bermuda grass and had fair luck with it (with persistent work on bare spots to make it even).  I don't blame the product as much as unusually hard rains this past spring that washed patches into puddles resulting in bare spots and overseeded areas.UPDATE 10/13/15:  I have added one star to the rating because I have planted my sample and have great germination.  The weather here has been fairly hot in the afternoons (85-93º) and moderate at night (70ish).  I've watered daily with a gentle sprinkle saturation.  I'm very pleased and will spread a yard or two of fresh loam in the spring and seed the entire bag.  I have great hopes for germination, but it's still to be seen how well this product can hold up to SW Texas summers.

UPDATE @ 2 Months:  This was bought for the wife's ZF2 and she loves it.  Likes the way it works and the many things that show in the window when the phone is off... caller info, alarm clock, etc.  It does absorb some of the vibration, but still noticeable if you are set to vibrate only.  Also, as mentioned by another reviewer, you can take pics and adjust volume with the front cover full open and folded to the back. I have seen my fumble-fingers wife drop the phone MANY times with no damage to the case or the phone... so buy with confidence.Original Review:Dropped one star simply because I feel like the front cover could have been a little nicer.  It reminds me of a plastic child's wallet.  Naturally, as more people begin to discover the good things about this, they'll begin to improve the looks of the front with designs or whatever.  Some of the smart window cases for the iPhone 6 and the newer Galaxy models are pretty stunning.Other than that, so far, I'm very impressed with it.  Even with the somewhat floppy front cover it is very attractive and protects the front and back from scratches and dirt.  In the event of a drop, you're not likely to do much screen damage because it covers it of course, all but the circular cutout.  In fact, this is actually the most effective overall protection I've had on a phone case, since it covers the front and the back and gives a LOT more to grip onto both while putting it away AND when using it.  When I'm just selecting items or browsing, my thumb slips through the cover hole to make dropping almost impossible.  During texting or gaming in landscape position, I put the cover downward and it gives me a more comfortable grip while typing with my thumbs.  When the cover is closed the whole thing is much easier to handle because it is not slippery like any of the other cases I've had... though yeah there are a lot of cases I've never tried of course, but this one does more to protect than you would expect.  When you do put the phone to your ear, you can fold the cover to the back and it's out of the way.First of all, it's very simple to put this on and off... it simply snaps right over the back cover of the phone, leaving a big section open at the top and bottom, so that there are no problems plugging things in and out.  Fairly easy to remove as well, simply popping it out of the back shell... so for those of you worried about heating during long charges (common for the ZF2) can easily pop the cover off to prevent excess heat.Of course the round hole in the front is cool, with a "smart window" on the front flap that shows who's calling you, wakes the phone when you open the flap, puts it to sleep when you close it.  No button pushing or double tapping.  Also I've found it's very comfortable to use the open cover and window to get a great grasp on the phone while you're using it.  With your thumb through the hole it's not going to slip out of your hand and it's a comfortable way to hold the phone... great idea!Worth the 8 to 10 bucks even if it doesn't last long, which might be the case because the seam that holds it together looks like a glue-on situation.  I'm not going to tug on it to see how strong it is.

My phone did not work for phone calls and it was returned.  I'm sure it was just a single incident with a part they used, but I have worked in many electronics production situations and know that this problem should have been detected in final testing.  Many other reviews seemed to have theirs working, so just read those, but be advised that no production system is perfect... the technician doing the testing could possibly have simply put the bad unit into the wrong tray.Update:  I replaced this with the next version of the same phone ... the Energy X (not plus) and it not only works, it works very well for the price.

I am not the ultimate authority concerning coffee.  I do love coffee and could not bear a morning without it, but I cannot see spending hundreds on an espresso machine or big amounts on the coffee itself.This packs enough punch to get me out the door with a single 16oz cup in the morning.  My first attempt came out a little weak... it was my own fault, so I tossed that and tried again with good success.  It's strong and does not leave a bitter aftertaste.That said, of course, everyone has a different opinion of any coffee.  I use a simple Krups single serving grinder and a cheap B&D coffeemaker, two tsp sugar and enough liquid creamer to lighten it a little.  I give this bean a B.

UPDATE AFTER A COUPLE OF WEEKS:On the day I got this I was making so many errors, I thought maybe I would not adjust.  But after a few days my fingers woke up and quit thinking the keys were where they used to be.  I did several exercises with "Now is the time for all good men..." and now I have nothing but good things to say about actually typing on it.First of all, with the strange layout and split board, along with the BIG bumps  on the F and J keys... my hands fall right onto the home position... I mean immediately.  There's no hunting around to make sure I'm on the right keys, I start typing FAST and continue without effort.  I already would not trade this for my old Logitechs... I'd still like to have the extra video controls and audio player controls, but typing is the big thing for me.  I programmed the F keys to bring up GOM Player and  WinAmp and a few other things and I can control those from the keyboard easily now.  You guys complaining on the first day, don't send it back, just do a little "typing class" practice and you'll never look back.  Very speedy.---------------------This is a cursory review the first day after arrival, and I would normally wait a few weeks to talk about this sort of item ... but I will add more as I get more confident using it or if there are issues.1.  Arrives with only the keyboard and a tiny fold-out pamphlet that does NOT give any instructions, instead only warnings and warranty/repair info.  One statement I should quote among the warnings says: "Long-term repetitive use of any keyboard could cause injury to user.  Perixx recommends users avoid excessive use of this or any keyboard."2.  After installation, I immediately tested every key for defects, all work fine, require very little pressure, make the normal keyboard sounds (louder than my Logitech K740s and quieter than any of my cheap keyboards that came with various desktops I've bought over the years.3.  I slouch a lot while typing and the humped up center puts the keys at an angle that is a little more difficult to read the printing.  This is my first ergo keyboard so I can't compare it to the Microsoft 4000 or any of the more expensive models.  I am a touch typist and fairly fast, but initial use, OF COURSE is confusing because the keys are in slightly different locations and the numbers and backspace keys are not as easily within finger reach with my wrists on the rest.  Most troublesome to me today has been the backspace key, which I have had to use often while becoming accustomed to things... I get a \ from where my normal backspace position would be... I will acclimate.4.  Due to the repositioning of the keys, this is especially frustrating to use for a non-touch typist, especially due to the key labels being at such a slant away from the typist.  For me, that might be a good thing, since it will keep my wife away more... she tends to change settings and I don't like her to use my computer... heck she has two computers of her own... no need to use mine anyway!5.  The quick keys at the top are set to give quick internet access, email, search, volume and mute and a quick sleep key.  Since I don't use the same browser and email Perixx uses, I'll have to figure out a way to reprogram a couple of them.  I use WinAmp for music, and I'm well accustomed to using the home cluster of keys to operate that, just a little rusty at it since I've been using Logitech K740s for the past 5 years or so, but it's coming back to me.Note:  After about 4 or 5 hours of speed typing today to get used to the new positioning, I am still making some mistakes (I've been using standard keyboard positioning for 50+ years) but getting better at it.  My wrists are SORE and that worries me, but hopefully it's mainly due to a lot of tension rather than the new angles.  I do like the keyboard and I will add many notes below this as I use it.  Updates about issues will be at the top of the review.

My wife has Filipina straight black hair to her butt which I love very much, but suddenly got the notion she wanted to color it blonde.  I would hate for her to do that, especially since it would take years for it to look natural again, so I suggested we buy this wig so she can see how she would look.  I think I won that skirmish, but it's no reflection on the wig itself.  It does look very synthetic and she says drops hair, but for the price, it's certainly what it was intended to be... a cosplay wig.  It's cute and would be fun for play.

Quick review here to make it clear that there are indeed 6 bottles and 6 colored lids... pic made that unclear.  Good quality and low price.  Only possible critical point would be that the stoppers are hard to get on the first time.  These will be useful for my e-liquid home lab since the tops are easier to remove instead of re-using the pop-off spouts on old e-juice bottles.UPDATE:  These bottles seal very well with no leakage at all.  I would suggest widening the metal needle to allow the thicker mixtures, especially the pure VG to flow through better, it requires a hard squeeze to slowly fill the clearomizer tanks.  Great product none the less.

A welcome replacement for my second Logitech K740 that kept popping off keys.  I miss the mute/volume keys and the audio player controls, but simply having a full set of keys and no nubs to have to press where keys used to be is a blessing.  This is a simple keyboard but even if it only lasts a few weeks I will be happy.  Buying it on Prime and using bonus points made it virtually free anyway, so I have nothing to complain about.UPDATE after a week of heavy use:  I find this keyboard comfortable to use and allows fast typing once again (missing key caps on my old keyboard was very frustrating to someone who types fast in a creative mode, so it is a freedom that I'd been missing).I do find that a few functions are different or altered on this keyboard, however, on specialized applications... for instance, on my GOM player I can no longer use the control (numberpad) functions the way they should be, which is frustrating.  Because of that and the lack of audio function keys, I've decided to buy another keyboard for everyday use and save this one for emergency situations.  I'm not complaining about it though, because the price was so good.

This will be a first impression review of 3 Sony earbuds bought at the same time:*** MDRE9LP (the Ipod type that only sits inside the outer part of the ear)**** MDR-EX37B (black body insertion type)***** MDR-EX25LP (tiny unit that goes entirely into the ear)All arrived in the typical over-engineered packaging that you can see that the designer is the only one that knows how to open without destroying the packaging.  I've yet to figure out why.Background:My wife uses earbuds all day, home or work.  Connecting to her BLU Selfie phone, her HP Laptop, her Toshiba Chromebook and her various Samsung tablets.  She goes through them quickly, but we've had bad results from buying cheap buds, especially the Panasonic RPHJE120 line, which we bought 5 different colors and are all in a drawer because they don't align easily in the ear and have low output volume and very low bass... unacceptable even though they are Amazon's #1 Best Seller.  She prefered to tape together some of her other broken earbuds and limp along with those instead.  Her favorites to date have been the nice earbuds that came with her BLU phone and some very old ones that came with an Ipod she seldom uses anymore, but both of those are held together with scotch tape and come apart easily.Soooo, I decided to buy one each of some Sony units to see which she liked.  We both tested each using the same song at the same volume out of the phone.She likes the EX37B ones the best (first quick use).  These were priced at $13.99 and are the standard kind of L configuration.  I like that they have a rugged appearance and a very good stress relief so the wires are not so likely to get damaged when she yanks them out or they get snagged on something as she rushes around while using them.  To me (refined pitch perfect audiophile ears), they are a little distorted and loud, but have tremendous bass response.Second she liked the tiny EX25LP.  THEY WERE MY FAVORITE BY FAR!  These were priced $14.99 and are little egg-like things that fall completely in the ear with only the thin wire coming out.  My concern with these was that there is no stress relief for the wires at all, but upon trying them, we both remarked how easily they slide exactly into the right place in our ears, no alignment needed and they come out VERY easy... but do not FALL out on their own.  They fit perfectly and have a very good sound, but not a huge bass note like the EX37B and our BLU phone buds.Lastly she didn't like the MDRE9LP units that just are like little speakers that do not go into the ear canal, like so many you see and exactly like the Ipod buds she likes so much.  These are hard to place properly in the ear and don't have the volume or bass quality of the other two.  They are the cheaper of the trio at $8.99 and I don't see these being used unless it's a choice between those and the Panasonics.I will UPDATE this review as problems or wonders happen.  Stay tuned.

Update after a month's use:I like these buds the best of any I've had other than the ones that came with my BLU phone (best sound quality of any earbuds I've ever had).  The thing I like BEST is that they are so easy to place in my ears, there's no screwing them into the ear hole or twisting them this way or that to get the best sound.  They just fall right into place and stay there... comfortably.  These do NOT have a huge bass boost built in, they are fairly a flat response, so that you do the "coloring" with your software.  I can easily wear these the entire time I'm watching two football games (6 hours) without discomfort, and each time I get up to get more snacks, it's just a simple light tug on the cord to remove them.  They are well worth the price.  Your experience may vary, because I can't imagine all ears are the same size, but these fit like they were custom made for ME.---------------------------------------------------This will be a first impression review of 3 Sony earbuds bought at the same time:*** MDRE9LP (the Ipod type that only sits inside the outer part of the ear)**** MDR-EX37B (black body insertion type)***** MDR-EX25LP (tiny unit that goes entirely into the ear)All arrived in the typical over-engineered packaging that you can see that the designer is the only one that knows how to open without destroying the packaging.
