This item does exactly what it is intended to do, provided the door and its trim are even with each other.  If they are not, you may have to add a piece of wood under one side or the other to make them even.  Bear in mind, however, that devices like this only make the door so it can't be opened "easily".  If the person on the other side is so determined to get in that they don't worry about the noise, they can smash through the door or break a window to get in.  Ours is just on a hollow core door that goes to an insecure utility room, so it would be very easy to smash through even if the screws on the door hold perfectly... that kind of door is pretty much made of cardboard.  Our thinking is that nobody could come in without making enough noise to warn us... bang!For the person who wants to put this on a front door so you can open it just a crack, kind of like the "chain latches", it will work fine and cannot be unlatched from the outside, but yes, just the same as with the chain, if the guy out there is going to blast through with his shoulder, the strength of the door itself and the screws holding the latch on the door and trim come into play... most screws will give way pretty easily to a solid shoulder smash to the door.  You can make it a little more secure by substituting stronger, longer screws that go through the trim and into the door jamb, and nuts and bolts that go all the way through the door, but for normal situations where you're making sure it's the pizza guy at the door, the included screws will work fine.

I do my own e-liquid mixing and use a 50/50 blend of pg/vg so that I get more vapor and it's still thin enough to mix properly and not clog my atty.  The cheap price of the Froggys is the main attraction, plus I could use my Prime shipping.

Since going to the "Spinner" type of battery, I've needed to go back to the old type of eGo charger rather than USB.  I only had one left and it was going slowly, it seemed... I've owned probably a dozen total, some cheap, some more expensive.  This particular charger, which I assume is Chinese-made, charged my 1600mw Spinner II in a matter of two hours, from totally dead to totally charged.  Compared to the old one, which I've always considered my best one, it's magnificent.  Highly recommended.If it continues to work well I will add another star, but if it slows as the others have done, or begins to become mechanically defective or get so it won't connect properly as some have done, I'll be back here to complain :)  As of this time I'm very pleased indeed.UPDATE:  Though this charger is still working very well, my backup charger died and I think I'm finally seeing why.  I leave the chargers plugged in and powered up all the time.  Stupid me, I'm an electrical engineer and never even thought about screwing one battery out of the charger and replacing it with a discharged unit WHILE THE CHARGER IS POWERED UP.  Since the eGo batteries are circular at the connector and you have to kind of move them around to find the threads, you will inevitably cause a short at the charger connection.  I will now simply snap the USB out of the puck anytime I swap out batteries on the charger.  It's probably been that lazy bad habit that has killed most of them in the past.  I would love to have one that had a power switch on the puck to make that a little easier and safer.

I agree that for the price, this is a good bargain, but I want you to know what you're getting here.I would NOT want this to protect a door, because it is all made of thin sheet stainless and it wouldn't withstand more than a shoulder push.  You can also see by looking at the pic there is NO place for you to put a padlock, so that claim is poppycock.BUT, if you want something convenient for the inside of a window, this is well worth the price.  It slides shut and clicks into place, holds firmly.  Press the button and it pops open with ease and stays full open until you manually slide it shut.  So this is perfect to mount on both sides of a window to make it secure from an outside lift.Also you would not want this for protecting a child from opening a cabinet door.  It might take the child a minute or two, but eventually it would find out how to press the button.I bought this simply to hold an attic door closed, not locked, because that silly door comes open by itself.  This will do that job just fine.  The advantage for my use is that if the door should close while I'm inside, the latch won't lock by itself, it has to be pushed into place purposely.

Update Aug 23:  I've mostly solved the "invisible button" issue by asking my wife to paint the button with red nail polish.  It still allows the light to show through and makes it easier to find the button visually.--------------------------------------------------This will be a review of the Spinner II vs the original Spinner vs the eGo USB vs the eGo-C vs the eGo variable voltage wired pass-thru.I've been using eGo systems and accessories since their inception, so I can tell you about all there is to know, I guess.  I'd been using various drip systems when I found the eGo drip version, liked the long-lasting rechargeable 350mw battery that was so much more simple than removable batteries, so I've stuck with a simple system that worked well for many years.  Pretty much the only changes I've made were increasing battery capacity and going to the simple Innokin Clearomizer tank system.  It's a system that is fairly durable, makes enough vapor to satisfy me but not make a cloud that is so obvious that I'm easily detected in questionable zones.  But you only want to know about the batteries, particularly the Spinner II... and you guys that use baseball bat sized battery systems that you still have to drip into so you can make an explosion of vapor are not going to be interested in an eGo anyway... so here goes:The new Vision Spinner II differs from the original first of all that it is more powerful (1600mw vs 1200) and about a 5/8 of an inch longer, but since the switches are located at about the same place, I doubt there is "actual" battery located in the extra length.  It's a tiny bit heavier and about the same diameter... see attached pic.  At the 3.8 volt setting, both of my vision batteries make the same amount of vapor as does the USB battery.  I use 3.8 volts because the higher settings tend to make me go through atomizers and liquid faster as well as charring the liquid and making it taste bad after a tank or two.Other points for the new Spinner version are a detented control that has a slotted bottom that I guess is intended for a coin in case you don't have a strong grip.  The old version turned more easily and just had a narrow grip that turned way too easily and often got reset accidentally.  Also the place at the top where you used to be able to screw on a "beauty ring" is gone, which allows the overall length to be less... you can see from the pic that the black battery portion is about an inch longer in the new unit, but overall length is only a half inch or so longer.My single complaint would be the button, which is only to be found by looking for it... you can't find it by touch like on the old one, but that's fine with me.  Other guys have complained here about the top breaking loose when they carry the unit in their jeans pocket, and that's a design flaw in the original and all other eGo batteries.  Don't put them in your jeans pocket.  I usually just keep mine in my hand since I constantly puff, but if you go into a restricted zone you'll need to find a hiding place.  Pants with long, low pockets are good.I still have and use ALL of the battery systems listed on the top line of this review and tend to use the pass-thru more than any other, simply because I am a computer addict as well as e-vapor addict... so that's where I usually hang out.  I prefer this new Spinner II simply because it has a powerful, long lasting battery and allows me to be mobile for longer times.  Of course I have a 4amp charger in the car, so I don't often get caught with dead batteries anyway, but of all of the systems listed here, the USB's seem to last the shortest time before expiring forever.  I've broken many in jeans, and I've worn many out, but I'm not ready to go to a baseball bat sized battery either.I like this one and hope you will to.  I'll update if I have any problems to tell about.

I'm rating this 5 stars because the unit is as good as you could get for the money.  Granted, for more money you could have more expensive fittings, etc, but they are really not necessary unless you are going to be constantly moving and reassembling.This is my 3rd unit for the house one in downstairs kitchen and one upstairs as well, replacing a 12-year old system that's never caused a problem other than a leak in the UV two weeks ago.  Sure I could have replaced just the UV but hey it's time for a complete new system.Complaints about the clarity of the instructions are unfounded as far as I'm concerned.  I was replacing a similar unit (different brand) but there were no parts of the old system re-used other than the metal fitting on the cold water pipe, which still required the new compression fitting.  The only difficulty with the instructions was the slightly upgraded output faucet which was not covered, but easy to figure out the difference and install.The main caution, as said by a few others, is to make sure you seat the tubes fully into the fittings... it's covered well in the manual and on youtube, but I still managed to have one leak afterward, which was hectic since I already had the unit on the wall of the cabinet and it was now full of water and pretty heavy.  Push those tubes into the fitting HARD so you can feel when it goes that last 3/8 of an inch.PROs vs the older unit:1.  Very very nice that they pre-assembled the filter portion, that saves probably 45 minutes for you.2.  Tubing diagram, in color, makes assembly and troubleshooting very easy.3.  This unit has about twice the water volume coming out of the faucet, which is nice if you're filling a coffee pot.4.  Extra Filters includedCONs vs older unit:1.  Does not include the UV sanitizer, and they point out twice in the instructions that you need that if you have any chance of microbial pollution.  If you are using city water, it's probably not needed, but those of us in the country will need them.2.  Not one complaint about the purchased unit itself.  Good quality.I'm almost 75 years old and assembled this without help.  I'm blind in one eye, a little senile, and have problems crouching for any period of time and even worse trying to get back up from under the sink.  I'm sure it took me twice as long as most people, but the result was well worth it.  I like the color coded tubing, easy to see where things go and come from under the sink.Suggestions for easier assembly:1.  Install the faucet first, with the tubing left full length2.  Install the input line from the cold water pipe, leaving the tubing full length3.  Install the tank, tubing full length4.  Install the drain tube cut to the length since the junction with the sink drainpipe is near the front.5.  Place a large rectangular plastic dish pan in front of the cabinet and assemble the connections there, so that you can turn it on and check for leaks before hanging the unit on the cabinet wall.  That way you can easily see and fix any leaks without making a puddle under the sink.

This review will compare the Sonicare to the Cybersonic II, even though the Cybersonic II is not available.  Reason?  Because I'm thinking many people bought them about the time I did and are now looking for a substitute, since the Cybersonic 3 is almost identical to the original model and reviews say it doesn't last long.  My Cybersonics lasted about 6 years each.Reasons the Sonicare is better:1.  Faster motion means more scrubs per minute2.  Smaller brush head fits easily in gaps where teeth are missing and gets deeper between normal teeth.3.  A little smaller and lighter4.  Metal spindle and interface between handle and brush.  The Cybersonic has a plastic interface that wears out quickly if you have a family snapping brushes and flossers in and out daily.Reasons the Cybersonic II was better:1,  Has a very, very good flossing system included... the best I've ever seen2.  Bigger, more stable charging base with places to store brush heads3.  Cheap replacement brushes (providing you didn't fall for the "free brush" scam where they sent you a new brush each month and charged 6 bucks for shipping) and flosser snap-ins.  Of course this cost depends on how often you replaced brushes and flossers.Other comments:1.  Cybersonic batteries kept charging fully for many years, I will let you know eventually how long the Sonicare batteries last.2.  I can see right away that the small, light charging base will fall over easily and possibly drop the unit off the countertop.  I'm thinking once I am sure where I want to keep the charging base, I'll put a dab of silicone caulk under it to hold it steady.3.  Don't get me wrong, I do like the Sonicare, it's speedy and really feels like it is getting my teeth cleaner, but I will still keep the remaining handle and floss heads of the Cybersonic until they die completely and then look for more on eBay.  That flosser is a thousand times better than flossing string or tape, works very well and very fast.

Spent the extra bucks and expected the best... and got it!  Two day Prime delivery, received this afternoon and installed immediately (old cheapie was leaking, flooding the cabinet below).  Downloaded the installation manual yesterday and studied it, so all went very smoothly.  Moen takes the trouble to make installation of even a commercial product simple enough for a non-plumber.Heavyweight item, no slop in the spout rotation, smooth working valve and even the sprayer was a quick connect deal.  The only difficulty was in removing the horrible cheap faucet that was there before and had been leaking for some time apparently... hard work to break the bolts loose and get it out of there, but from then on it was easy peasy.  No leaks, no trouble at all other than the coiled plastic hose for the sprayer getting snarled until I realized running hot water through it would straighten it out.Well worth the extra dollars and then some... you won't regret this purchase.

This is made by Enerlite, which is the same brand as the sensor/switch I was replacing.  The old one started giving problems after 3 months or so by intermittently not switching ON.  Sometimes it would just blink, but then you'd have to go to the switch (located at the kitchen sink) and manually slide it to ON.  But then of course you had to remember to turn it back to the center position in hopes it would work the next time.  I called Enerlites who simply told me they do not handle customer complaints and for me to contact the retailer.  Things gradually got worse until the unit would never switch on by itself.So the reason I ordered THIS switch was that I thought it was made by someone other than Enerlite... ah well.  If I have a problem I'll call Top Greener rather than Enerlite this time.As a precaution, this time I installed a double box (a little sawing required to expand the hole) and installed a manual switch next to the new sensor.  I did this because this particular Enerlite switch does not have the slide switch located on the outside like the last one did, you have to pop off the bottom cover (over the pushbutton OFF switch), so that would mean if this switch failed in the same way as the last one, I could not turn the lights on manually.  The manual switch I added simply bypasses the sensor and is easy to work and with a double plate there and the rocker switch, it looks very nice.Installation situation:  My kitchen was originally kind of dim, with a single light bulb over the sink and another over the kitchen table.  It meant that most of the long countertop had bad lighting and often a shadow so it was hard to see what you were doing.  I installed lights above each of the double doors of the upper cupboards so that they shined down from above your head, and also shined into the cupboards, making a WORLD of difference lighting the work area.  I simply connected the new lights to the old single sink light.  That sounds ugly and kind of stupid, but it was done very nicely and it actually makes the right amount of light for the area using 5 13watt CFL bulbs.  The sensor switch allows you to switch on the lights simply by approaching the work area and it is set to 5 minutes duration, just in case you are standing still too long.  Originally I had it set to less time, trying to "save electricity" but it would time out and be irritating if you had to stop what you were doing to wave at the sensor.  But with the 5 minute duration, you're pretty much certain to move enough to reset the timer and not have the lights turn off while you're still there.  I was very pleased with the original Enerlite switch until it started failing to turn on, and the new one is working fine as well, so far.  If this new one lasts more than two years, I'll be happy and give the rating a 5th star.  If it does not, it's cheap enough to just buy another.  With the parallel bypass switch, I don't foresee any problems.

I've been using rechargeable Enerloop batteries for so long that I didn't realize the price was so low on good alkalines now.  We've used about 8 of these so far and all work.  If I become unhappy with failures or storage life, I'll let you know

Amazingly hot!  Wife loves these and bought them in red and blue, now wants black as well.  They fit her tiny feet nicely (she should wear 4 or so, but heels seldom come smaller than 5, so she manages to make do).  She likes the easy-on back zipper and the light weight.  She's a bit wobbly wearing these, since they are the first really tall shoes she's had, but she will not be going on long hikes wearing them and of course she'll get better at balancing.  I'll let you know if there are quality problems.

These are large for my wife, since she wears a 4 flat and 5 heel... so a 5.5 is a little long for her, but still manageable.  For the price, she will keep them and happily wear them.  They are actually very cute on her in spite of the size disparity.
Wife says they are very comfortable and she likes the look and fit.  That's what it's all about, right?  She said the shoes are nice enough to wear anywhere, for any occasion.

I haven't used mouse pads since I got rid of my last ball-mouse 10 years or so ago, but I made a pull-out keyboard shelf for my desk, just to give me more legroom under the desk, and made the shelf out of white rough-surfaced shelving from Lowes.  The mouse was NOT happy with that surface causing skipping and difficulty doing fine movements.  I bought this pad simply because I want it to stay in place AND the fact that it is very thin rather than a big piece of plastic or a thick pad.  It excels amazingly for this function and causes me no discomfort at all, plus the mouse is functioning the best it ever has.  I'm very pleased with it, and it wipes clean easily.  Remains to be seen how it holds up to the wear of the mouse constantly moving over it (the surface of my desk where the mouse used to move is like polished glass compared to the rest of the desktop, so I know there is a good test for the pad for the next year or so.Nothing has peeled up around the edges and the stickum is holding... I placed it where I wanted it and have not tried to move it.

We bought this a few months ago hoping to use it as a special cloth when we want the table to look a little more snazzy.  It's a very special handmade inlay oak table that is easily damaged by moisture, so I have a solid plastic cover over it and a linen cloth over that for normal daily use.  I just today needed some snazziness, so put this on top of the black linen.  It does look nice at first glance, but the lace is very, very thin and actually looks very machine made.  A bigger complaint is that it is actually painful when you put your elbow on the table, kind of cutting into your skin!  I guess for twenty bucks you can't expect a really nice one, but hey, I had hopes.

The first unit received was DOA, but if you read the first comment below, you'll see that Sabrent was anxious to make it good and to make me happy.  They sent me another unit and it works beautifully.  I appreciate their concern and good service.  This one plugs in solidly and seems very good quality.Sound quality is very good and this unit is much more rugged with the aluminum case than another brand we bought before that was just thin plastic and cracked open soon after purchase.  I'm sure this one will work for a long time.  My wife's laptop had no output from the headphone jack when purchased "refurbished", so we have to go this route, which is not a big expense.  I will be so happy not to have to suffer the bad audio from her laptop speaker ... it's been a long hard route, buying a usb speaker that wasn't very much better than the laptop speakers, then the fragile plastic usb sound adapter (not made by Sabrent).  I'm happy now and appreciative of Sabrent's concern and trouble taken in this matter.

I bought one of these for my wife's bluetooth headphones and now it is in her phone, working perfectly and simple to add/remove files via the phone USB.  Kingston has never failed in all the years I've used SD cards.
Magnesium is a requirement for prevention of muscle cramps and a myriad of other problems caused by the weak American diet.  This particular size is perfect for me.
Well-made cable for the price.  Used to go from my outdoor amp, under the house and up through the floor at the entertainment center.  Perfect length and good quality.

But sadly she didn't use them.  Says they are hard to position in her ears and have low volume and not much bass.  She'd rather continue to use her BLU earbuds scotch taped together or her very old Ipod buds.  For that 35$ I could have bought her some pretty nice earbuds, so today we just put these away for emergencies and ordered 3 different Sony BLU ones.  I bought the group of 5 simply because Amazon said they were the #1 best seller and there was a slew of 5-star reviews.  I don't know if these were a bad batch or if those reviewers had just never heard good earbuds, but live and learn... you can't always trust the reviews.

The Orbit 62062N Digital Outlet and Manual Outlet Two Valve Water Timer is a SINGLE VALVE system with two water outlets, which means you will experience a pressure drop in both water outlets or you will have to cap the second outlet.  The product description says it is a TWO VALVE TIMER, it is not.  Also the instructions for the product could be greatly improved. I can not think of an application for this product where a person would need a single time to control two water outlets, because the single outlet device of this type, that cost much less, will do the same thing by adding a inexpensive Y adapter.  The item is not worth the money.  Hope that helps.

WIll not work with many devices.  This item is much smaller then the picture implies.  It will not work with American made GPS systems.  It will not work with other type of DC devices such as inflating compressors.  The adapter too shallow for DC Auto plugs to fit in and stay in.  This item is NOT save because the DC auto plug will pop out or the contact points are above the upper edge of the adapter.  The device puts is labeled as putting out 500mAh, however it does not come close to that, which means this adapter could damage your electrical devices by not providing proper electrical power.  The low price of the item makes it a "throw away after disappointment" device, because the return shipping cost is more then the price of the item.  I would suggest that you not waste your money on this "Generic Unerversal AC to DC Car Cigarette adeptor. .Hope that helps.

The Lotus & Windoware 1-inch Vinyl-Plus room darken-light filtering blind is of Very good quality and has a Very good price when conpared to local available products.  Also easy to install with a few power tools. Blinds can be cut to be a custom fit using a very sharp power saw. I used a power miter saw.  I highly recommend tapeing the blind tightly together before attempting to cut and make sure that the ends are even.  Tapeing before and after the cut point helps to stabelize the blind and you will get a smoother cut. MEASURE TWICE CUT ONCE.  I will not hesitate to order again in the future.  Hope that helps.

ITHe Bluetooth Headset S530 is a remarkable product.  However, I do believe that the next generation will be much better.Good Things:1. The fit in the RIGHT ear is exceptional.  It is comfortable and stays in place.  The instructions says that it is designed for the RIGHT EAR ONLY.  So the picture is misleading.2. The sound quality very good.3. It paired very easily with three different generation cell phones.  I suggest that you be a little patient with it and remember to hold for 4-5 seconds OR until the device light starts to flash red then blue.4. Music streaming is very good and the music can be paused by touching the multi-function button or when an incoming call arrives.5.  Two quick touches of the Multi-Function button and the last number dialed function is activated.  REMEMBER Two QUICK touches.  Two slow touches and the devices switches to Chinese language(Don't know why it is designed to do that.).6.  Device informs you when connected and disconnected.  Hopefully in a language that you can understand.Now for the NOT SO GOOD:1.  There is no voice commmand dialing function.  You must use your phone to initiate a call.  Inconvenient, but not a failing issue.2.  There is no volumn control on the device.  You must use phone to vary volumn or you can pause the music or incoming call--that is really Inconvenient.3.  There is NO audio track forward or back advancement function on the device. Again you must go to the sending device, the phone, to advance the music track.4.  The device drops and restores signals for no known reason. Music streaming sometimes will have intermittant failures, which can be irritating.(Remember you can not back up the streaming).5.  The device is designed so you can easily convert the language to Chinese.  There is no need for the two language system. If you should stumble into the Chinese, just push the MFB again and you will go back to English.NOTE: The instructions are difficult to understand because of ovbious language difference of the writer.  And a caution, the device is small and can be fragile.  I would recommend that you charge the device twice before using.  When charging the Red light will be on.  It goes off when device is "charged".  However it is a good idea to remove the charging cable and reconnecting it to facilitate a FULL charge.  So all things considered for a device that fits confortably IN YOUR EAR and provides clear music streaming and voice conversations, this product is a good purchase at the price.  Even with the short comings mentioned above, I would recommend it for those who do not require the more dynamic highly functional Bluetooth headset.  Hopefully the next version will have all the missing features mentioned above.  Hope that helps.

Superior music from the era when the people knew good music when they heard it.  Wish the country could go back to the good music era and move away from the same sounding screaming and strange utterances.  Hope that helps.

Well built sturdy cable, however was a special purchase for specific device which did not work correctly.  On its own, I would highly recommend the product if you need a short cable.  A plus on the shortness is that the cable did not take up a lot of space behind the devices.  Highly recommended.  Hope that helps.

DID NOT WORK.  I tried this E-More 1080 HDMI to Component Video YPbPR on two different TV systems and the video signal could not be seen. As a final test, I attached device to a DVD player, using the HDMI out on the player and the Component input on the HDTV, still no video.  Disappointing that I have to continue to search for a functioning device.  The Hatachi "HD-Ready" set requires a fully functioning device to make the HDMI to Component transition.  It appears that this device does not convert any video signals correctly because when I set both devices (sending and receiving) to 480i (SD basic) the E-More 1080 HDMI to Component prevented any signal from being displayed on the screen.  Possible that I got a defective model because it appeared to be used, but such risks are not acceptable so I can not recommend the E-More 1080 HDMI to Component conversion adaptor. Hope that helps.

Strange product.  There are NO instructions for use, so I had to fully charge it then play with it for a while to learn how it works.  Does not work as other models.  That being said.  The sound quality is very good.  Other models have a problem with the cable becoming rigid, this is made of different material so that problem does not seem to occur.  There are some difficulties experienced with positioning the device in the ear.  Perhaps because of the bend in the ear piece, but once positioned, WITH THE OVER THE EAR HOOK, it seems to stay in place during moderate exercising.  All thing considered, this would be a GREAT product IF it came with instruction for use.  For the price, it is still a good purchase.  If I could not find a better product, I would purchase again.  Hope that helps.

Strange that many people have experienced the same problem with the Brother MFC-J870DW and I and others have experienced with the Brother MFC-J825DW, in that over time the quality of print starts to diminish.  Currently my Brother MFC-J825DW give very poor quality BLACK printing.  Cleaning the printer only seems to make the problem worst and CONTRARY to what you may have heard, probably from Brother, it does not seem to matter if you use Brother's more expensive cartridges or OEM cartridges.  In all cases the quality of the print goes from pretty good to very bad in a short period of time.  It would appear that the Brother MFC-800 series uses the same print head and that print head clogs or becomes defective after using for any period of time.  I have used other Ink-Jet printers and I have never had a gradual diminishing of print quality.  I have attempted to find out from the vender (the product seller) if there is some way to clean the print head and restore print quality, but the vendor had not responded to my requests.  My next attempt will be directly to Brother.  Perhaps there is some secret that is not disclosed to the consumers.  In any case based on the number of "poor print quality" reviews I have read, I am reluctant to purchase another Brother Ink-Jet product.  I have the highest reguard for Brother Laser printers, but my respect for their ink-jets is fading as fast as the printer's print quality. Hope that helps.

NOTE: This is a very heavy cable.  I purchased it because it was the only DVI-I (24+5) that I could find that was Prime.  The cable will not fitproperly on the Dell monitor because of the thickness and rigidity of the cable.  I was able to test the cable's performance on a HDTV and it delivers a very good signal.  BUT, I could caution purchasing for use on a computer monitor because the cable is not flexible and the ferrites on the cable are very large, obstructive and heavy.  For monitors with cable loads on the side, this may be a great cable, however it would seem that the weight of the cable would excessively pull down against the monitor plug-in and MAY eventually cause harm to the monitor.  All cables have some degree of pull on the plug-in, but this cable is much heavier then any cable I have ever dealt with.  In summary, this cable is difficult to work with because of thickness and rigidity.  The signal that the cable delivers is not any better then thinner cables supplied by other vendors.  Hope that helps

These ear buds are not as advertised.  They are larger then displayed and the ones that I received were USED.  I can not evaluate the sound quality because they would not pair with any of the cell phones that I have.  They had to be returned.  I would not recommend them.  Hope that helps.

Excellent cable, but I have found that when dealing with BlueRigger, you can expect the best quality product and the best service.  I would recommend this product to anyone who is looking to buy a cable.  BUT remember that DVI comes in two pin patterns.  DVI-I is 24+5 and DVI-D is 24+1.  The right cable will get the job done right.  Hope that helps.

Not much to say about these little bubbles.  I was able to attach one to my power drill and I now know when I am holding the drill to produce a better drill point.  They are simple, as small as I hoped and they work. I only needed two, but the set was 10.  I guess it is better to have and not need then to need and not have.  Hope that helps.

Works as promised, but better then expected.  My old battery has been exhausted because the charger blew during charging and the power drained from the battery.  With this charger, I was able to recover the battery by using multiple charge sessions until the battery was up to full power.  The price is much less then replacing the Power tool.  For those who have had problems with this item, I would suggest that you charge the battery two or three times before attempting to use it as the battery may need a multiple charges to fully recover.  Again, I am glad that it worked better then I expected.

This did not give the number of pages that it advertises.  I suspect that these products dry out while in storage waiting to be sold.  The rumor that using a Brother product gives a better quality picture, greatly depends on the product that it is compared to.  This is an above average product, BUT, and this is a big but, the price difference is not justified.

The sprayed on leather-look material first cracks, then it starts to peel off and becomes a real problem.  I asked furnature repair experts and there is NO way of preventing this product from cracking, peeling and falling off.  It seems deceptive that the seller would use the word LEATHER in the title and description when there is no leather on this product.  This is not bonded leather, which is thin leather bonded to fabric.  The covering is made of chemicals, most likely, sprayed onto a fabric that is not conducive to the process.  Secondly the mechanism that supports the chair is proned to comming loose and if you do not keep an ear open for the tell-tale sounds of metal snapping, you run the risk of the chair frame breaking.  That's right, you should take a wrench and from time to time tighten up the bolts, but not too tight.  It is unfortunate that one can not replace the phony L-look padded area, but then again there is the issue of the frame that becomes unstable if not frequently attended to.  That being said, IF and only IF you are looking for a moderately comfortable chair to use for a short period of time, say a year or less, this is a good product to have.  BUT beyony that time and the product starts to deteriorate.  Also, keep in mind that the safe weight for use of this chair is 250 lbs or LESS.  This is not a good product, but it does have its uses.

These cartridges are a Freaking joke.  I pulled the tab on the side and the ink ran all over my hand.  It took a lot of effort to get the D>>> ink off my hands.  Then I noticed that the cartridges continued to leak.  I had to clean the ink off my desk, the printer and the floor.  I plugged the hold and quickly returned them to Amazon.  I would not recommend installing these cartridges, but if you chose to, then I would advise that you wear gloves to keep your hands clean.  Again, These cartridges are a joke.

Rockwell RK3440K VersaCut Circular SawThe Rockwell RK3440K VersaCut Circular Saw is actually a Circular Saw. It is NOT a hand held cutting tool for several reasons.1. The blade is covered by far too much material and makes it very difficult to line up a "plunge" cut. You simply can not see the blade unless you put your face close to the material to be cut, which is never safe.2. Because of the non-varying blade speed, when hitting the different densities in wood, the VersaCut tends to kick back or jerk , which will radically alter the cutting pattern and in some cases create a do over situation. Also, the Rockwell RK3440K will kick back when cutting thin sheet metal, which may have been cause by blade wabble, but it was a real surprise as I struggled to maintain control of the cutting device.3. Changing blades is a chore because it requires you to handle two Allen wrenches, one to prevent the cutting blade from turning, and the second to loosen the blade. Then there is the problem of the blade shield being in the way. You have to pull the release trigger, which is very near the power button, then push the shield out of the way to get the small cutting blade off and on. (you should unplug the VersaCut before attempting to change the blade).4. There is a safety issues with the Rockwell RK3440K VersaCut Circular Saw, in the location of the power trigger. It is difficult to get your finger off the device when it is moving because the trigger is located so far forward on the grip.5. The thickness of the grip makes it difficult to control the device.6. The laser is a nice feature, but it is pointless when the saw dust covers the cut line. All the laser does is makes the dust easier to see.It would appear that Rockwell, an exceptional company, simply reduced the 7 1/4 circular saw, keeping all the problems that made a new product desirable, and miniaturized the circular saw.All that being said and considered, is this a BAD product? I would say NO, BUT I would not recommend this product for novice, journeymen (persons), generalist, or those who are new to the construction and home repair efforts. If I had the time, I would keep the Versa Cut and practice, practice practice, until I learned all its quirks, But I do not have the time. The Rockwell RK3440K VersaCut Circular Saw is a fairly good product for professional users, but it should be greatly improved for the average less experienced user. Hope that helps.

I did not expect TOO much from this product as others have not performed as expected, BUT I was really surpursed, this American Made power cord does not become rigid in cold weather.  Bless the US.  It delivers high power to the snow blower and with the increase power it give enough power to the SnowJoe to break up ice and throw the ice out your way.  It feels good to buy an American Made Product that meets or exceeds the advertisement. I would highly recommend this product for contractors or home project do-it-yourselfers.  Hope That Helps.

Ordered, but not received.  I have seen this product on monitors in offices and they seem like a great product. Just like the store versions; Slightly over priced, but they work well for about 5 uses. Don't know what else to say about the product. Hope that helps.

The Back2Life Continuous Motion Massager does not do what I expected it to do.  My lower back was injured many years ago in Viet Nam and occasionally it will shift and cause pain.  I have had massages and chiropratic treatment that does a short term relief.  I was tired of making the trip to the "store to get the fix."  The machine looks SILLY, so I ordered the model that was advertised as coming with an instructional DVD to fully demonstrate how it works.  What I received was a unit that had NO DVD, but a set of 5 pound leg weights.  I wondered what would be the purpose of wearing leg weights while using a machine that GENTLY lifts you.  Was the weights designed to make it more difficult for the machine to work properly?  Perhaps the DVD would have explained, but there was no instructional DVD. I contacted the vendor TWICE and got no response.Now about the Massager:  I am 6'1" so I set the machine to 6'4" tried it AND NOTHING.  I lay there on the floor for 12 minites and wondered what I was doing wrong because the machine did not LIFT any portion of my body off the floor.  So I set it to 6'6" and again notihing, but this time the machine would cut itself off and I had to wiggle to get it to come back on.  My wife who has nearly constant low level back pains, is 5'2", she tried it and what she got was a numbness in her legs and feet, but no relief of her back pain.But I kept the faith and tried again.  I noticed that the height of the lift at 6'4" is the exact same as 6'6".  I decided to do an experiment.  I lay on the floor with my legs on the end of the bed and my head on a comfortable pillow for 12 minutes, and the results were the EXACT same as with the Back2Life Continuous Motion Massager.  I felt a very slight relaxation in the S-region of the lower spine, but nothing as wonderful as promised by the glowing reviews.  Perhaps, there is a secret on the instructional DVD that greatly contributes to the wonder of the machine, but remember, I did not get the promised DVD.Maybe, just maybe I received a model with a "lazy" motor that refused to actually lift your lower back off the floor, don't know.  What I do know is that the end of bed experiment achieves the same results as this machine and the bed is free.  So with hopes shattered, I must return the Back2Life Continuous Motion Massager with a message that says, "Wish you worked."  Hope that helps.

My Wife loves the stuff.  I hate the smell, but as long as she is happy, I will put up with a lot of things.  Excellent product, dont understand why the local stores do not continually carry THIS FLAVOR.  They occassionally get it in, sell out quickly, and then do not reorder.  So my thanks to the on line providers.

I don't understand the rave reviews for this product because I have not found it to live up to advertisement.  For one thing there are multiple versions of the OrGrennic pans avaialable.  The ones with the silver rim around the pans are .4 mil thicker then the pans without the silver rims.  The thicker pans tend to hold up better.  I happen to have both types of pan.  In any case after a very few uses on a ceramic or glass top cook surface the fry pans will develop "Sticking Points".  This will happen regardless of the amount of oil that is used in the fry pan or the lowering of the tempature of the cook surface.  I have returned three pans to a local BB&B store and got clear instructions as to how to preserve the "NON-STICK PROMISE" on the replacements.  None of the suggestions have worked.  Also the pans tend to warp and will not sit flush on a flat cooking surface. The center point of the pan, where the OrGreenic label is stamped pushes down making the pan have uneven cooking areas.  Solution: Very Gently, tap of the bottom of the pan at the OrGreenic Label will correct the problem but only for a short period of time. Also, after using the fry pans for a very short period of time, if you clean the pan, as directed, and hold the pan in sunlight, you can see the dull discolored "Sticking Points".  SO, I am still searching for a TRUELY NON-STICK fry pan and unfortunately I have found that the OrGreenic pans are not that.  Hope that helps.

The Kitchen replacement faucet works.  The replacement took only a few minutes and it has been working correctly since installment.  For the price, availability and quick order turn around time, I would highly recommend this product.  WHY 4 and not 5 stars: the product is shoter then the previous model and not as heavy, so it does not represent an exact replacement, but it is a very good substitute.

The Cozy-Heater 250 Watt Wall Mounted Electric Panel Heater smells like a buring electrical product.  The photograph shows an item that APPEARS to be 24'W x 18"H x 2"D, BUT the actual product is 18"W x 24'H x 2"D, which makes a differece in where the item can be mounted.  The item arrived in a box that pictured an eligent looking heater that had a front switch on the upper right hand corner, which is the heater that I ordered. What I arrived in the box does not match the picture on the website no the box.  Also, the panel heater arrives covered in white dust of an unknown nature. The toxicity level of which is totally unknown. The heater has to be cleaned off before initial use.  Further, the "NEW" heater design requires that the electrical wire remain in close contact with the heated surface, which should be considered a serious safety hazard.  After much email, discussion, and confusion, I returned the product and was very glad to be rid of the odor, yes the product continues to smell when it is not in use.  Regarding the effectiveness of the product, it does not appear to function as a "CONVECTION" heater.  If you place an opened tissue at the top of the product, there is NO AIR MOVEMENT, therefore the hype that it is a CONVECTION heater that draws cool air in at the bottom, heats that air and disburses warm air is simply not true, the air movement is to minimal to be considered a CONVECTION heating system.  I gave this product one star, but it truly deserves less.  There exists a very slim possibility that I received a defective product, but accepting that indicates that there are other ones in the sales distribution system.  I would avoid this product.  It is unfortunate that the previous front switch model is not available.

I bought this set for my 8 year daughter and she loves it. It's easy to use and add decoration to her journal pages and letters that she writes to family. There are three different tape refills that fit into the dispenser and are super easy to change. The tape set arrived quickly and the seller is friendly and professional.

The first thing I want to mention is that this book should not necessarily be taken as a parenting how-to book. Unless the advice really fits your personal parenting values. However, this book is a necessity for all parents who just need a good laugh - and that's all parents. When you're a parent, you need to take a break from all the work, worries and stress that parenting entails. Then read this book, laugh out loud, and wish you could do and say all the things that Elizabeth recommends in her book. It's written with advice and personal anecdotes from her childhood that she believes are useful tools to raise happy and healthy children.Don't let the idea of guilt and manipulation scare you away from this book. Yes, it's full of guilt and manipulation tactics that I admit I've thought about but have never used. Now I feel embolden with the knowledge that these tactics can work. I've encountered many of the parents and their children that Elizabeth writes about in her book, especially the playground bully and moms who sexualize their daughters by dressing them like party girls. Admit it, we've all seen this.The author sometimes spends a little too long on her personal experiences growing up in Las Vegas but I'm sure it was to add pages to the book, and very specific examples of how her parents style of raising their kids makes the case for guilt and manipulation to work. Her experiences in growing up in Las Vegas were often different than my Midwestern upbringing, but I enjoyed her advice just the same. I didn't just enjoy it - I laughed hard at many of her anecdotes and observations. Okay, I'm not really going to work at raising my kids this way but sometimes wish I had the courage, or had Tony the Ant on speed dial.

I have tried other natural and organic mists to help relieve sinus infections but none have helped as much as this mist. I get several sinus infections due to severe allergies and neither I nor my doctor want me to take antibiotics that often, so I've tried to find a natural treatment to help out. I decided on this mist because of so many positive reviews and I'm so glad that I did. It has helped so much that I didn't use any medication during my last infection. I also use nasal rinses and talk to my doctor before ANY treatment. After saying that, I think this is a great product to help those of us with regular allergy and sinus problems.

This is so much better than Vick's Vaporub. I really love Badger products and my family uses many of their products. They are organic, affordable and really work. For cold and flu season, this is a must have in our home. It's as effective as Vick's but completely natural.

I absolutely love this pen. I regularly add lettering to my art and the sumi brush gives beautiful results. This particular brush tip has great spring and gives nice thick and thins in lettering. The body is metal and comfortable to hold. I keep this pen on a tray because it is also beautiful. Wish I could buy several colors of this pen.

I have very sensitive skin and don't use peels or masks because they tend to make my skin sting and turn red - even the natural and organic peels. I have to say that this peel is no exception. The first time I used it my skin felt like it was burning. But that was for the first two or three minutes and then the burning stopped. Now even a couple of minutes is a lot of time when your face hurts. After I rinsed off the mask, I will admit that my skin looked good. It was smooth with a refreshed look - brighter might be the best word to describe it. But my skin was not red. I waited a week and tried the peel again. I experienced the burning again but for a much shorter period of time, and again my skin looked really good afterward. I have a feeling that there is a cumulative benefit for the skin when using a pumpkin peel. So I tried it a third time and noticed very little stinging (not really burning now), but still have nice looking and smoother skin. I use the peel only once a week just to be cautious, which will make it last for me. Since I have experienced good results and reduced burning I gave it four stars and have to say that I do like. This may be the only pumpkin peel that I can actually use.
Great medium pink color ink that I use in my pink Cocoiro pen body. At this price, it's worth just trying it.

I wasn't sure a 2 cup measuring cup would make much of a difference for baking, but I was wrong. I mostly bake bread and using a 2 cup measurer speeds up the process. The cup has a small pour spout for liquids, but I use it to measure flour and occasionally sugar. It's fairly light weight but that hasn't been a problem when just scooping into flour. I'm glad I took a chance and bought it.

I just love these Cocoiro letter pens. I think the Yume-Ichigo is the strawberry pink for the N.A. market. The color of the pen is true to the color shown on my monitor - a soft, medium pink. I use the rose pink refill and I have a fun color lettering pen that is comfortable to hold and fun to use.

I began using Gallery Leather planners many years ago but after we moved I couldn't find a local store that sold them. I was thrilled to find them here on Amazon. I like to use both my calendar app. on my smart phone and a traditional planner, mostly because I can write faster than I type. I use my app for reminders and alerts. What I like about this particular planner is it's good looks, clean and easy to use daily pages, and lined pages each week for lists and ideas. The company still includes pages for personal/birthday information, extra note pages and several maps, which occasionally come in handy. I especially like the fact that it's slim and flexible so that it fits in my tote or handbag, and the company keeps making them in the same colors so that I have an elegant row of tan planners on my shelf. If your looking for a timeless looking and useful planner, this is the one to get.

My 10 year old daughter loves owls and wanted a pair of owl earrings. Because she's 10, I didn't want to buy her earrings that were too big. These are actually quite small, which is perfect for her ear and they look appropriate for her age. They would be too small for an adult unless you like very small ear studs.

These are the best laundry bags available. I've tried so many other bags and a consistent problem is the zipper pull breaking away from the zipper. This makes the bag troublesome to open and close, but also leaves a sharp edge that can mar or cut other garments that are also in the washer. I will try to wash a few delicates at the same time but they don't all need to be protected in a bag. I found some items damaged and think that it must be the zippers on the bags. The Laundress' bags have a flap that folds over the zipper thus eliminating any rubbing of the zipper on other clothes. And should the pull break away the flap covers it. I highly recommend purchasing theses laundry bags.

Great bright color in this classic ballpoint pen. I have noticed a few companies introduced vintage style pens in retro colors and thought they were great looking. Then I remembered my father's Parker pens that wrote better than most others. So I'm so glad I bought this (and a couple other colors) because it didn't disappoint. It writes perfectly and is a bright color that is fun to use.

I wanted to use this oil for a while before I gave it a fair review. I purchased the Prickly Pear Seed Oil because I read in a few sources that it is highly beneficial to skin as an anti-aging moisturizer. There are a few new skin care products that include this oil and most of these are quite expensive. I do have very sensitive skin but no serious aging issues - yet, and I didn't not want to spend much money for a moisturizing oil. I did a bit of research and found that it is indeed very beneficial for skin and health. As a skin care product, it includes high levels of omega fatty acids, vitamin K and vitamin E, even more so than argan oil.I decided on this particular brand because it is organic and is a very good price for a 1 ounce glass bottle. Many oils containing prickly pear seed oil are much more expensive and some are blended - not a pure oil like this one. After using the oil for nearly two months, I can say that I do like it with one caveat. It smells bad - not overwhelmingly bad, but an odd earthy smell. The smell dissipates like most oil aromas do but I thought I should warn buyers about this particular aspect. The natural smell may be why some companies blend it with other oils to increase the appeal. However, it is a really nice oil that absorbs quickly and moisturizes for hours. I use it at night and my skin still feels and looks soft the next morning. I have not had any reactions to the oil, and I think that this 1 ounce bottle will last a very long time.Another review mentioned that she thought the oil is too watery and may not be oil at all. I have to disagree with that comment. Not all oils are thick and viscous. Some are quite light and watery. This is a thinner oil but definitely an oil that seems to work very well. I recommend this oil if you are interested in trying a pure, organic prickly pear seed oil at a better price than many other brands.

First let me emphasize that this is a very technical book, one the author even recommends for college level Electrical Engineering course work. The book is filled with detailed summaries of technical knowledge that Electrical Engineers should know upon graduation. While each chapter teaches the facts and equations anyone would likely learn in a typical course on that topic, having it all clearly and expertly summarized makes it an excellent resource for any newly-minted EE.However, donât let the word âSkillsâ in the title give you false expectations. The book is filled with facts and equations, but to me thatâs not the same as skills. To make sure this is the kind of book youâre looking for, be sure to read the table of contents first. I didnât, so I was expecting chapters on skills like working with other Engineers, developing project estimations, giving presentations, troubleshooting, etc. The book is much more a technical resource than a career handbook.The last chapter on finding a job and starting a career is the one non-technical chapter in the book. Itâs full of great information that new graduates probably donât get from their course-work, but the three sections on getting a job, keeping a job and enjoying your career comprise a mere 19 pages combined. What is there is terrific advice, but itâs very high-level and doesnât dive into much detail.Aside from the last chapter, I believe most Electrical Engineers will learn the knowledge presented in this book through any credible EE curriculum. While having all of this knowledge in a summary format is certainly helpful, it wasnât quite what I was expecting based on the title. That said, if youâre looking for a technical refresher you can turn to as you start your EE career with a few job hunting and career tips thrown in, this will be a great resource for you.

My 9 year old daughter and I read this together and we both had similar opinions about the book. After my daughter read a classic novel, she was read for a more adventurous book. This one delivered the adventure with a great amount of of trouble, misfortune, misunderstandings and evil. The protagonists are children, particularly one girl named Ali, and the antagonists are not fairies but imps. My daughter particularly liked the magic of the imps and the imaginary environments in which they live, but didn't feel any connection to the story or the characters. While the theme isn't new, I was hoping for a more insightful story for my daughter to read. I felt frustrated by plot twists that were too twisted to easily follow and character descriptions which were sadly lacking. There also were too many breaks in the plots twists and story lines which left distracting gaps for the reader. However, it's a decent coming of age story where a nearly middle school aged girl realized her own intelligence and strength to save the day. Unfortunately, that realization is still an imaginary child "magic" instead of the innate strength, imagination and understanding that children actually possess.

I searched locally to buy these pins, which I use for knit fabrics, and could not find them. Luckily Amazon has them and they are just what I was looking for. These really are the fabric pins to use for knits so that the threads are not torn during pinning.

I'm so glad I purchased this highlighter set. My daughter is using a reading method called text mapping and she uses several different colors of highlighters. Traditional highlighters were too bright on the page but the mild, pastel color set is much easier on the eyes. The lighter colors also make it easier to read the text beneath the highlighted color. This brand works very well although I can't yet comment on how long they last. For now they mark easily and with less color strength. I recommend these if you want a softer highlighted effect.

I have been looking at these beautiful pencils for several months and was so excited to finally try them. I compared them to my Prismacolor pencils and right away noticed a few differences that might be important to a fine artist. First I will say that they are beautiful, and I like the color on the end of the pencil. If you have a large set, this would make it easy to find what you're looking for. However, the pencil shape is round instead of hexagonal and they easily roll around and off a desk or table. The colors are marked with esoteric names instead of pigment names or numbers. If you work in multi-media art it will take work to match one of these pencil colors to the color of a paint. The colors are very pretty, but I when comparing to my current set I thought they were less smooth and did not blend as easily as the Prismacolor. I blended by using a colorless blending pencil and a lighter color pencil, and with both techniques the Tombow pencils were still too rough. My final thoughts after using them is that they might work better for crafters who do not rely on pigment names, or for students who are moving to a middle quality pencil for their art.

I have a few sets of drawing pencils and find that each manufacturer makes their pencils a little different. I was excited to try the set by Tombow and my first reaction when I opened the package was surprise that most of the pencils are in the soft range. In fact 4 of the pencils are soft, 1 is an HB, and 1 is a 2H. Most other artists pencils sets include as least one more hard pencil. For example my Faber-Castell set includes 4H, 2H, H, HB, B, 2B, 4B, and 6B. Most of my art is botanical so this range is great for me.I compared Tombow's set to both my Faber-Castell and Palomino sets. Like other reviewers stated, the Tombow pencils laid down dark and they are quite soft. When comparing the 4B's, the Tombow was the darkest followed by the Palomino and then the F-C. In fact the Tombow 4B drew as dark as my Derwent Graphic 9B. The Tombow graphite is rather soft but smooth, and the finish on the pencils is is the slickest of all my sets. I did notice that the pencils slipped a bit as I sketched. When I sharpen pencils, I prefer to use a metal hand sharpener by KUM because I think electric sharpeners take off too much and "eat up a pencil." The Tombow pencils sharpened to a beautiful point. My favorite piece of the set is the MONO Zero eraser. I don't have an eraser this small and found that I really like using it in small and tight parts of my drawing. Overall I think they are a nice pencil to use the the set is quite nice for a nice price.

I like to use high quality skin care and like I to use a moisturizing oil as night. Argan is one of my favorite oils to use on my normal to combination skin. In a few seconds after applying, it sinks right into my skin makes it so soft. In the morning, I wake up to soft and healthy looking skin that is not oily or dried out. The 1 ounce size of argan oil in this set has lasted me a long time. I ordered it over 3 months ago and still have over half a bottle left. Naturally, I used the cleanser the fastest and I won't buy this again. It is a creamy fluid that isn't to my liking, and I didn't feel like my skin was thoroughly cleaned. I did like the moisturizing lotion, which I use during the day if I don't wear sunscreen. For my skin type, it goes on smoothly and adds just the right amount of moisture. It may not be enough if you have very dry skin though. Kahina is a well liked brand of skin care, especially the argan oil, and this is the best way to try three of the products without paying too much.

Lonely Planet has published some very nice books and this is no exception. It is not a large book at 9 3/4 x 7 1/2" in size, but at over 200 pages it touches on many of the great natural and man made wonders of the world. I do say "touches on" because the information given is brief. I would consider this book an introduction to each wonder, with enough photos and graphics to start research for a student or spark the imagination of young and old alike. Even though the book is not encyclopedic, the information is more than just a picture, title and esoteric paragraph. There was enough thoughtfulness and consideration given by the author so that some amount of details are presented to explain the origin of the wonder. The only suggestion I'd make for the book is to add the location to the name of each wonder title. Otherwise, my family has thoroughly enjoyed the book, and I'd recommend it as a helpful resource for the student, the curious or the traveler.

I like paper straws better than plastic for environmental care reasons. The paper straws also come in more colors and designs that adds a festive look to a party or celebration. I like for my girls to use these but they do become soggy quite fast and then then any liquid can't pass through the straw.

My daughters and I have used washi tape for a couple of years now, and have enjoyed embellishing cards, envelopes, journal pages, and even making art with it. I hoped that the decoration pen tape would be just as much fun. It is easy to use - you just click the end, like a ball point pen, roll and release. The pen lays down a decorative tape. I purchased two pens and one works perfectly so far, but the other doesn't cut the tape when I finish rolling. I had one instance where the tape just came out wrong. It looked like it has twisted a little on the cartridge. This is the tape roll that came in the pen so haven't changed anything. I can't comment yet on how long the tape lasts but will add an update after finishing one of the rolls.

I always appreciate a truly organic product that does what it says. I have used several tinted moisturizers over the years because I don't like using a traditional foundation. I have normal skin and this goes on my skin perfectly - it blends in easily, adds just the right amount of tint to even skin tone, and moisturizes my skin all day without looking or feeling too oily. I even like it better than Jane Iredale Dream Tint and Josie Maran's Tinted moisturizer. When my skin is a little drier in the winter, I just add a little Suki Nourishing Day Cream.

Beautiful brush pen. It has a nice weight and size to it that makes it easy to hold and use. The owl and moon design is quite pretty and makes it a little dressier that the other brush pens that I use. It is also easy and inexpensive to buy the brush refills because they are the same as the Kuretake CocoIro Brush letter pen. So far I have enjoyed using Letter pen and expect to be using it for many years.

I use many Suki products and I really like all of them. Again, Suki put a great deal of care into this body scrub and it does work. One reason I continually use Suki skin and body care is the organic quality. Her products are really and truly organic - not just a little bit. Like the exfoliating cleanser (a must-have for me,) the body cleanser exfoliates with oil and sugar. The sugar is not as harsh as other exfoliants and then it dissolves as you use it. The body oil works in tandem with the oils to exfoliate and soften at the same time. The natural, slightly citrus aroma is a nice addition. It does come in a glass jar, which I prefer to plastic, but a little care in the shower is needed. Organic sugar isn't just safer for our bodies, it's safer for the environment too -no small plastic beads or bits going down the drain, which don't often get filtered in our water systems. These plastic beads have now shown up in the ocean and in some of our lakes. I only gave the scrub four stars instead of five because of the price.

My first impression of the L'Occitane Almond body oil was a good one. It is a pretty glass bottle of 3.4 oz., which is a good size. While the ingredients are not organic, they are also not too bad for a conventional body product, although I did not check the ingredients against a source like ewg.org. However, here is one exception - perfume/fragrance, which is listed third in the ingredient list. And it is a strong, synthetic fragrance that is an irritant for people like myself who have sensitivities to perfume. If you don't have any sensitivity to perfume, you may like this body oil, but it is not a soft, floral or herbal scent. It is definitely a perfume which could clash with any other fragranced bath and body product.The packaging for the oil says it provides 48 hours of hydration, which is what the 48H means on the box. It does a nice job of moisturizing the skin, but I did not notice 48 hours of hydration.  It probably performs much the same as other body oils that are priced lower. I've decided to include the list of ingredients here because they are very hard to find online: sweet almond oil, capric triglyceride, parfume/fragrance, oleyl alcohol, camelina seed oil, rosa canina fruit oil, sunflower seed oil, bergamot fruit oil, carrot seed oil, tocopherol, dioleyl tocopheryl methylsilanol, limonene, linalool and citrol.

Evan as a fairly technical person, I had some difficulties setting up the Zepp golf swing analyzer, and I attribute most of the problems to poor instructions. There are no instructions in the box whatsoever, just an easily-missed card with a web address.At the web site, step one is to download the app - easily done. Step two is to turn on the Zepp unit, but the picture indicates the power button with a dot on the top surface NEAR the corner, when youâre actually suppose to press ON the corner in towards the center. I spent 10 frustrating minutes just trying to turn the unit on, and didnât succeed until I found a support page with more clear instruction.Step three is pairing, which was straight forward, but after pairing I got a pop-up on the iPhone saying âThe accessory âARTâ uses an app you do not have installed. Would you like to get it from the App store?â  A search on Zeppâs web site turned up nothing and I ultimately chose to IGNORE the note and not get whatever App it was referring to. This hasnât caused any problems so far, but itâs a little disturbing to think that I may be missing something important.Step four is mounting the device to my golf glove. This works best with a tight fitting glove. One of my gloves was a little large around the wrist such that only the back part of the tab contacted the velcro on the glove - the Zepp consumed this small patch of velcro so the tab had nothing to stick to.At step five you launch the app and are immediately required to enter an email address to create an account. Thereâs no way around this account creation, yet none of Zeppâs documentation talks about needing an account or any features or benefits of having an account. Fortunately it doesnât require any verification of your email address, so you can probably get away with any random selection of characters that includes an @ and a dot. The sole purpose of asking seems to be for Zeipp to build an email list.This is where the web setup instructions end and you now follow the instructions within the App. First up is entering things like gender, height and handicap, and then it asks for details about your clubs. The App did not list my older TaylorMade R7 driver so I chose a different TaylorMade model. Iâm not sure how much this affects the analysis or if it would have been better to leave it as generic - again no help from the Zepp web site on this.Once I finally got the glove, the club and the app all set up, the Zepp sensor had turned off from lack of use. Unfortunately itâs not clear from the App (until youâve used it a while) that the sensor is off and it took a while to figure out why things werenât working. After finally turning the sensor on I again struggled to make it work until I figured out you have to hit the yellow icon to calibrate it first (by standing still at address for three seconds). Some step-by-step flow would be nice here so you donât have to guess what to do next.With all the problems solved I was finally able to capture some swing data, which is actually simple and automatic. Just take a swing and the iPhone beeps and draws a line showing your club head path. You can rotate the view to look at the swing path from front, back, side and above. It also gives you some specific swing data like the ratio of time spent in the back swing vs. the down swing, club speed, and something called club plane %.Unfortunately thatâs where the app ends.  Thereâs no specific advice, either in the app or on their web site, about how to use this data to improve your swing. All you really have is the comparison to âproâ swings to try to figure out how to improve your numbers.Overall it shows some interesting data and graphics, but the documentation is very poor and the app seems like it could offer a bit more analysis and instructions. It might work out well to use this app in coordination with a swing coach so youâll have someone who can tell you HOW to achieve better numbers, or if all those better numbers even apply to your swing.  At the cost of a couple of golf lessons I suppose this might be worth it for the avid golfer whoâs already familiar with their swing and wants to do some fine tuning. But if youâre not at that point yet, you may be better off putting the money towards some lessons and playing time.

I thought I'd try a big watch (finally) but didn't want to pay much for one. I chose this timex because I like the chronograph look and function, the brand is dependable and I wanted a white leather strap for summer. The dial looks very nice in person and the chronograph dials for day, date, and 24 hour are not just decorative. This is a nice feature for such an inexpensive watch. The strap is a padded leather that is a little stiff, but I hope will soften with use. The dial is very large, stylish and easy to read. That being said, I do find it a little cumbersome to wear. I have small wrists and after fastening it as far as it can go the watch falls down onto my hand which feels like its in the way. I haven't worn it much yet so maybe I'll get used to it.

I have been using Suki Naturals skin care products for many years and am still very happy with them. What I like about this moisturizer, and the other products from Suki, is the organic quality, lovely soft, rose scent and moisturizing effect. Suki has dedicated herself to making very organic skin and body care with a commitment to safe environmental practices. I like that the products, except shampoo and conditioner, are packaged in glass bottles instead of plastic containers. I appreciate the high percentage of organic ingredients as compared to other brands that label their products as organic but may in fact contain less than 50% organic ingredients. And because of Suki's organic and gentle ingredients in her products, I can use them on my very sensitive skin. I like using skin and body care that is so organic and actually works.

I use pigment ink pens frequently in my sketchbooks and illustrations, and there are two brands that I use the most often. I started with the Sakura Micron Pigma Ink pens and loved them. My husband bought me this set and I have been extremely happy with them too. In both pens, the ink is waterproof, very black, and archival quality. In fact both sets seem almost identical so it seems hard to choose which pen set to use. After much use of both brands, I have chosen Staedtler as my favorite. First I should note that when comparing the tip sizes of both brands, I found they were not the same. For example, the Sakura .05 is noticeably  larger than the Staedtler .05 tip, which doesn't make sense but that's what I noticed when comparing the two sets. That size difference is one reason I like Staedtler better. The fine tip of the .05 pen tip is more precise and that precision is necessary in some of my artwork. The tips of the Staedtler seem to hold up to extensive use better, and I just like the feel of these pens better. The Sakura have a slick finish and the Staedtler have a matte finish that I find is more comfortable to hold for a long period. The cons for buying the Staedtler is priceâthey are more expensive, and availability. The Sakura are easy to find just about anywhere art supplies are sold. If you don't use pigment ink pens very often and don't need precisely drawn lines, then the Sakuras might be just fine for you. But for fine art work, I have chosen the Staedtler as my favorite.

The author does a good job of building the characters and the setting and the story never bogged down. If you're familiar at all with Indianapolis you'll recognize many of the locations described in the book. I always looked forward to reading more of the book and was interested to find out what would happen next, which is no small thing. The fact that the main character and his family are muslim didn't overpower the story and added a unique perspective.On the down side, the story and the writing were clunky in a few places in ways that pulled me out of the book, and in the end not everything added up.  I felt like I was ahead of the detective most of the book and the motive behind the murders was not believable to me.  The magnitude of the honest mistake didn't seem to justify multiple murders to cover up.Even so, it was an interesting read - not at the top of my list but certainly not a disappointment.

This set and many of its pieces are customized for building the specific vehicles in the instructions. Many of the pieces are more decorative than useful. It's more like a model car kit with metal pieces than a set that you could use to build generic structures.  That's not necessarily a bad thing, just something to be aware of.Unfortunately we encountered problems from the very first step. The battery compartment is something you assemble like a clam shell from two different plastic pieces. Somehow I received two of the SAME piece which didn't fit together and I had to snip several bits of plastic off one piece to make it work and hold the batteries.In the process of building both vehicles, there were steps where pieces didn't fit together as shown and I had to move some pieces to make it work. I also had to add washers as spaces in the gear assemblies to make the gears mesh properly.Worst of all, the completed model performed horribly.  The motor supplied with the kit does not have enough horsepower to drive the wheels. If you turn the motor on while holding the car in the air the wheels spin very fast, but as soon as you put it on the floor the motor stalls and the car just sits there.We found it worked better on bare floor than carpet, but then we ran into another problem. The screws holding the front wheels onto the axel aren't quite long enough to allow the wheels to spin freely so one of the screws (depending on whether you're going forwards or backwards) always tightens as the wheel spins. So after about two feet of travel one of the wheels will seize up and again the motor stalls.Steering had it's own set of issues.  The structure provided no mechanism to hold the steering gear tightly against the rack so even after I fixed the wheel problem (with long screws and a lot of spacers) the car would always veer hard to the right.  I spent a fair amount of time trying to adjust the alignment and the steering mechanism without success.Needless to say I was extremely disappointed with this Erector set and would not recommend it.

I was really looking forward to reading this book. Charles Finchâs first book received so many good reviews and was an Agatha Award nominee, so I had high hopes for âAn Old Betrayal.â Finch is a good writer and reading this book was pleasant, with pleasant characters and a pleasant scene. Finchâs writing style is smooth, and as a bit of an Anglophile myself, I especially enjoyed reading about English social customs in the Victorian period, and the etymological insight into English words and phrases.This book may have been a nice, comfortable read but the mystery was a little lacking. Even with the slight surprise at the end, I still knew too many answers too soon. There are also quite a few unrealistic events and character interactions in this story, but that doesnât detract from this particular book because it lacks the grit and gore of modern crime fiction. Itâs obvious that your reading a gentle, Victorian crime novel and should be enjoyed as such. I did feel that the main characters had been fully developed with a familiar repartee between the two main characters, Charles Lenox and his former protÃ©gÃ©e, John Dallington.While âAn Old Betrayalâ lacks the substance and nuance of an Agatha Christie, Martha Grimes, P.D. James or Elizabeth George, it is still a nice novel for who like a British crime story mixed with insight into the British Parliament and Victorianna.
