I just didn't find the characters very sympathetic, despite the author's beautiful and perceptive writing about them, and kept losing interest in the novel because of this.With the exception of the art entrepreneur, who takes a long time to struggle out of a divorce and find the right career, all of the main characters are phenomenally successful at very young ages in the ferociously competitive music world.They are all very good looking. No one has many health or mental problems until the last third of the book. Everyone can afford to live in homes in very pricey Boston suburbs. They fly to Europe for lectures and concerts. Their professional careers proceed very smoothly.It was hard to care about them. Compared to the vast majority of creative people, they were already so lucky and blessed, I found their complaints -- one man can't finish a symphony he's writing; one woman can't conceive a child because of her husband's low sperm count; another woman is bruised by a bad divorce -- to be trivial, compared to the difficulties experienced by the vast majority of musicians and other creative people.They had no truly compelling life struggles that would draw me in to care about them. Frankly, they seemed rather spoiled and suffering from entitlement mentality.This is a good book to give any young people you know who are planning to become musicians, but you would want to warn them that the main characters in this book represent the top 1 percent of the profession -- the musicians who won the professional lottery.

This game is a variation of Twister. It uses Disney Junior characters, some different variables and a smaller board which makes it easy for kids to do. If you or your kids like Twister theyâll like this game even more. My daughter thinks itâs a blast and itâs nice to do something active and that doesnât involve a screen.

The LifeHammer is solid and has a nice feel to it. Itâs slightly longer and thinner than some hammers so you get a better grip. Thereâs a point on both sides and seems like better quality than similar products. I havenât had to use it but it certainly seems like itâd do the job.

This skimmer fits our handle perfectly and locks in and detaches easily. The mesh works great and so far itâs held up for one summer while being stored outdoors. Itâs priced right and Iâd buy it again.

This is so much easier and cleaner to use than those syringe bulbs. It holds a lot of water and it emits a high pressure stream that really gets in your ear. Itâs safe and easy to use and you WILL get results.

If you need a mirror that you canât break and will hardly notice when carrying it this is what youâre want. Itâs tiny, super lightweight, and sturdy. Itâs multi-purposed and everyone could use one.
Thereâs not much to this. Itâs a suction cup that holds your razor. Itâs stayed on the wall in my shower and it solidly holds my razor. Itâs exactly what I wanted and the price is right.
These are a perfect fit for my 5 year old daughter. You almost donât notice them but when you do they look good, especially for safety glasses. We use them for cycling in low-light conditions.

I donât golf enough to justify spending a lot on apparel and this shirt is perfect. Itâs soft, comfy, and airy. Itâs been great in the extremely hot and humid weather of SW Florida. It looks sharp too. Iâm 5â9â and 150 lbs. and the medium fits great although itâs a loose fit.

I wish I would have bought this sooner. Yes itâs a little over-priced but itâs worth it. Assembly is simple and itâs fairly solid although just to be careful Iweight down the base with a brick paver. I use this stand with my iPad when Iâm on my trainer and itâs secure and easily adjustable. Yes you can make your own holders but this is so much easier.

This rashguard holds up well although it will stretch a bit. I bought a white one a couple years ago and itâs too large now. The second time around I went with medium and at 5â9â and 152 pounds thatâs a much better fit. This rash guard is fine as a beach shirt or for casual swimming but itâs not for doing laps because of itâs semi- loose fit. It fits like a fitted t-shirt and it will drag you down if youâre trying to do any serious swimming. Also, loose rash guards look pretty silly when paired with a tight swimsuit. So if you want a rash guard for casual use then this is a great option but if youâre going to do laps I recommend the Quicksilver All Time rash guard because itâs very form fitting. I recommend any color except white because my first one was white and the collar and cuffs yellowed eventually.

My toddler thinks this is a fun toy and he was immediately attracted to it. He also easily got the hang of playing the different instruments although heâs still too young to blow the horns. It comes apart easily into various different musical instruments and when itâs all together you can push it around and it makes noise. My only complaints are that one of the ears come off too easily whereas the trunk is difficult to remove. Also, if there was ever a product in need of frustration free packaging itâs this one! Getting it out of the packaging is a hassle.

great price and does what it shouldThis surge protector does what it should and the price is right. It appears well made and functions correctly. Itâs solid and compact. It has some weight to it which helps it stay in place. The dust covers are a nice added feature. Iâd buy it again.

Putting this set together takes some skill. Itâs like an advanced Lego set of lesser quality with some very small pieces. Of course whatâs challenging to me and my five year old is really easy to other people. It just depends on your skill set. Nonetheless, the instructions are good and itâs a neat looking playset especially if you like SpongeBob and we LOVE Spongebob. The set was too much for me and my daughter but my wife got it together in a couple hours. Many of the pieces are tiny so if you have little ones be warned.

This dish soap smells so great that I ended up buying a Mrs. Meyers candle in the same scent. Itâs highly effective and itâs nice that you donât have to use much of it. For the price youâre getting a lot of quality.
Itâs long, well-constructed and the sound quality is good. I needed something really long and there arenât many Prime choices so fortunately this one worked out and the price is great.

I wanted a tiny brush to keep under my smoker to clean out the wood dust and this fits the bill nicely. Itâs very small so it can brush in the crevices and to protect it I can store it in a Ziplock under my smoker. For $5.55 it was well worth it.
This hooks looks great and it stays put. We use it to hold two bath sponges (or puffs or whatever theyâre called) and itâs never fallen off.

This is a fairly straightforward and simple hand puppet. The difference is that when you move the lips it talks. It doesnât have a lot of different phrases but itâs enough to get the attention of my toddler and make him smile. Of course as with most things, it doesnât hold his attention for very long but it makes for a nice distraction. I went with 4 stars instead of 5 because for the money thereâs not much to it.

This toy set is a lot of fun. You get 6 attractively painted and well made cars that are fun to play with on their own but the accessories add an additional element of enjoyment. You get a ramp that launches the trucks, vehicle attachments (helicopter blades and a glider), and a missile launcher with targets. The trucks are sturdy but Iâm not sure how long the rest of the parts will last. I could see some of them breaking and certainly getting lost. Both my 5 year old daughter and my 14 month son like this set and to be honest I have fun with it too. The truck launcher was a little sticky on the first day and it was hard to cock which frustrated for the kids but that problem went away quickly. Maybe it just needed to loosen up.

Everlast Nutrition Fuel is nutritionally similar to the product I normally use (First Endurance EFS grape flavor). However, Everlast comes in packets which are much smaller servings than the suggested dosage size of the EFS powder. Furthermore, compared to EFS, the price of Everlast is quite high but the individual serving packets are probably partially responsible for that. Everlast tastes like orange creamsicle, orange sherbet, and Tang. The taste is pretty strong and sweet even when mixed in a 22 ounce bottle. Itâs not a bad flavor but itâs a little too strong and sweet for me. I prefer my liquid nutrition to be weaker and less sweet. Also, the sweetness of Everlast tastes artificial. Everlast also left an orange stain around the inside top of my bottle. Staining hasnât been an issue with the other liquid nutrition products Iâve tried.

I like this modem because it has slightly improved range. I think itâs the third band that has the better reach. However, Iâm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because itâs difficult and frustrating to set up and a little overpriced. Iâm fairly proficient with this sort of thing and yet I was not able to get it to work with my cable modem by following the quick setup instructions. So then I had to reconnect my old modem so that I could get online and find some other instructions (oh the irony) that did work. I do think that once you get this product installed youâll like it but the instructions could be better and they should lower the price.

These are your basic garden stakes. Theyâre solid and hold up well. They serve a lot of purposes from propping up plants to posting signs. Iâve used these stakes for both these things and more. Theyâre great and exactly what I needed.

You spray this product on the water of the toilet before you go, it leaves an oily sheen and it (mostly) covers the smell. Itâs a good product to use at work or other public bathrooms. People will obviously still know what you did in there but theyâll be smelling vanilla mint  instead. However, be aware that the scent of this product is so strong that others may be just as bothered by the Poo-Pourri smell. As soon as you spray the product into the toilet the room is engulfed in the scent of the spray and it will linger for considerable time afterwards. This stuff is potent! Itâs basically just a really powerful and expensive air freshener thatâs oil based and goes on the water instead of into the air. The vanilla mint scent is pleasant but only if you donât mind a strong and unnatural smell. Iâve also tried the Rose Geranium scent and the Vanilla Mint is WAY better. The Rose Geranium smells like cheap perfume.

I often wear gloves when working on my bike. These gloves are thicker and more heavy duty than most disposable gloves making them almost tear-proof. Theyâre sturdy, comfortable, easy to work in, and easy to take off. Theyâre much nicer than the cheap, sweaty, latex gloves that Iâd been using. I highly recommend keeping a box of these in your garage. I also have the orange nitrile version of these gloves that Ammex makes and I like those even better because they have texture making them better for gripping. I have fairly small hands for a man and the size medium was perfect.

This is a compact toy that stores like a cube and then expands into numerous activities that keeps my 1 year old occupied for short stretches of time (like most things). What I like best is that it doesnât take up much space so I can store it on a shelf in my bathroom. This way I can hand it to him when I need to distract him while Iâm in there. It also makes a convenient toy for traveling.

This is an affordably priced pedal that I use for commuting and light recreational duty on my Electra Townie. Theyâre well-made and fairly heavy-duty although theyâre just as light if not lighter than my Shimano dual platforms. I prefer these pedals to the Shimanos because the clipless (platform) side grips a lot better. Itâs more of a platform mountain bike pedal style. Adjustment of the tension is easily done with an allen wrench. So far theyâve served me well and I havenât had any issues. For $50 I canât complain.

I know it's possible to get a good bag of Erin Baker granola because I've had one before. However, I have now received two bags in a row that are stale and taste like cardboard. The other bad bag was the Fruit and Nut flavor. Both stale bags have been within a month of the expiration date so that might have something to do with it. I'm guessing that they've been sitting in an Amazon warehouse for a long time and then being shipped in a cardboard box during really hot weather doesn't help. So the fault probably lies with Amazon and not Erin Baker. Regardless of the reason, the product I tried isn't good so I have to give it a low rating. I also won't be buying anymore granola from Amazon.

I'm a fan of Erin Baker's granola but I didn't care for this flavor. Although it hadnât passed its expiration date, it tasted stale and like cardboard. The texture and consistency was like that too, tough and chewy. I suppose I may have just received a bad bag or something but I wonât be buying the Fruit and Nut flavor again.

Iâve found that kinesio tape used during cycling helps alleviate some of my knee and neck pain. It adds support and somehow lessens the soreness in my problem areas. Because the tape is so expensive I use it sparingly, typically only for longer rides and only if Iâve been in recent pain. Iâve worn it on my knee during 60+ mile rides in the very hot and wet summer weather of SW Florida and it stays on. Normally I remove the tape after exercise and switch to a standard support band if needed. Iâve used Rock Tape, Kinesio Tex Classic, Spidertech and now KT Tape. They all work pretty much the same although the Kinesio Tex Classic had the worst staying power. KT Tape appears to have the best sticking power. But with all brands the effectiveness is relatively short lived (about 8 hours tops depending on amount of exercise, sweating, and showering). After that the supportiveness starts to break down and for maximum effectiveness itâs best to reapply fresh tape. I have also used the pre-cut version of KT Tape Pro and the advantage of the pre-cut tape is speed. You donât need scissors and if you need to apply the tape in hurry the pre-cut is obviously faster. Not having to worry about scissors is also nice for throwing some tape in your bag. The pre-cuts also come with rounded edges which stay on better and donât curl up as easily as the right-angled edges of the uncut tape. Of course you can make the edges of the uncut tape round by cutting it yourself but once again that adds time. The advantage of the uncut tape is flexibility of length and cost savings. And if youâre buying the uncut tape in large rolls such as this one, the cost savings is even larger. Also, there are times when you want a shorter or longer piece of tape than what the pre-cut provides. So which one should you buy? You pay a lot more for the pre-cut so youâll have to decide if the money is worth that. You also use more of the uncut tape because you arenât cutting exact lengths. I like having both. I keep a roll of regular tape for when I have time to cut my own which is most often and a roll of the pre-cut for when Iâm in a rush.

This is an interesting and unique toy. Itâs almost hard to describe. Itâs a stabilized arch that has a number of activities and functions for infants and toddlers. Mainly it plays music and flashes lights. Itâs also touch activated. My son, who isnât walking yet, likes to crawl up to it and stand and hold on to it while it lights up and plays music. He slaps on it and grooves. Is it worth $60? That Iâm not so sure about. I think there are better bang for your buck toys.
This product is pretty simple. Thereâs not much to it. Itâs attractive, made of soft fabric, and itâs easy to install. It looks nice on the crib and gives your baby some padding and protection.

My intention was to use these lids on standard bottled waters that I buy at Costco. However, theyâre too wide to fit on those bottles even though they are 10 and 16 ounce bottles. So Iâm not sure what type of bottle these lids would actually work on.

I love the concept of this product but itâs too big for my intended purposes. I wanted to carry it in my cycling jersey pocket on rides but itâs too wide to fit. The idea was that after the water was gone I could fold it and stow it neatly in the pocket. If they made one that was smaller and/or narrower itâd be great.

I much prefer the Eurostyle Chamois Buttâr to the regular version of Chamois Buttâr. In fact, I wonât buy the regular version anymore. The Eurostyle is greasier and has much better staying power. Thereâs also a hint of tingling sensation from the menthol but not too much. Iâve used it for rides up to 60 miles and itâs performed great. It lasted a long time and kept me friction free. I also like DZ Nuts but for the price I doubt you can beat Chamois Buttâr Eurostyle.

The Darth Vader part of this steering wheel cover is actually quite subtle. You hardly even notice it which is fine by me. I didnât necessarily want a Star Wars cover but this one fit my needs and hey Iâm a fan so why not. I wanted a cover that slips on, wasnât too expensive, and was available via Amazon Prime and this one was it. It slips on fairly easily but you will have to use some hand strength. Itâs nice and tight and a perfect fit on my Chevy Avalanche steering wheel. The texture feels good. It doesnât get hot or sticky and itâs being used in one of the hottest places in the country (Fort Myers, Florida) however it does add a lot of thickness. Overall, this cover checks all the boxes and Iâm very happy with my choice.

This product is a steal at $18. Similar products cost way more and this one works great. Itâs easy to set up, itâs solid, it blocks the sun, and the openness of it allows for ventilation and keeps it from blowing over.

The Wisk Deep Clean PowerBlasts has a great scent. Itâs a masculine piney scent but I donât think itâs so strong that women wouldnât want to use it. I like the convenience of the packs but I wouldnât use it all the time due to the price especially since I had to use two packs for some of the large or stinkier loads. I think itâs a nice product to have on hand for loads of athletic clothing. What I will probably do is buy the liquid version of this product so that I can use it all the time. Also, I was impressed that none of the packs were damaged during shipping.

I like the idea behind this stuff but I just canât get past the taste. It has a strong, earthy flavor that I find unpleasant. I tried it in a strawberry smoothie, which is the way I mostly use protein powder, and it was overpowering. I also tried a small amount in milk and had the same result. Too be fair, I did not try this product in anything besides the smoothies and milk so I canât attest to how it is when used in other ways. As much as I wanted to like this stuff I canât use it if I donât like the flavor so Iâll keep using my Jarrow Formulas Whey Protein.

Campbellâs chicken noodle soup has been a lifelong staple of mine and Iâm glad to see that theyâve made the move to organic although I wish the sodium content was lower and the taste was better. The Campbellâs organic soup has a slightly different taste than the non-organic Campbells. Different spices are more pronounced and it is more fragrant. The taste is good but I definitely prefer the regular.Also, I donât like the packaging. I prefer a can which I find easier to open (as long as you have a can opener).

If you are looking for the smallest and thinnest wallet possible and donât want to resort to a money clip this is what you want. Itâs a nice wallet but for my needs itâs too small. It doesnât hold much and it basically gets lost in my pocket so I returned it for the ALL-ETT Leather Original (thank you Amazon for free returns). The ALL-ETT original turned out to be perfect. Itâs also very thin and small but it holds a lot more and fills out your pocket better. I recommend going with that one.

Obviously for $25 these arenât going to be indestructible, high fidelity headphones but for my kids they do the trick. The sound quality is fine for the needs of a child. The built in volume buffer is a nice feature. They are lightweight, easily adjustable, inexpensive, and my children find them comfortable so it meets all my needs.

First and foremost, these chips are tasty. The flavor that comes through the most is salty which makes sense because they have 80mg of sodium per serving which isnât necessarily healthy but itâs on par with other chips. Theyâre not just salty though. You get a little bit of the bean and grain flavors too. They have a nice texture. Theyâre not too delicate and not too hard. The ingredient list is good, certainly better than most chips and theyâre especially good with guac but then again what isnât good with guac. I would buy them again.

This is a small, simple container that suctions with a cup and a plastic pad that makes it stick better. We use it in the shower to store our razors and itâs a very solid hold. The container is tapered and quite small so you canât really put much in there. Itâs enough to hold a few razors or a bunch of writing utensils.

My daughter hasnât met a Barbie doll that she doesnât like and this one continues that tradition. This Barbie Rock 'N Royals doll is pretty much like all the Barbie dolls just with a different theme. This particular doll is part of the Rock âN Royals and has a keyboard guitar.

My daughter hasnât met a Barbie doll that she doesnât like and this one continues that tradition. The Barbie Rock 'N Royals Singing Erika Doll is pretty much like all the Barbie dolls just with a different theme. This particular doll has a guitar and plays songs. The music is actually not horrible which is a bonus. Also, the dress spins around.

We use this track junction with our tracks and and the Fisher-Price Thomas The Train Take-n-Play Steamies vs. Diesels Engine Pack. Itâs a nice addition to our track set and itâs particularly appropriate at Christmas. The quality is good, itâs attractive, and well made.

Zesty is the word that springs to mind with this body wash. It has a strong citrus smell with a hint of floral/mango. The scent is almost suitable for man but I think itâs more on the feminine side and I wouldnât buy it for myself. Itâs perfect for my wife though. She finds the scent invigorating. The body wash is very soft, moisturizing, and lathers up nicely. The price is great too. Iâm a fan of Dove body washes and this one doesnât disappoint.

My one-year-old enjoys this toy although I think heâll like it even more when he gets a little bit older. Itâs recommended for ages 3+ so he canât fully utilize the playing potential of it. The trains are solid and fairly heavy and the magnetic connections are fun. We have the tracks that go with it which makes it even better.

Balance Bar Bites are remarkably similar to Captain Crunch cereal in both looks, taste, and texture. Fortunately they are not similar in ingredients. The Balance Bar Bites have good ingredients and nutritional value. Eating them is a little off-putting because you feel like you should put them in a bowl and pour milk over them. Nonetheless, you quickly get used to the strangeness. The taste is very good if you like peanut butter cereal balls. However, they are much more filling than cereal. Theyâre also portable and not messy. I donât see myself eating these often but theyâre a nice snack to have on occasion to mix in with my usual routine of on-bike nutrition that mainly consists of bars, soft chews, and gels.

My son enjoys playing with this toy and assembly was fast and simple. He loves dropping the balls down the chutes. Heâs too young to use the elevator properly but he does still manage to push on it now and then. As far as negatives to this toy and why I didnât give it 5 stars, one is that if you hold the elevator up too long the ball can get stuck underneath it and youâll have to extricate the ball which is a little bit tricky. Also, be aware that fingers can get stuck or pinched between the elevator floor and door. This can happen more easily when two children are playing with it at the same time. What happens is that one child pulls on the elevator string when the other child has their fingers in the opening. Fortunately, no real damage occurs if this happens. Lastly, I wish they would have included more than two balls because theyâre the sort of thing that gets lost easily.

My five-year-old has had a lot of fun with this. At first we put a house gecko in it that weâd caught. The geckos are a little more interesting that the standard brown anoles that we have everywhere around here. After a day we let him go and now we have a Betta fish in it but weâll soon be moving the fish into a proper bowl. The port, light, and magnifier are all nice features and the handle makes it easy to carry. My daughter is so far not interested in using it for bugs, frogs, or snakes but itâd be great for short-term storage and transport of  them too. There are a few negatives. For one, itâs quite small. Therefore, itâs only for temporary storage unless youâre using it for insects and even for insects I donât think youâd be able to create a permanent habitat. For almost all critters, you would only keep them in there for a day or two or use it for transport. I think the description is a little misleading in calling this a âhabitatâ. Itâs way too small for the creation of a proper habitat. Also, the port is too small to use for many critters and I wish the light used AAAâs instead of watch batteries.

I used the Competition Blend to smoke a chicken and a pork shoulder and the flavor was great. I got a clean and consistent burn out of them too. Iâve also used CookinPellets brand (Perfect Mix flavor) and thatâs also good but itâs about $3 more.

We are fans of the Boppy nursing pillow but this one is even better. Itâs more ergonomic and easier to get the baby comfortable and situated. It has a narrower fit which works in chairs with arms better. The Boppy is a great pillow in general but if youâre looking for one specifically for nursing and bottle feeding Iâd go with this one.

It appears that Nature Valley has followed the example of many other energy bars and come out with an all natural product that contains minimal ingredients. These bars are very similar to Kind bars. There are few ingredients and you recognize them. Itâs real food. The taste is good, nothing too sweet or salty. The texture is a little tough but nothing so bad that itâd put me off from eating these again. The texture comes in handy when I leave it in my jersey pocket and take a long ride on a hot day. The bars soften up without getting too soft. Although I like the flavor of Kind and other bars better, where Nature Valley Simple bars comes out ahead is in the price. Theyâre about 75 cents cheaper per bar than comparable bars.

These long-handled wrenches  are really helpful and the ball end is essential. Why even buy hex wrenches that arenât long-handled and ball ended? The wrenches are solid and the price is great for a set of 9. I find them essential for working on bicycles.

This is a simple, solid, well-constructed, and attractive spacer. Itâs always good to have spacers on hand for bike fitting. $7.51 is a bit pricey for one spacer but I suppose the shipping costs are built in. Also, be aware that the color is a dull or off-white color. Itâs not glossy white which is what Iâd hoped for. I should have called the toll free number that they helpful provide in the description for questions.

This diaper pail broke before weâd even put our first dirty diaper in it. It may have been damaged during shipping but I think what most likely happened is that when we were testing opening the lid I was perhaps slightly forceful when pushing the diaper-hatch-lid down and an approximately 5mm chip of plastic broke off the male piece of the locking mechanism. Unfortunately this tiny piece was important because afterwards the latch would no longer lock. Without the lock the lid stays completely and permanently open rendering the entire pail useless. Why would you make the pail almost entirely out of metal and then make a crucial component out of brittle plastic? As I said, I was maybe a little forceful when closing the lid but not so forceful that it should have broken. Being as delicate as this thing is, it would have for sure broken eventually regardless of how hard I pushed. And this shouldnât have happened in shipping either. It was well packaged. The only reason I didnât give this 1 star is that aesthetically itâs great. Itâs tall, sleek, and contemporary looking (as much as diaper pail really can be). It also has a large capacity and in theory it should be quite odor proof. However, what makes it odor-proof is a two step process that seems overly complicated for a diaper pail. When youâre hurriedly changing a messy diaper the last thing you want to bother with is two steps. You pretty much just want to drop a diaper in a can and close the lid which is where the old standby, the $25 Safety 1st Easy Saver Diaper Pail excels. Save yourself a lot of money and go with that one. Weâve used it for two kids and itâs been fine.

This is a simple, sturdy, compact, and easy to use planner thatâs based on the academic year.. It has month at a glance and week at a glance,. Thereâs a listing of holidays, a notes section, and a ribbon page marker. It has somewhat of a retro look to it and itâs all that I need in a planner.

This is a lightweight, attractive, comfortable and very well thought out pack thatâs perfect for short overnight trips. Itâs easy to adjust and lets you get a good fit dialed in. The back panel is well ventilated and stays off your back. In addition to the large main compartments thereâs some handy smaller ones too and they are all easy to access. The quick deploying rain cover is a nice feature and the pack has a lifetime warranty. Itâs pretty much everything you need to get started in camping.

I installed this in an older model Ford Taurus. We rarely drive this car with our daughters - it's the "work" car - but as they have been riding in it more, I was looking for a more secure option than the backless booster we had been using on occasion for our five year old. She uses a seat with a five point harness in our minivan, and I had not considered a higher quality booster as a replacement. The Monterey seems MUCH safer than other boosters I have seen, largely because of the LATCH connectors that allow the seat to remain tethered to the vehicle even when the seatbelt is unbuckled. It was easy to install; reading the instructions took longer than actually putting the seat in the car. I did not have to recline the seat, as it fit firmly against the seat back in the standard position. It is a "larger" seat; I can't imagine having someone sit in between this seat and the other toddler seat we use. However, it's a great middle ground between a harnessed car seat and a low profile booster. The headrest and seatbelt positioner will make me feel much better about my daughter's safety. She likes the retractable cup holders and the fact that it looks like a "big kid" seat. I did have to extend the headrest quite a bit, but she is a very tall five year old.

These shoes have a more athletic design and comfort level rather than the traditional golf shoe. The grip is also more of a turf shoe design rather than the removable spikes I normally use but that doesn't take away from the traction they provide. The one issue I see with them is while they claim to be moisture wicking they are not waterproof. Your socks will get wet if you are playing in wet conditions including damp mornings. But overall I very much like this shoe and they were a good value.

Given the option Iâd give this smoker 4 Â½ stars. I would deduct points for the poor instructions and the chipped paint. My smoker was not damaged in shipping except for a few blemishes on the paint on the front of the lid and I canât be sure the chips occurred in shipping. It almost looks like it came from the factory that way. The paint-chipping is an annoyance but nothing Iâd send this smoker back for or return to the store (if I had bought it from a store). Assembly was pretty straightforward in spite of some omissions in the instructions. The instructions also werenât very clear on how to start and operate the smoker. The instructions should have also had some better diagrams that pointed out ALL the parts. Some basic recipes and cooking instructions would have been nice too. Despite some initial frustrations in getting the smoker to smoke and the temperature dialed in I did manage to get things smoking and my first smoke turned out to be a very pleasant experience. I cooked a whole chicken and a pork loin in my first ever attempt at cooking by smoking. I used a hardwood mix of hickory, cherry, maple and apple pellets made by CookinPellets purchased from Amazon (40 lb. bag). I used water and apple juice in the steam pan, homemade rub on the pork loin, and a special chicken spice from Penzyâs. I have zero smoking experience and didnât even do much research prior to smoking this meat so I was shocked that the loin and chicken turned out so well. Iâd given myself about a 60% chance of things turning out but it was fantastic, my expectations were exceeded. The meat was tasty, moist, and tender. The pork loin had a beautiful smoke ring and the flavor really came through in the chicken. The only thing that didnât work out was that the chicken took much longer to smoke than the pork loin. I should have put the chicken on about an hour earlier so lesson learned. All in all Iâm really happy with this smoker and I think it makes smoking pretty easy. Yes you still have to monitor the smoker but youâre not totally tied to it. You can check on it like once every 45 minutes, maybe even longer. And to adjust the temp all you do is open or close the vent and adjust the temperature dial. The smoker feeds the wood automatically and you never really even need to open the lid. This smoker is big and heavy, especially when the hopper is full of pellets so I wouldnât say itâs very portable. Also, go ahead and buy at least a 20 lb. of pellets because youâll go through more of them than youâd expect. Lastly, brine your chicken (it makes a big difference), use a digital thermometer in your meat, and cook it to 5 degrees less than the recommended temperature because itâll continue to cook when you let the meat rest which you should do for about a Â½ hour.

The Clubman Pinaud Styptic Pencil is cheap and it works. Iâve tried others and this one is the best. I use it not only for shaving nicks but any sort of cut. You wet the pencil and dab it on the cut and it stops the bleeding. It even blends in pretty well. It doesnât sting and I appreciate the little storage tube that comes with it.

Sure these arenât the heaviest-duty and highest-quality tools out there but they do what they should and you get a whole set for $16. All the wrenches have worked correctly and they suit my light-duty home bicycle mechanic needs. I mainly use them to swap stems, adjust handlebars, install accessories, and adjust saddles. I finish everything off with a Ritchey torque key. The colored-handles are a nice touch as is the carrying stand. I appreciate that the stand is numbered but it would have been great to have the numbers on both sides. However, that was easily remedied with a Sharpie. I wish I would have bought this handy set a long time ago as this style of hex wrench saves time and reduces frustration. For the price to value, I give this product the highest rating.

This is a very well made GI. The stitching is excellent and the whole thing is very sturdy but still comfortable. Itâs slightly flashy but I like that. Also, the carrying bag is a nice extra.. Iâm 5â9â and 150 lbs. and thought the fit on the A2 was just right.

This is a very soft, plush and comfortable topper. The fit was perfect and Iâm definitely sleeping better on it. However, the one big problem is that it doesnât fit into our washer which is a large capacity washer. So be warned of that issue prior to purchasing.

This isnât a high end set but you get excellent value for the money. The clubs are very light and well built and itâs the perfect set to get your started in golf. My game has improved slightly since switching to these from my much older set. You get everything you need with this set  (and more possibly) and the bag that it comes with is top-notch. For the money itâs tough to beat.

I mostly use this handy little speaker during bath time for my kids. They enjoy having music during their baths and they also like to splash water all around. The speaker has gotten quite wet and itâs been fine. The sound quality is surprisingly loud good and I havenât have any connectivity issues. When itâs turned up you can feel the beats on it.

This printer took about 20 minutes to get set up and installed on my wireless network but it was easy as long as you follow the instructions. I love being able to print from my iPhone and laptop and the print quality was pretty decent. The scanning and copying features work well too. Itâs a simple, no-frills little printer. It probably wouldnât be good for very heavy use, but for someone like me who just needs an easy, quick option for printing the occasional picture or couple of pages, it is working great.
These balls have solid and uniform construction, produce a good roll and give me consistently longer drives.

This is a lightweight smooth hoodie, best for light weather (light wind, light rain, light cold). Having said that, everyone's tolerance to the elements is slightly different, so keep that in mind. This is also great for indoor use, be it at home or at the office or other places where the air conditioning may be too low for your liking. It also works well for layering.The two pockets give you flexibility to quickly free up your hands by tossing things inside, or keep them warm. To give you an estimate of the depth of the pocket, it's as if you fully extend your five fingers and put your open hand inside (give or take).One thing of note is that the zipper does not go up too high, so if you are outside with some wind or rain, you cannot bring it all the way up to your chin.It has three tags, two up top and one on the back, towards the bottom left side. From the tags we learn this is 60% cotton and 40% polyester and made in China. The washing instructions are Machine Wash Cold, Gentle Cycle, No Chlorine, Bleach if needed, Tumble Dry Low, Cool Iron If Needed.Gifting: the item is very visible when it arrives, so you have to gift wrap it on your own or have Amazon do it.One nice touch is that when opening, it uses a tiny little pin which you can reuse, instead of using throwaway plastic thingies.

With adult scifi on TV struggling, perhaps fresh ideas can surface from kids shows. And this is an entertaining animated scifi show for kids of all ages. They managed to fit in quite a lot of material in it without making it stuffy or boring. With a starship available, this opens all kinds of possibilities for future adventures and new worlds and storylines to develop. It even ended on a cliffhanger, so that's one more reason to start making Season 1 now!The only distracting thing graphics-wise for me were some of the angles of the pirate ship, but hey, this is not a blockbuster movie, so I'm just nitpicking.

With hundreds of sitcoms out there, one would think everything was done before. But not so. Highston has the unusual premise of the protagonist being able to see and interact with celebrities in his head, while obviously no one else around him can see or hear them. In an ever increasingly complicated world, we need comedies like this! All the characters that had screen time worked for this format.I found this pilot slightly better than Red Oaks, and Red Oaks got picked up for a full season. The combination of the premise and a rotating roster of celebrities make this almost guaranteed to get picked up for a full season. Deservedly so.I don't watch celebrity reality shows and frankly I don't really care about celebrities, but within the format of this show, having celebrities mixed in works real well.

The Burberry Weekend 3.3oz (100ml) arrives in a dark blue with golden accents shiny cardboardy box. Inside there is a cardboardy base to protect the bottle. It is ready to use out of the box. The spray is enclosed completely by the stylish (in a modest way) silver cap. The spray is not removable which ensures the fragrance does not evaporate slowly. The bottle is about four inches tall with a two inch radius at the bottom.This is the Eau de Toilette (EDT). As of review time, the first picture above for the 3.3oz option says "After Shave". That is the wrong picture. This is not an After Shave.Very few EDTs have names that actually match their smell and are not of the grandiose trending towards the obnoxious kind. This smell is very much a weekend. A relaxing and low stress weekend, evoking perhaps a scent memory of calm days on a cloudy spring day or the early autumn with a tapestry of mildly fragrant wet leaves on the ground.I sprayed this at multiple spots at different times to test for possible reactions but had no issue at all. I also tried using too much as a test, and again, no problems. There were no complaints of overpowering smell.

I think this is useful to have for special occasions, but it maybe overkill for everyday use. Maybe when you are expecting guests or you know that your earlier meal is known "offender". I tried eating a variety of foods to test it, but I was not willing to eat rotten eggs to test "extreme" cases :) It works very well, and for regular action, you don't have to use the 3-5 sprays, maybe 1-2 are enough.The Vanilla Mist type of smell is strong to overpower the target, but not annoying like some of those obnoxious fragrance sprays. The actual list of ingredients is not provided (trade secrets?) but the container says it is natural essential oils. The package has warnings to avoid contact with eyes, do not ingest, use in ventilated area (most bathrooms have windows or fans), and choking hazards. It says Made in USA and never tested on animals.The package is full of witty puns but it's also useful. That vertical toilet paper roll actually shows you how much of the mysterious liquid is left. The spray is nicely designed, solid spraying, no finnickiness. The cover goes on with an audible click.If you are one of the very important people who's output smells like roses (you know who you are!), your roses will blend really well with this vanilla mist aroma :)

Power protectors are important in case of power troubles, but many (myself included) rarely pay a lot of attention to them. How useful you find this 6-outlet Woods depends on your setup and needs. It has six ports that span just 7 inches. So if you have power bricks or other prongs that take up space, you may not be able to fit all that you need. The plugs go in sideways, not vertically, which means in practice you can only have one big power brick (if you give it the last spot).Each one of the six ports can be individually closed. The ground is not covered, only the two power holes. When powered and all is well, the Ground light is green and the Surge light is red. These small but bright lights are always on when it has power. The power button is on the side of the thick AC power cable coming in, and it has its own red light. When installing it, make sure the power button won't be in a situation where it can be accidentally turned on/off, because it protrudes a little from the side.In addition to power, it also has an RF Input and RF Output for cable or satellite. These are on the side, and out of the way if you don't need them. Other than this and the power button, this is a solid block type of a design. It is about 10 inches long, 2.5 inches deep, and about 1.25 inches tall. The power plug is right angled and rounded, which is nice, but it takes up space if you have stacked vertical outlets (it has to be the bottom one). The power cable is thick, and about four feet long.It is packaged in a cardboardy box, half of it is covered, half of it is not. It is easy to open with fingers. Inside you have the instructions in english and spanish (tiny print on an A4 type of a page, one side per language).Since Amazon has multiple different units sharing the same Amazon page, I'm posting some of the specs from the box to make sure you are reading the right specs. It is marked for "Multimedia" use, indoors only, no aquariums (does not explain why not). It has max surge voltage 6000V, max spike current 60000A, response time under 1ns, EMI/RFI noise filtration < 40 dB, 100kHz -100MHz. The max connected load is 1800W. It is marked 1000 Joules and offers up to $150,000 warranty of sorts.

The Jack Links Original Chicken strips arrives in an 8x4x4 inch colorful cardboardy package (rounded measurements). Inside you will find 12 individually sealed 0.8oz packets. Each packet is roughly 8.25 x 2.25 inches. You peel it open up top (it has "peel open" arrows) and opens very easily. The food item itself is roughly 6.5 x 1.25 inches.Overall, I liked their taste. The scoreboard says so: I ate four of them the day they arrived. Granted, this was partly for testing purposes, so if there were any issues with them, I would notice. But the main reason I ate 4 on day #1 and another 4 on day #2 is because I liked them.The flavor reminded me of veggie BBQ faux-ribs (either Morningstar or Trader Joe, I can't find them anymore), but as if the patties were pressed down to a link. But it still has meat texture, it gets stuck in the teeth in similar fashion as chicken (since I don't have a CSI Lab, that's as close as I can get to verifying the presence of chicken in this).It is sweet and spicy, at just the right levels of sweet and spicy for my taste. Some may find it too sweet, some may find it too spicy or not spicy enough. I can only taste it as me :) It is easy to eat, there is some chewing and resistance but you don't have to "fight it" like dry beef jerky.The ingredients are posted on both the outer package and on the individually sealed meat sticks, but the nutritional info is only posted on the outer package: 70 calories, 6g protein, 6g carbs (5g sugars), 25mg cholesterol (8% RDA), 1g fat, 240mg sodium (10% RDA) and 2% iron and Vitamin C per strip.The main ingredients, in the order they appear on the box are chicken  (shocker, I know), brown sugar, sugar and apple sauce. The rest of the ingredients are under 2% and it includes chicken broth, oat flour, and fructose among many others.The box says "Packaged in the USA" and it is made from 100% recycled paper fiber.

This pair of headphones grew on me. After a month of daily use, I found this to be a good choice as a bluetooth with NFC headphone that you can take with you, it is comfortable to wear for a long time (does not clamp, which means it may fall off easier, so maybe not for sports or head bobbing activities), and can also play music using a standard 3.5mm cable without power. As with many portable headphones, this is best suited for non-quiet places on the go, and not a good match if you are listening to audiophile classical music or for studio work or music practice.General- bluetooth can be very practical and convenient but if you don't need bluetooth, as a general rule of thumb, for the same money, you can get a better wired non-bluetooth headphone- sound is slightly different on bluetooth vs audio input- can play music from a standard 3.5mm audio cable even if the battery is out of juice- I did not find anything objectionable to the sound signature while listening to various modern music genres (I rarely listen to classical/jazz)- however, I did not like the sound when connected to a Casio music keyboard (I prefer a bigger around the ear headphones for that)- good isolation for its size (blocking outside sounds) but it does not silence the outside world- if you are not listening to quiet music, it covers up most of the outside sounds- very little leakage (others able to hear your music) in non-quiet places (eg coffee shops)- the earcups fold flat which is nice for transportation- the headphones do not fold- I carried them around in a soft bag in backpacks and bags for about a month and they are fine (making sure I put them in safe/padded parts of the bags)Cable Matters- has removable flat cable with one button and a volume slider (not volume buttons)- volume slider works with all devices, not just smartphones and tablets- volume slider handy for quickly muting- caution however not to bump volume slider higher if already listening at high volume from music source- the button works as play/pause and depending on device/app combo, as next and previous track (double and triple click)- the shirt clip can cause cable tangles, so if you don't need it, it is removable- can play audio via 3.5mm while charging via microUSB- putting a 3.5mm cable in it, automatically turns off the bluetooth connection- cannot play both 3.5mm audio and bluetooth at the same time (one or the other)- works with random 1/4" adapters (not included)Battery and Power- on bluetooth, at low battery, there is an annoying loud beep every minute (every 60 seconds)- the loudness of the beep depends on the headphones volume- as a workaround, lower the headphone volume, and increase the volume of your source device- at this low volume settings, I got around 40 minutes of power before it shut off, with 40 lovely beeps :)- battery power and charging time (via microUSB) were about as expected (I didn't measure them, but they did not surprise me either way)Turning it ON/OFF- a bit goofy- first you turn the power slider on the right earcup (ON or OFF positions, hard to read without enough light)- then you press the play/connect button on the left earcup- 4 seconds puts it in connection mode (blinking blue light)- 6 seconds puts it in pairing mode (party lights - blinking blue and red)- even while in pairing mode, it can detect previously connected to devices, and connect to them without re-pairing- when the bluetooth connection is disconnected from phone/tablet, you can either turn off the power (right earcup) or let it blink for about 10 minutes, and turns off on its own- if you let it turn off on its own, you can reconnect later by just pressing the play/connect button for 4 seconds (without also having to turn on the power on the right earcup)- I don't know if this significantly affects battery life, but if you find two buttons turn-on annoying, you have a choiceBluetooth related- connected and worked fine with Android 5.x (Nexus and OEM), 4.4 (Galaxy, Moto), iPod Touch, Windows 8.1 laptop, and Lumia Windows Phone- also worked with a bluetooth keyboard also connected and used by the tablet (no interference)- pairing and connections were generally fine (there was only one corner in one coffee shop that have playback hickups)- as long devices are not fighting over it (eg two previously paired smartphones with bluetooth turned on), it connects smoothly- bluetooth audio continues to play music while charging but there is a constant hum (that's when those super long USB charging cables come in handy)- when you reach the Maximum volume, there is an annoying loud beep (very stupid)- when you reach the Minimum volume, there is a low volume non-annoying double beep- the buttons on the headphones only work with a bluetooth connection (they do not work when playing music through the cable)- remembers multiple previously connected device (I didn't count)NFC related- NFC pairing worked successfully every time- the NFC area is the outside of the left earcup- NFC cannot "steal" an active/live Bluetooth connection with another device- NFC connected while the phone was in a solid plastic case (I don't have any thick cases to test those)In The Box- the headphones- the audio cable- the microUSB charging cable- instructions in many languages but very small font and very small diagrams- nothing else is included (no case/bag, no 1/4" adapter)- has material smell out of the box when you stick your nose to the earpads but it goes away quickly- lots of protective tape on the headphones

This is a promising new scifi TV series, taking place in space, in a different world. Two former Stargate writers have created this project (first as a comic book), and you can see some Stargate elements in the show, and some former Stargate actors make guest appearances, but it's not a Stargate-type of a show.The idea is clever, it has multiple undercurrents of mystery to hook you through and make you keep watching. This is in space, a rarity these days among TV shows. The characters are mostly interesting, the actors are doing a decent job, and overall, given the budget, this is a very watchable show, and has the potential to get a lot better in season 2.This is not a high budget show, so you can't expect an HBO level production. But with only 13 episodes, the stories are more focused and they don't have to resort to clip-shows to make the budget work.Because of the various mysteries and twists, if you are interested in watching it, make sure you avoid spoilers if you can. It will make it more fun. There are multiple revelations throughout the series.

After about 2.5 months of daily use, this strange-looking keyboard turned out better than I expected. It is still not a perfect keyboard, but despite the funky shape and monster size, it is comfy on the wrists, and if your hands are properly aligned for touch-typing, you can do quite well touch-typing. It is a bit unforgiving if you misalign your hands for touch-typing purposes. The typing angle is pretty good, even though your hands are going a bit downhill.One pitfall for first time users, the F-Lock button (on the right of the F12) toggles the function keys between their standard functions and different functions assigned by Microsoft. If for example the F3 or F5 are not behaving as expected, just press the F-Lock and all will be well again. I found out the hard way :)There are many extra buttons, and there is customization and Microsoft software/firmware to install and tweak if you wish. The most unusual placements (but can be handy) are left/right arrows below the space-bar, a zoom button above the space bar, and a dedicated calculator button above Scroll Lock. Of the extra keys, these are the ones I have been using the most .Keypad, arrow keys, Home/End, Ctrl/Shift/Alt are all working well and have not caused me frustration.It arrives in a monster red Microsoft box, it is a big keyboard after all. It has two feet on the front that can tucked away if not needed. This is a USB-powered keyboard, no power needed. At its longest, it is around 20 x 11 inches, and at its tallest it is about 2.5 inches tall (with the feet up).
